This entrepreneur is a fresh young 20-year-old bachelor. He graduated from intermediate school. 

The purpose of this loan is to develop his grocery store. He has a few employees and hopes to hire more employees to help him in the future. He has been working in this field since his was very young and recently has been able to build his own shop. 

His personal income will increase bit by bit and he hopes to marry when his income is high enough that he can support a happy family. He has a lot of customers, although he is in the blossom of his age. He also has a good reputation in his neighborhood. We foresee him to be a dependable customer in the future.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and freezer for his grocery store

loans.name: Cruz Emerita

texts.es:
La lic Cruz Emerita V. P. e s trabajadora de la escuela normal Mirna Mairena de Esteli desempeñándose como maestra desde hace aproximadamente 19 años.
Cruz Emerita va usar el crédito para complementar la compra de un solar en Esteli. Ella espera que la compra del solar construir una vivienda para su hijo mayor.
Cruz Emerita es casada y tiene 3 hijo dos de ellos varones y solo uno a su cargo ya que los otros son profesionales ella vive con su esposo y su tres hijo.
Este es su segundo crédito con Ceprodel  Cruz dice que con el crédito anterior fue de gran ayuda para solventar gasto de su hijo que estaban en la universidad
texts.en:
Ms Cruz Emerita V. P. has been working as a teacher in the Mirna Mairna de Esteli school for about 19 years. Cruz Emerita will use the loan to help with the purchase of a piece of land in Esteli. She is waiting for the purchase to be able to build a home for her oldest son. She is married and has 3 children, 2 of whom are boys, but only one who is still dependent on her. The others are professionals. She lives with her husband and her sons and daughter. This is her second loan with Ceprodel. Cruz says that the previous loan was a big help in taking care of the expenses of her son who was at the University.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To help buying a piece of land

loans.name: Jaydee

texts.en:
Jaydee O. is a 28-year-old mother of two. Both children are grade school students. She is a native of Talim Island in the town of Binangonan, which is located in the Rizal Province in the Philippines. She is happily living with her two children and her 32-year-old husband Darwin O., who is a fisherman and bamboo set maker (furniture). 

She dreams of escaping the spiral of poverty. She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2009 with the hope of having access to capital to start a business. She and her husband used to be partners in their bamboo set making business. Since then her business has continued to grow and provide good income for her family but income from the business is not enough to sustain their everyday needs. Therefore, she now requests her second loan in the amount of 10,000 pesos to use as working capital to start a fish cage business for supplementary income. The loan will be used to pay for 20 bundles of fishnet, bamboo, and labor expenses.

She is looking forward to an increased demand for fish on the island so her secondary business will grow and generate enough income for her family. She dreams of sending her children to school until they finish college and to find stable living.

loans.use: To start a fish cage business

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina M. is a 45-year-old mother of two. One child is a 26-year-old undergraduate college student and the other one is a 16-year-old college student. She is married to a driver and bamboo set maker who works very hard to give the best for his wife and their children. They make and sell bamboo set (furniture).

Rosalinda applied for a new loan of PHP 10,000 to continue finance the bamboo set making business. Specifically, the money will be used to pay for bamboo, bamboo strips, nails and other supplies for her business. She hopes that through her loan, she and her husband can save money and get a stall in the nearby town market to display and sell their bamboo set (furniture).

She wants to help support her children's education and build a better house for the family. She believes that through the help and support of ASHI and KIVA, she has a big chance to improve the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To pay for bamboo, bamboo strips, nails and other supplies.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol P. is the 24-year-old mother of two kids. Her husband, Alvin Pascual, is a bamboo set maker. When she got married, she started a bamboo set making business. Their income is not enough to support the needs of their growing kids. Marisol joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.) in 2009 to get capital to start a secondary fishing business. Now, she applied for a second loan to buy fishing materials like fishnet, bamboo and other materials for her business. 

Marisol dreams of expanding her fish cage in the future to raise more fish. She also wants to save money from her bamboo set business to meet their daily needs. She hopes that someday, through her loans from ASHI in partnership with Kiva, she will be able to discover skills to engage in a more productive business. She dreams to get out of the ties of poverty. That is one challenge in their lives.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials like fishnet, bamboo and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
In 2001, Raul D., 46, started to sell goods in his village. He has a sari-sari (variety) store. Aside from selling goods, he also a small poultry operation and a small piggery. He is married and has two children. His eldest child is 8 years old and currently an elementary pupil. 

He would like to grow his business. He hopes to receive a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos with Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner. He will use the loan to buy additional merchandise to resell.

loans.use: To obtain additional merchandise to resell

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl P. is 25 years old and engaged in the fish-selling business. Her parents are fishermen and she married a fisherman as well. She has two children and desires to give them a brighter future. Her wish is to send her children to college so that when they get older they will be able to land better employment. 

She now needs additional capital to run her fish-selling business. If ever she gets a loan at CEVI, she will buy more fish to resell to augment her sales and profit.

loans.use: To obtain fish to resell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia S. is 40 years old and engaged in the fish-selling business. Her husband is a fisherman and she helps with catching fish when she is not busy in their home. She has nine children and desires to establish a bigger fish stall in the town market of Talibon. Now she sells fish to her neighbors and the income she makes from trading fish helps a lot in paying for daily expenses. 

She would like to increase her sales, which is why she would like to apply for a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to buy more fish to resell.

loans.use: Obtain more fish to resell

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en: Alejandra B., 51, is a fish vendor. She works every day to sell her fish in their village. Sometimes she sells it door-to-door so as to save time. She earns an income by doing this business and she uses her earnings to buy the basic needs of her family. Aside from fish she plants seaweed. She would like to apply for a loan of PHP 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy more fish to resell and seaweed seedlings as well.

loans.use: Obtain more fish to resell and buy seaweed plants.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita V., 46, is engaged in the business of fish selling. She started her business in 1995. She has been doing the same thing since then because the income she makes from fish really helps her family buy food, clothing and other basic needs. She would like to apply for a new loan of PHP 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy fishing materials for her husband to use, and fish to resell in the market. In that way, she believes, she could be able to augment their income and support her children all the more.

loans.use: Obtain fish to resell and buy fishing equipment for her husband.

loans.name: Cornellio

texts.en: Cornelio A., 36, is a sari-sari (variety store) storeowner and fish vendor in Talibon Bohol. He has eight children.  He started his business in 1990 and he is still pursuing the same business because it helps him buy the daily needs of his family. He wants to augment his income and he would like to apply for a loan of PHP 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy fish and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.use: Obtain fish to resell and buy additional merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.en:
Leonidas M. is 39 years old. She owns and manages a small sari-sari (variety) store in Talibon, Bohol. She has seven children. She started selling goods in 2008. She is still pursuing her career in the sari-sari store business because it helps her family a lot with paying for the daily costs in their home. 

She would like to ask for a loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner. She will use the loan for buying additional merchandise. In that way, it will be easy for her to offer her customers a wider selections with greater variety.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to resell

loans.name: Abdull Monir Group

texts.en:
Zahira , who is the leader of Abdull Monir group, is 47 years old. She is married, having 4 children and lives in Kabul, Afghanistan.
she is a tailor and has been involved in this business since 1999. She has much experince in this business and can sew different kinds of clothes.
She needs this loan to buy a new machine with the other needed materials of her business.
She hopes that if her business grows she will be able to suport her childern and can have a small tailoring shop as well.

loans.use: purchasing a machine and materials

loans.name: Ghulam Dastageer

texts.en:
Ghulam Dastageer son of M. S. is much experienced, though he is uneducated. He works in repairing parts of cars and has been involved in this business for more than eight years. He lives with all of the eight members of his family. 

Lately he has had some business problems in not having a complete set of tools. He would love to progress, so he wants to buy a new cutter machine for his shop, and for that purpose he needs extra money. Therefore, he requested an individual loan of 42,000 AFN to buy a new cutter machine.

He is grateful for this loan process. He wants to say that it is his second cycle loan and it is really great. He wants to continue his partnership and encourages other workers to use this loan service.

loans.use: to buy a new cutter machine for his shop

loans.name: Adela

texts.en: Adela S. is 60 years old. She is a food vendor and, at the same time, sells fish in their village. She started her business in 2007 and desires to augment her income by increasing the size of her sales. Her husband is a fisherman. Both of them work together for their family. She would like to ask for a loan of PHP 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy more fish to resell.

loans.use: To obtain fish to resell

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Before the loan, Leonora R. worried how she was going to support her children. Now, she doesn’t worry anymore because CEVI is providing her loan in her “buy and sell” business. Leonora sells firewood in their village. She sold it by bundles and the income, which she gained from her business, was really helpful in paying the school and basic expenses in their home. She hopes to receive a loan of PHP 9,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She chooses CEVI because they are not just providing loans but they provide training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy firewood to resell

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en: Bonifacio G., 36 years old, is a sari-sari storeowner. He desires to have a bigger store someday so that he will be able to offer his customers more selections and augment his income as well to buy the needs of his family. He started his business in September of 2009. Now, he is still selling a variety of goods because he thinks that he has a better future in this business. He would like to apply for a loan of PHP 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan buy additional merchandise to resell.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to resell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma C. is engaged in a fish-selling business. She said that she wants her business to be prosperous to help her parents and siblings pay the daily expenses in their home. She is unmarried and still hoping to have a family someday. She would like to receive a loan of 10,000 PHP from the Kiva field partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc., to help her fish-selling business. She likes the program of CEVI because she received not just loans but insurance coverage and training as well.

loans.use: Obtain fish to resell

loans.name: Parima Group

texts.en:
Asifa is the group leader of Parima group.She is married and she lives in a family of three members.She, her husband and her son. She lives in Kabul Aghanistan. She wants to take this loan for her son. He has a general store and he is involved in this business for more then three years.Although, his business has been steady the demands of the market has expanded. Also, he is determined to support his father and her mother Asifa who is a hard working woman.Her son needs this loan to purchase more stock for his shop.
She hopes that her son will grow his business through this loan and stand on his feet. 
Asifa is thankful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing stocks

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita A. is 59 years old and a good mother to her three children, all of whom are at legal age. She is married to her compassionate spouse, Feliciano A. Sr., a fisherman and a bamboo set maker. They currently live at a coastal place, Talim Island, Binangonan, Rizal. She has been engaged in her fishing business for more than ten years and also gets involved in bamboo set making as another source of household income.

She plans to utilize this loan of 10,000 PHP to expand her fishing business and to continue to be involved in other businesses for supplementary profits. This loan will be used to buy secondhand fish cages, bamboo and fingerlings (small fish). She believes that her business will help her family to rise up and fight against poverty.

During her one year as a member of ASHI, Pacita has shown very good performance with her group mates and at the center. Having this loan will enable her to finally achieve her dreams in life: to have a successful business, a better life and a happy family as well. She is very thankful to ASHI and KIVA services for the continued support of her dreams.

loans.use: To pay for secondhand fish cages, bamboo and fingerlings (small fish).

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie A. is a 34-year-old mother who is focused on her family’s dream. She lives in the Coastal Place of Talim Island, Binangonan, Rizal, Philippines with her loving husband and two kids. The couple works hard to provide a better education for their children's future and they want a better life as well.

They decided to join the Kiva field partner, ASHI, in 2009 to get capital for their fishing business. They have requested a loan of 10,000 PHP. They will invest this capital to reconstruct fish cages and to buy more fishnets, bamboo and fingerlings (small fish). Winnie also has a secondary source of household income, which is hog fattening (raising pigs).

She hopes to build their own beautiful house, expand her fishing business and to have a larger space for their fishing equipment. She also dreams of a successful pig farm business. 

The family feels very happy with the loan that helped their lives to become improved from before. Winnie will continue praying and wishing all lenders the best of luck, and she hopes they will continue to support poor families like them, who want to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To recontruct fish cages, buy more fishnets, bamboo and fingerlings(small fish).

loans.name: Charis

texts.en:
Charis C. is 28 years old. She is married to 40-year-old Edwin C., who is a fisherman and bamboo set maker. The age gap is not a hindrance to their love or to their fighting the challenges of poverty in their life. She and her husband hope to have children in the future. The partners are both strong and full of courage to elevate themselves out of poverty. They live in the Coastal place of Talim Island, Rizal Province in the Philippines.

In 2009, they got the idea of joining ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), which means ”To rise up from poverty”, an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines. She was given hope and the opportunity to acquire working capital, so she now runs her fishing business. The business has brought them good profits. Currently, on her second loan, she proposes the amount of 10,000 PHP as additional capital to pay for two sets of "Baklad" (fishing materials made of fishnet for creating fish pens), which cost 5,000 PHP each.

Charis has simple dreams in life. She would like to have a durable, concrete house for themselves and for her future children. She also dreams of expanding the fishing business. With the service offered by ASHI, she believes that her dreams will come true. The couple is thankful that there is ASHI service in their village.

loans.use: to buy materials for making "baklad" (fish pens).

loans.name: Swannie

texts.en:
Swannie A. is a 27-year-old mother who cares for her four children. She is married to Ferdinand, who is a carpenter. To help her husband support the family, she started a business of making and selling doormats. 

With dreams of getting away from poverty, she came up with the idea in 2008 of joining the Kiva field partner in the Philippines, ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap Inc.), which means “To Rise Up from Poverty”. Since her membership in the institution she had shown good performance in her credit rating (basis of loans), allowing her to get more capital for her business.

Now on her third loan, she applied for 15,000 PHP to buy an assortment of raw materials for her business, such as cotton, flannel, and other supplies.

In the future, Swannie hopes to establish a shop where she can fulfill orders. She also wants to be able to save for her children's education and to have a comfortable house for living in with a happy family.

NOTE: Please disregard the date appearing on the picture. The camera internal date was not set on the right date.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie C. is a woman full of determination to rise above poverty. She is 56 years old and still fighting the challenge of poverty in her family. She is married and the mother of two children, both of legal age and with their own families. She lives in Antipolo, Rizal province, in the Philippines.

In 2008, she decided to join Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, hoping to obtain working capital for her sari-sari store (general store). During her membership in ASHI, her performance has been noted well in repayment and in attendance in center meetings. Her business is still growing, so she is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to pay for assorted groceries for the store.

With the chance offered to her by ASHI, she believes that she is getting closer to the achievement of her dreams. She wants to help her grandchildren with their school fees and also to save for their future living, because she and her husband are getting old. 

NOTE: Please disregard the date appearing on the photo. The camera internal date was not set on the correct date.

loans.use: To pay for assorted groceries for the store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
A 36-year-old, Josephine S. is a woman with the determination and faith needed to get out from the ties of poverty. She is the mother of five dependent children, all of whom need her support. She is married to Orlando Soriano, who is 37 years old and a mechanic, but his income is not enough for their daily needs. That is why Josephine has the initiative to engage in selling small goods to help her husband in supporting and raising their big family.

In 2008, as a mother of big dreams, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), which means ”To rise up from poverty”, an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines. Since her membership, she opened a general store and it truly helps them to meet their needs.

Now on her third loan, she is requesting the amount of 15,000 PHP to pay for two sacks of sugar, liquor, five sacks of rice, two sacks of charcoal, two containers of cooking oil and other groceries for her store.

She hopes that, with the help of ASHI and KIVA, she can have a successful mini-grocery in the future in order to pay for the needs of her children until they finish school with a degree. Her greatest dream is to reach her aspiration of stepping out from poverty.

NOTE: Please disregard the date appearing on the picture. The camera internal date was not set on the right date.

loans.use: To pay for groceries for her store.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is an educated young man who lives in Beit Hanoun, in Gaza/Palestine. His village is located in an Ottoman area near the Israeli borders. Beit Hanoun is known for beautiful citrus and almond trees, as well as for raising cattle and goats. Ahmad is only 20 years old, but very well experienced in raising his livestock. He lives with his family and is ambitious to finish his education. He requested a loan of $3000 to expand his business by buying sheep and feed and eventually a bigger hut. Ahmad is unique in his integrity and high ambitions, and there is no doubt he will succeed in his project.

loans.use: To buy sheep, expand his hut and increase production

loans.name: Anta

texts.fr: Madame Anta K. est une femme mariée de 52 ans, sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC de Baye Laye depuis Aout 2009.Elle  habite dans la localité de Homo 6 , une cite environnante de la zone de Guediawaye. Elle a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit déjà rembourse au sein de l’IMCEC.C’est un véritable soutien de famille car elle est mère de 7 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 12 et 25 ans. Madame K. a une expérience de plus de 20 ans dans le commerce de fleurs, de tissus, de drap et de friperie. Elle fréquente la  foire de Dakar et les grands marches. Elle est née dans une grande famille de commerçantes. Et à cet effet elle a été orientée dans cette activité par une de ses tantes qui voyageait sur la Turquie et  qui lui a appris le commerce de fleurs en premier lieu. Les moments les plus favorables  pour son commerce sont les périodes d’événements  de Tabaski, de korite et de fin d’année. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs pour renforcer son stock de marchandise. L’achat se fera par l’intermédiaire de fille qui va à Doubaï. Mais son plus grand rêve est d’envisager dans le futur un voyage pour son propre compte..Grace aux crédits empruntes elle parvient à renforcer ses stocks et a diversifier ses produits. Par conséquent l’amélioration de sa marge bénéficiaire l’aide a constituer une épargne personnelle et  a penser a des projets futurs. Avant tout c’est une source de satisfaction des besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Ms. Anta K. is a 52-year-old married woman who has been a member of the U-IMCEC branch of Baye Laye since August 2009.  She lives in the town of Homo 6, a place encompassing the area of Guediawaye.  She has already benefited from a loan already repaid within IMCEC.  She is practically the family's breadwinner, since she is the mother of seven children, whose ages range from 12 to 25 years.  Ms. K. has over twenty years of experience in the commerce of flowers, fabrics, bed sheets, and second-hand clothing.  She goes to the Dakar fair and to the big markets.  She was born into a large family of merchants.  And because of this, she was familiarized with this work by one of her aunts, who used to travel to Turkey and who taught her commerce in flowers in the first place.  The best times for her business are during the events surrounding Tabaski, Korite, and New Year's Day.  Ms. K. is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs for bolstering her stock of merchandise.  Her supplies will be purchased through brokers who go to Dubai.   But her greatest dream is to do the traveling herself in the future.  Thanks to the loans taken out, she is able to boost her inventory and to diversify her products. Improving her profit margin helps her as a result to build up some personal savings and to think about future projects.  Above all, it's a way of meeting family needs. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her working capital

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: Madame Maguette D. est une femme de 46 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 4 et 21 ans. Elle est soutien de famille car elle a aussi 2 personnes en charge .Son activité de départ était la vente de tissus et de parfums ceci depuis 1999.Mais actuellement elle est orientée exclusivement vers la vente de foin et d’aliment de bétail. Son choix d’activité s’est porte sur le commerce car elle n’a pas su réussir dans les études. Elle a aussi une expérience dans la couture car elle a même obtenu son diplôme en broderie. Mais néanmoins sa passion est portée sur le commerce qu’elle exerce. Ses moments d’entrées de fond sont les périodes qui l’intéressent le plus dans son activité. Et grâce a son dynamisme et son ambition elle est parvenue à se procurer un terrain grâce a son commerce. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs. L’objet de ce prêt sera d’acheter du mil de l’arachide et des poissons fumes afin de renforcer et de diversifier ses activités. Son grand rêve est de voyager sur Doubaï. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de satisfaire ses besoins personnels et d’ assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maguette D. is a 46-year-old woman, married and mother of six children, whose ages vary between 4 and 21 years. She is seen as family support, since she cares for two other persons. In 1999, she started in business by selling fabrics and perfume. Currently she has chosen a different orientation: selling exclusively hay and cattle feed. She chose to develop commercial activities as she was not successful in school. She has also some experience as a seamstress, and even obtained a diploma in embroidery. However, her passion remains centred on her current business. What interests her most is when earnings are realised. Thanks to the dynamism and ambition she demonstrates in her business, she was able to acquire a parcel of land. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs. The loan will be used to buy mil, peanuts, and smoked fish, to reinforce and diversify her activities. Her great dream is to travel to Dubaï. Her earnings currently satisfy her personal needs and ensure her children’s education.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen working capital

loans.name: Soda

texts.fr: Madame Soda D. habite  Daroukhane dans la localité de Guediawaye. Elle a 49 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 12 et 31 ans. Elle est membre de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis juillet 2006 et a déjà rembourse deux prêts. Cela fait plus de dix ans  qu’elle s’active dans le petit commerce de vente de pain , de beignet et de café  le matin. C’est surtout la rentabilité qui la pousse a choisir cette activité. Ce qui lui  plait surtout dans son activité  c’est l’affluence de la clientèle le matin a la recherche de petit déjeuner. Elle sollicite un crédit de 75 000 frs pour s’approvisionner en mil, niebe,et sucre qui constituent des matières premières pour sa préparation. Le crédit lui assure une certaine autonomie par rapport aux boutiquiers qui souvent la ravitaillaient a crédit et ses bénéfices lui permettent de satisfaire ses besoins personnels
texts.en:
Soda D. lives in Daroukhane in the district of Guediawaye. She is 49 years of age, married and has 7 children between 12 and 31 years old. She has been a member of the microfinance institution of Baye Laye since 2006 and has already paid back two loans. She has had a small business for about ten years and she sells every morning bread, donuts and coffee. She has chosen this business because of the good profit she can make. She likes it because every morning there are many people who buy breakfast. She is requesting a loan of 75 000 frs to buy millet, niebe (a bean spread) and sugar, the main ingredients of the products she sells. The loan will give her some authonomy from her providers that usually sell on credit and the revenue will allow her to pay for her personal needs.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating funds.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: Monsieur Cheikh D. est un pécheur de 39 ans a Yoff vivant dans le quartier de Thongor Ndioufene. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis juin 2007 et a déjà bénéficie d’un prêt antérieur.  Il est célibataire sans enfant.et s’adonne particulièrement à la pèche artisanale depuis plus de 10 ans. Il sillonne régulièrement le trajet Yoff, Kayar, Ngaparou. Il a choisi son métier par passion. Et ses plus grands moments de bonheur sont les moments ou il attrape beaucoup de poissons puisqu’il sera sur de faire beaucoup de bénéfices. Il sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs dans le but d’aménager une chambre et une salle de bain dans l’objectif d’améliorer son cadre de vie.
texts.en:
Mr. Cheikh D. is a 39-year-old fisherman in Yoff who lives in the Thongor Ndioufene district.  He has been a member of the Yoff lending group since June 2007 and has already benefited from a previous loan.  He is unmarried with no children and has devoted his time especially to artisanal fishing for over ten years.  Cheikh regularly scours the course from Yoff to Kaya to Ngaparou and back.  He picked this trade out of passion.  And his happiest times are when he catches a lot of fish, since he is sure to make a lot profit.  Cheikh is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs with the goal of fixing up a bedroom and a bathroom, so as to improve his living situation.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Priscila Alexandra

texts.es:
La Srta. Alexandra S. es socia del banco comunal San Bartolo, viven en la comunidad La libertad de San Bartolo, que se encuentra a unos 30 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, es un lugar muy hermoso que cuenta con una belleza natural y vegetación exhuberante. Este Bankito esta formado por miembros de un familia que se agruparon en busca de mejores días para sus hijos y también para seguir creciendo con sus negocios.

Alexandra S. es soltera  tiene 20 años y vive en el Sector la Libertad en el  cantón  Sigsig en casa de sus padres  quienes se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

Alexandra se dedica a la cría de cuyes, ganado, tambien  elabora quesillo que lo  vende en su comunidad,  con los ingresos que obtiene colabora con los gastos del hogar, este es su tercer ciclo en la Fundación y  nos comenta que los créditos recibidos le han  permitido comprar sus animales, ahora  con el préstamo que le entreguen  va a  comprar  una vaca y cuyes para incrementar su criadero.

Su gran sueño es comprar una casita y un terreno.
texts.en:
Miss Alexandra S. is a member of the San Bartolo Communal Bank, whose members live in the La Libertad community of San Bartolo, about 30 minutes outside the city of Cuenca. It’s a very beautiful place with a natural beauty and exuberant vegetation. The community bank is formed by members of a family that joined together in search of better days for their children and also to continue growing their businesses. Alexandra S. is single. She is 20 years old and lives in the sector la Libertad in the canton Sigsig. She lives with her parents who are dedicated to agriculture and livestock. Alexandra raises guinea pigs and cattle. She also makes cheese that she sells in her community. With the income she obtains, she contributes to the household expenses. This is her third cycle with the foundation, and she tells us that the loans she has received have allowed her to buy her animals. Now with the loan that you give her, she’s going to buy a cow and guinea pigs in order to increase her farm. Her biggest dream is to buy a little house and some land.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow and guinea pigs

loans.name: Sonia Margarita

texts.es:
Sonia R. es socia del  Banco Comunal Libertad San Bartolo que esta formado por miembros de una familia que buscan mejores dias para sus hijos y la forma de seguir incrementando sus negocios, ella vive en la comunidad San Bartolo de Sigsig, tiene 30 años y se encuentra casada fruto de su unión conyugal procreó tres hijos que se encuentran de  6, 4, 2 años de edad, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad resultado del esfuerzo y trabajo conyugal.

Sonia es comerciante de pollos,  tiene ya siete años es esta actividad y  los  vende pelados y también vivos como le soliciten sus clientes, nos comenta que le va muy bien en su negocio pues recibe muchos pedidos.

Ella lleva tres ciclos trabajando  en la Fundación desde que se entero de los beneficios que ofrece la institución por un promotor de la Fundación;  con el préstamo solicitado comprará  pollos pequeños, maiz y vitaminas  para criarlos y comercializarlos.

Su gran sueño es tener un local propio para vender su producto en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Sonia R. is a member of the communal bank Libertad San Bartolo, which is made up of members of a family that are looking for better days for their children and a way to continue expanding their businesses. She lives in the community San Bartolo de Sigsig, is 30 years old, and is married. She has three children; ages 6, 4, and 2. The house that they live in is her own, a result of effort and hard work. Sonia sells chicken for a living, which she has been doing for 7 years. She sells them plucked or live, at her clients' request. She tells us that her business is going very well, as she receives a lot of orders. She has been working with the Fundacion for three loan cycles, since she found out about the benefits that the institution offers through a promoter. With this loan, she will purchase small chickens, corn, and vitamins to raise and market them. Her greatest dream is to have her own place to sell her products in the downtown area of the city.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase small chickens, corn, and vitamins to raise and sell them

loans.name: Cindy Annabel

texts.es:
El banco comunal Confraternidad de Damas se reúnen en la ciudad de Portoviejo cada 15 días,  es un grupo  muy unido, conversamos con la señora Cindy para que nos cuente como le va trabajando con la Fundación.
                                                          
Cindy está casada desde hace seis  años, ella es comerciante informal que se dedica a vender ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, con este negocio viene trabajando desde hace un año,  empezó en el negocio con la ayuda de un préstamo que le hizo una amiga en aquel tiempo su capital fue de $400 dólares con eso invirtió y desde entonces le ha ido muy bien; ella pudo seguir surtiendo su negocio  y ahora con la ayuda que le brinda la fundación compra de contado la mercaderia obteniendo  mejores ganancias. 

Nuestra socia está muy contenta con su trabajo, cuenta que tiene que viajar hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil cada dos semana para surtir el negocio y cumplir con los pedidos que sus clientes le hacen, lo que invierte depende de los pedidos y la recuperación de capital una vez que ha reunido el dinero viaja para abastecerse de  mercaderia directa de los distribuidores. 

Por ahora Cindy tiene en mente invertir una parte del dinero en surtir y ampliar el local para  brindarle mejor comodidad a sus clientes adquiriendo pantalones, blusas, camisetas, bermudas así como tostadoras, wafleras, licuadoras e ir incrementando mas  electrodomésticos y accesorios para el hogar.

 El sueño de Cindy es poder tener su vivienda propia ya que al  momento vive en casa de su mamá.
texts.en:
The communal bank, "Confraternidad de Damas," meets in the city of Portoviejo every two weeks. It is a very united group. We spoke with Cindy so she could tell us about how it's going working with Fundación Espoir. Cindy has been married for six years. She is an informal merchant who sells clothing for women, men, and children. She has had this business for one year. She started it with the help of a loan that a friend made her for $400. She invested it in her business and since then it has gone very well. She has been able to to keep supplying her business and now with the help that Fundación Espoir is offering her, she will buy more merchandise with cash so she can obtain better profits. Our member is very happy with her work. She says that she has to travel to the city of Guayaquil every two weeks to be able to supply her business and to fill the orders that her customers aks for. What she invests depends on her orders, and after she has collected the money, she travels to buy merchandise directly from distributors. Now Cindy plans to invest part of the money in stocking and expanding her location to offer more comfort to her customers that shop for pants, shirts, t-shirts, shorts, and also toasters, waffle irons, and blenders. She will increase her inventory of household appliances and accessories for the home. Cindy's dream is to be able to have her own home since at the moment she lives in her mother's house.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, t-shirts, shorts, waffle irons, toasters, blenders, etc.

loans.name: Angelica Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Angélica forma parte  del Banco Comunal  Confraternidad De Damas desde hace dos ciclos, éstas mujeres emprendedoras se reúne en la ciudad de Portoviejo en la Provincia de Manabí cada quince días donde comparten vivencias del día a día.

Angélica es madre soltera de dos niños vive en casa de una tía política quien ha sido la persona que le ha brindado ayuda, nuestra socia se define como una mujer luchadora y de trabajo para ayudarse económicamente desde hace un año viene dedicándose a la  venta de productos de belleza en una variedad en marcas hasta el momento le va bien, empezó con un pequeño capital de $200 dólares, en los actuales momento ha podido comprarse una vitrina para exhibir en su casa los productos a sus clientes a pesar de aquello se toma su tiempo para salir y ofrecer puerta a puerta.

Nuestra socia  junto a su tía también han podido reunir un capital y han montado  un negocio de aceites para vehículos,  compra por galones a los mayoristas y  vende en un local que la tía le prestó  aquí le ayuda a atender un sobrino,  con el prestamo solicitado va a dividir para sus dos negocios adquirirá labiales,cremas, perfumes, etc, y aceites  para abastecer sus negocios.
texts.en:
Ms Angélica has been a member of the Communal Bank Confraternidad de Damas for 2 payment cycles. These women meet in the city of Portoviejo in the Manabi Province every two weeks to share news of how everything is going. Angélica is a single mother of two children. She lives in the home of an aunt (by marriage) who has been the person offering her help. Our partner is known as a fighting, hard-working woman who helps herself economically. For a year she has been selling beauty supplies of different brands, and so far it’s going well. She began with a small working capital of $200. Recently she has been able to buy a display case to show the products in her home to her customers. She also takes to time to sell door to door . Our partner and her aunt have been able to save some capital and have put together a business selling motor oil. She buys gallons from wholesalers and sells it in a stand that her aunt lent her. There she also helps her take care of a nephew. With the requested loan she will divide the money to add lipsticks, creams, perfumes, etc. and oil to stock up the merchandise for the two businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lipsticks, creams, perfumes and motor oil

loans.name: Rosa Aura

texts.es:
El banco Comunal Confraternidad De Damas se reúne en la ciudadela Pacheco de la ciudad de Portoviejo, 
la señora Rosa  tiene 46 años es madre soltera de tres hijos, ella se dedica a realizar manualidades su negocio esta ubicado en su casa donde vende artesanías hechas a mano como collares, pulseras en fin todo lo que es bisutería, también vende  ropa para damas, caballeros y niños tiene aproximadamente diez años con su negocio.

Este es su primer ciclo en mi bankito ya que una amiga fue quien la incentivo para ingresar, está contenta por los beneficios que ofrece la Fundación.

Ella viaja  a Perú y  Guayaquil para realizar sus compras a los mayoristas, su inversión  es de 400 a 800 dólares y trabaja a crédito con sus clientes para incrementar su clientela. Con el préstamo que  esta solicitando comprará hilos, mullos, gafetes y más implementos para elaborar sus artesanias, así como pantalones, blusas, camisas, camisetas, interiores  para toda l familia.

Ella siempre ha trabajado sola y uno de sus sueños es tener su propio local y su casa.
texts.en:
The Confraternidad de Damas communal bank meets in the Pacheco housing project of Portoviejo. Rosa, 46, is a single mother of three children; she is a craftsperson. She maks such things as necklaces, bracelets and all kinds of costume jewelry; she also sells clothing for women, men and children. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and she sells from her home. This is her first cycle with the bank; she was encouraged to join by a friend. She is happy with the benefits the Foundation offers. She travels to Perú and Guayaquil to buy from wholesalers. She invests from 400 to 800 dolars and sells to her customers on credit in order to obtain more customers. This funding will be used to buy thread, beads, hooks and other supplies for her crafts as well as pants, blouses, shirts, t-shirts and underwear for the entire family. She has always worked by herself and one of her dreams is to have her own store and her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy thread, beads, hooks, etc. pants, blouses, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Unidas Somos Mas(Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Unidas somos Más  esta formado por un grupo de mujeres luchadoras que buscan día a día la superación personal y familiar con el fruto de su trabajo, viven por el sector  Nonodel a unos 30 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, sus reuniones las hacen en campo abierto en medio de un paisaje natural en donde se ve la naturaleza en todo su esplendor y estado natural.

La señora Rosa León tiene 29 años  vive en union libre con su pareja y sus cinco hijos de 10,8, 5, 3 y 1 año de edad,  sus 3 primeros hijos estudian en la escuela Martin Huelte en  la comunidad Rumipamba por lo que tienen que caminar 30 minutos para llegar al plantel educativo, su esposo trabaja acerrando madera. La casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad construyéndola con mucho amor  donde se refleja todo el esfuerzo de su trabajo.

Rosa se dedica a la agricultura y  trabaja  tres días a la semana ya sea lavando ropa ajena o labrando la tierra de sus vecinos, siendo su prima quien la lleva a trabajar ya que ella tiene muchos conocidos que solicitan  sus servicios, tambien se dedica a la cria de cuyes, gallinas  que son tanto para su consumo personal como para la venta en la ciudad de Cuenca.

Este es su tercer crédito en la Fundación  fue su cuñada la que la incentivo para formar parte de su banco comunal  y los créditos le han beneficiado para superarse poco a poco en su hogar, con el préstamo que le entreguen  lo va a invertir en la compra de  pollos, cuyes junto con su alimento.

Su gran sueño es que sus hijos estudien y  salgan adelante.  

Rosario B. tiene 33 años es otra socia de éste banco, vive en la parroquia Quingeo con su esposo y sus seis hijos  de 15, 12, 10, 6, 3 años  y uno de 2 meses de nacido. Su esposo es albañil actividad que le ha permitido ir construyendo poco a poco su casa propia y mantener a su familia

Ella se dedica a la cria de ganado, cuyes, gallinas que son para su consumo familiar y  nos comenta que su ganando lo vende solo cuando tiene algun apuro economico, tambien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. Nuestra socia se encuentra en su primer crédito y es su cuñada quien la invito a este grupo de amigas que buscan la superación de sus  familias 
 

Con el préstamo que la  FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue va a comprar  abono para el pasto y su gran sueño es salir adelante para brindarles un  buen  presente y futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Unidas Somos Más communal bank is made up of a group of hard-working women who daily seek their personal and their family’s progress through their work. They live in the Nonodel sector, which is about 30 minutes outside of the city of Cuenca. They meet outdoors surrounded by natural scenery where Nature is seen in all her splendor and natural state. Rosa León, 29, lives with her life partner and their 5 children, who are 10, 8, 5, 3, and 1 years old. Her oldest three children are enrolled in the Martin Huelte elementary school, which is in Rumipamba; it’s a 30-minute walk to school. Her husband works hauling lumber. They own their own house which they built with lots of love and which reflects all their hard work. Rosa farms and works three days a week either taking in laundry or working her neighbors’ fields; her cousin takes her to work because she has many contacts who request their services. In addition, she raises guinea-pigs and chickens, both for her own personal consumption and to sell in the city of Cuenca. This is her third loan with the Foundation; her sister-in-law encouraged her to be part of a communal bank. The loans have gradually helped her to get ahead in her home. The loan she will get now will be used to buy chickens, guinea-pigs and animal feed. Her great dream is that her children study and get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens, guinea-pigs, animal feed and natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Hoai's Group

texts.en:
Hoai T. Đặng  is 35 years old. She lives in Xom Vang, Co Loa, Dong Anh, Ha Noi. She has two children who are going to school. She is a tailor. She works at home. She has a sewing machine. She has a monthly income of about 2.000.000 Vietnamese dong. 

She joined SEDA, a Kiva partner, four years ago and makes repayments on time. This time, she wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND to buy a sewing machine. She hopes her life will be better. 

About the other borrower in her group: 

Hòa Thị Hoàng is 34 years old. She is a hairdresser. She has a monthly income of about 2.500.000 VND. She wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND to invest in her hairdressing business.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: My's Group

texts.en:
Mỹ Thị P. is 59 years old. She lives in Cau Ca – Co Loa – Dong Anh – Ha Noi with her husband and two of her children. She has been raising chickens for many years. She has a monthly income of about 2.000.000 Vietnamese Dong. She joined SEDA, a Kiva partner, three years ago and has made repayments on time. This time, she wants to borrow 7.194.000 VND to repair breeding facilities and buy some chickens.
 
About the other borrower in her group: 

Huệ Thị Nguyễn is 28 years old. She sells goods in the market. She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND to invest in her small business.

loans.use: To repair breeding facilities and buy some chickens

loans.name: 01-Dong Son Group

texts.en:
"Nhung D. T. (10) is a 50 year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Nhung leads a five member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group will receive an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the entire loans if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this group is 01-Dong Son (37166).

Nhung is married and has three adult-aged children.  To make a living, Nhung runs a general store, selling a variety of products in the local community.  Nhung has been in this business for over four years and earns approximately 1.500.000 VND a month.

In 2004, Nhung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nhung successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to expand the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND to further expand the business.  The loan will be the eigth from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Nhung plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  N. T. Dan (11), a 53 year-old woman is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business specialized retail store.

2.  N. T. Loan (9), a 61 year-old woman is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.

3.  N. T. Thanh (8), a 49 year-old woman is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.

4.  L. T. T. (12), a 47 year-old is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.
-------------------------------------------------
About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


Nhung D. T. (10) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Nhung là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 01-Dong Son (37166).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại sản phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Nhung thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Nhung kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND.  Vào 2004, Nhung đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Nhung đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 8th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. T. Dan (11) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


2.  N. T. Loan (9) là 61 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


3.  N. T. Thanh (8) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


4.  L. T. T. (12) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  D. việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: 02-Dong Hai Group

texts.en:
"Huong L. T. (19) is a 32 year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Huong is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 02-Dong Hai (16-05-02).

Huong is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Huong owns and operates a butcher shop, selling a variety of meats in the local community.  Huong has been in this business for over a year and earns approximately 2.500.000 VND a month.

In 2004, Huong joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Huong has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to expand the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND to expanding the business even more.  The loan will be her ninth from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Huong plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  P. T. Quyet (26) is a 27 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  P. T. Luan (20) is a 38 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.

3.  N. T. Chien (21) is a 48 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4.  N. T. Van (15) is a 41 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

5.  L. T. Loi (12) is a 50 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

6.  L. T. Binh (19) is a 47 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.
---------------------------------------------

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


Huong L. T. (19) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Huong là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02-Dong Hai (16-05-02).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ giết mổ & bán nhiều loại thịt khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Huong thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 1 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Huong kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND.  Vào 2004, Huong đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Huong đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 9th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  P. T. Quyet (26) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  P. T. Luan (20) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


3.  N. T. Chien (21) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.
