5.  L. T. Loi (12) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


6.  L. T. Binh (19) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: Expand the business.

loans.name: Agnes Kabbaseke 's Group

texts.en:
Agnes is 27 years of age, married with three children.  All her children go to school The family resides and owns a two roomed house where she stays with five people. She takes care of additional family members.  The family has access to electricity and no piped water at home.  The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include paying utility bills, medication and feeding the family. Harriet owns a stall in Nakawa market selling yellow bananas and on average she receives  20 customers a day. She has done this business for over twenty years. She doesn’t incurs transport costs  because she buys from her place of workHer main challenges are seasonality and thieves  She sells on retail and wholesale .She has been with MCDT for ten  years servicing her twentieth loan >Harriet  wants to use this loan to use this buy clusters and bunches of bananas. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and own and start going directly to farmers.
.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of yellow bananas

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 27 years of age and is married, with three children. All of her children go to school. The family owns and resides in a two-roomed house where she stays with five people, as she takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but has no piped water at home. The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include paying utility bills, medication and feeding the family. Christine owns a stall where she sells fruits and vegetables. On average she receives 20 customers a day. She has done this business for over twenty years. She doesn’t incur transport costs  because she buys from her place of work. Her main challenges are seasonality and thieves. She sells both retail and wholesale. She has been with MCDT for ten years and is servicing her fourth loan. Christine wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of tomatoes and onions, plus other fruits. She aspires to seeing her business grow bigger and to start going directly to farmers.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions and other fruits.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 35 years of age and married, with three children. All of her children go to school. The family owns and resides in a two-roomed house where she stays with five people. She takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity, but has no piped water at home. The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include paying utility bills, medication and feeding the family. Juliet owns a kiosk selling soft drinks in Namungoona and on average she receives 20 customers a day. She has done this business for over 20 years. She doesn’t incur transport costs because she buys from her place of work. Her main challenges are seasonality and thieves. She sells both retail and wholesale. She has been with MCDT for six years, and is servicing her twelfth loan. Juliet wants to use this loan to buy more crates of soda and mineral water and more boxes of fruits. She aspires to seeing her business grow bigger and to start going to manufacturers.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda and mineral water and boxes of fruit.

loans.name: Urandelger

texts.en:
Urandelger is 47 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. They live in a traditional, Mongolian, nomadic tent called a “ger”. His two oldest daughters are 15 and attend the local secondary school. The youngest is not yet of school age. 
Urandelger operates a clothing business from a rented stall at a local market. He started his business in 2003 and has established himself well in the local business community. At first his working capital was 300,000 tugrugs (~210 USD). Through his hard work he has increased his working capital to more than 2,500,000 tugrugs (~1800 USD). 
Urandelger has many plans for the future and is working diligently to expand and improve his business. He says, "my goal for the future is to provide quality products and grow my customer base". He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase children's clothes from China to sell in his business.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothes

loans.name: Akbar

texts.en: Akbar T. is a 25 year old, young, single man. He lives in Fuzuli region. Akbar has been working in his business for 5 years. Akbar T. now needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy stock to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stock

loans.name: Khoder

texts.en:
Khoder is a 28 year old man who lives with his wife in Bint Jbeil, Southern Lebanon. Khoder has been selling fruit and vegetables since 2005. He sells tomatoes, watermelon, cucumbers, green beans and other produce. His produce changes from season to season. He sells from his van and goes from shop to shop throughout his entire region. 
He requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase a new van for work because his current one is very old and needs a lot of maintenance. This maintenance will cost more than buying another van. This is the first time that Khoder has requested a loan.
Khoder is well known for the good quality of the produce he sells. His clients are people from his region. When he first started he had to face competition as there are a lot of other producers who also sell in his region. Khoder decided to start his business because of his experience. In the future he plans to keep expanding his business by growing more produce and selling it in the surrounding villages.

loans.use: To buy a new van for his business

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila is a 49-year-old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with her husband and their six children. Jamila has been producing agro products and selling lingerie since 2005. She produces different types of jams, spices and more. Regarding her lingerie sales, she sells underwear and pajamas from her house. Jamila is an active woman who does her best to improve her family’s income. She is a hardworking lady. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for both of her businesses. This is her third loan and she has always paid on time. Jamila is special in her work because she offers good quality and very tasty agro products; she always tries new recipes and health products to sell. As for the lingerie, she offers good quality merchandise. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her businesses, she didn’t have enough cash to diversify her merchandise. Jamila decided on doing her businesses because she wanted to supplement her family’s income, especially since she has a big family and she wants to offer them the best she can. She plans to keep on improving her businesses as well as her financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Ilkham

texts.en: Ilkham H. is married and has a child. He was born in 1975. H.'s family lives in Fuzuli region. IIkham has been in this business for 10 years. Now Ilkham H. needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to expand the store to improve his business.

loans.use: To expand his store

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 33-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Ali has owned a bakery since 2000. He sells mankoucheh and pizzas. A Mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza. The most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. Ali is special in his work because he is known for his good and tasty mankoucheh. When he first started his business, he passed through some financial issues. Ali is special in his work because he has lots of confidence and experience. This is his second loan and he has always paid on time. Therefore, he requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to expand his business by opening a new bakery in a different region. He plans to open his second bakery and hopes that it will keep on growing and having more clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Nimreh

texts.en: Nimreh is a 49-year-old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with her husband and their four children. Nimreh has been producing agro products since 1995. She produces different type of jams, spices, bread and more. She also does Lebanese pastries like “Fatayers”, which are spiced triangular spinach pies stuffed with meat and onions; “Manakich” which are pastry baked with thyme, olive oil, spices and sesame seed; “Sfiha” which are pies made from our own fresh dough topped with spicy ground lamb meat, onions and tomatoes; “Sambousik” which are pastries with meat and pine nuts; and “Rakaek Jibne” which are thin flour dough, stuffed with a combination of cheese and fried to golden perfection. Nimreh requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her business. This is her third loan and she has always paid on time. She is special in her work because she offers good quality and very tasty agro products and pastries. Her clients are people from her region, but mainly her friends and neighbors. Nimreh decided on doing her business because she is a very good cook and has experience. She learned cooking at a young age from her grandmother. She plans to keep on improving her business as well as her financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en: Abbass is a 39-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Abbass has owned a bakery since 1998. He sells mankoucheh and pizzas. A Mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza. The most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. Ali is special in his work because he is known for his good and tasty mankoucheh. Abbass also does Lebanese pastries like “Fatayers” which are spiced triangular spinach pies stuffed with meat and onions; “Manakich” which are pastries baked with thyme, olive oil, spices and sesame seed; “Sfiha” which are pies made from our own fresh dough topped with spicy ground lamb meat, onions and tomatoes. When he first started his business, he passed through some financial issues and took loans at Al Majmoua. This is his third loan and he has always paid on time.  He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials and gas for his oven. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. He plans to keep on improving his work and offering the best to his clients.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and gas for his oven.

loans.name: Zahira

texts.en: Zahira is a 42-year-old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with her husband and their two children. Zahira has been working in agriculture since 1995. She owns livestock, which allows her to produce dairy products. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a cow to increase her livestock. This is her third loan and she has always paid on time. Zahira is special in her work because she does her best to produce the best quality. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t produce as much as she does today. Zahira decided on doing her business because she took after her family’s business. In the future, she plans to keep on expanding her work by producing more.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase used aluminum for his work.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en: Siham is a 35-year-old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with her husband and their three children. Siham has been producing olive oil for 15 years. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase olives for her work and save money for her children's school tuition. This is the first time that Siham has requested a loan. Siham is special in her work because she does her best to produce the best quality of olive oil. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she had some financial issues and couldn’t produce as much as she does today. Siham decided on doing her business because she took over her family’s business. In the future, she plans to keep on expanding her work by producing more.

loans.use: To purchase olives for her work.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 26-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil in southern Lebanon. Samer has been working in construction for seven years. He owns an air compressor. When he first started his business, competition was a problem, especially since he didn’t do a lot of networking. He also had some financial issues. Now, Samer is exceptional because he is known for his good work. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region.

He requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Samer has requested a loan.  In the future, he plans on expanding his business by working in surrounding villages.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 41-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil in southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Ibrahim has been working in construction. He tiles floors. 

He requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, A. Majmoua, in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Ibrahim has requested a loan. 

When he first started his business, he had to face some competition. Now, Ibrahim is known for his good work, and he is trustworthy. His clients are people from his region. In the future, he plans to expand his business by working in surrounding villages.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 27-year-old man who lives with his wife in Bint Jbeil, in southern Lebanon. Youssef has been working in agriculture for nine years. He grows fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, watermelon, cucumbers, green beans etc. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new tools for his work. This is the first time that Youssef has requested a loan. 

Youssef is notable in his work because he is known for his good production. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he had to face competition because there is a lot of agriculture in his region. Youssef decided on this business because of his experience of learning it when he was young, and then taking over his family’s business. In the future, he plans to keep on expanding his work by producing more.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef has owned an electronics shop in his town since 1991. He opened his shop after seeing a need for such services in the region. He sells used or new equipment in addition to offering repair service. 

Today, Youssef is wanting to borrow $700 to buy additional electronic equipment to satisfy the needs of his customers and in order to expand his business productivity.

loans.use: buy additional electronic equipment

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 40-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their five children. Ali has been working as a school van driver since 2007. When he first started his business, he had to face some competition, especially since he didn’t do a lot of networking. He had some financial issues as well. Now, Ali is well-known for his work because he is punctual and trustworthy.

He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his van. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. In the future, he plans to expand his business by working in surrounding villages.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his van.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda S. B. is twenty five years old, divorced, and has one child who is five and half years old. Her business is located at Khayega, a busy local market in Kakamega. She sells vegetables, onions and tomatoes to the local people. She has engaged in this kind of business for the last four years despite the fact that competition is high because there are many people in the area engaged in the same kind of business as hers. 

She is using her loan to buy a cow and a donkey. A cow will give her milk to consume at home and she will sell the excess to the local people. A donkey will enable her to transport her goods from one place to another. She dreams of buying her own land and building her own shop. She also sees herself being the biggest green-grocer in Khayega. She is a very hardworking and determined lady.

loans.use: To buy a cow and a donkey

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 22-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil in southern Lebanon. Ali has been working in construction since 2006, tiling floors. When he first started his business, he had to face competition and had some financial issues. Now, he is exceptional because he is known for his good work. His clients are people from his region.

He requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his work and to purchase more sophisticated tools.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a 41-year-old woman who lives with her husband and their five children in Bint Jbeil in southern Lebanon. Ghada has been selling clothes from her house since 1998. She sells women's clothes, scarves and clothes for veiled women, as well as pajamas and lingerie. 

Ghada decided to start her business because she likes it and has experience. However, when she first started her business, she didn’t have enough cash to diversify her merchandise. Now, Ghada is well known because she does her best to suit her client’s needs. Her clients are women from her region.

She requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase more merchandise for her sales. This is her second loan cycle and she has always paid on time. 

In the future, she plans to keep on improving her business and to attract more clients.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en: Teymur F. is married and has three children. He is 39 years old. Teymur and his family live in the Fuzuli region. This man has been in the auto repair business for nine years. Now he needs a loan of $2500 to buy spare parts to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a 39-year-old man who lives with his wife and their four children in Bint Jbeil, in southern Lebanon. 

Abbass has been working in construction for over two years. He decided to start his business because of his experience. At first he had difficulty buying the required tools for his work because he didn’t have enough cash. Now, Abbass is well known for his work because he does it well and is committed. His clients are people from his region. 

He requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase more tools for his work. This loan will help him improve his efficiency. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time. In the future, Abbass plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 22-year-old single man. In 2008, he decided to open a special Lebanese coffee and tobacco shop to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This business helps him to support his family. He serves a wide range of customers in the village and surrounding neighborhoods who came to have a good time in his coffee shop. Today, Mohamad is requesting to borrow $1,000 because he is planning to build a special tent next to his shop in order to expand his business and make a good income for his family.

loans.use: To build a tent to expand his coffee shop

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 24-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and child. He has been working as a car electrician since 2004. His customers are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. Hussein's business is successful because he is trustworthy and known for his good work. He has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase tools and car oil for his work. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time. When he first started his business, he had difficulty finding the proper place to open his garage. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by selling car spare parts.

loans.use: To purchase tools and car oil

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice A. A. is 45 years old, widowed and has seven children between the age of 21 and 10 years. All of her children are still schooling and she hopes to give them quality education. Her business is located at Khayega, a busy local market in Kakamega, where she has sold cereals to the local people for the last twenty years. She will use her Kes 20,000 loan to restock her business by purchasing more beans, wheat, groundnuts and peas. She is very hardworking and takes pride in being the supplier of cereals in Kakamega, even when she knows that there are challenges of low demand seasonally.

loans.use: Beans,  wheat, groundnuts, and peas.

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is 34 years old and lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife and three children. Mouhamad has been working as a constructor since 1995, and his particular job is taking care of the cement. His customers are people from his region and the surrounding villages. When Mouhamad first started his work, he wasn’t really known by people in his region which meant that he didn't have a lot of contacts. He decided to start his business because of his experience.
Mouhamad has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase tools for his work and to do some maintenance work on his car. This is the first time that Mouhamad has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work and do some maintenance work on his car

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal, 42 , lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with her husband and their four children. Amal has owned a grocery store since 1999, selling candies, canned food, beverages, etc. She has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to expand her stock and diversify her merchandise, thereby helping her meet client demand. This is the first time that Amal has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

Amal decided to start her business because she wanted to supplement her husband’s income, and over time has gradually diversified her product offerings. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. In the future, she plans to continue improving her store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en: Maurice is a 52-year-old single man who owns a coffee shop in his town. He has been involved in this business for the past 30 years. He has become well known in his region because the majority of village men meet together at his coffee shop after a long working day to have an enjoyable time. Maurice is thankful for his business; it has helped him to assist his only brother in taking care of his mother after his father's death. Today, Maurice is requesting to borrow $800 USD to renovate his shop in order to attract more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: To renovate his coffee shop

loans.name: Cầm's Group

texts.en:
Cầm Thị C. (ID 010103020015) is 46 years old, married, and has two children. She has a store where she sells all types of things – cake, beer, sweets, etc. She has been working in this business for many years, and earns a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She has been a member of Kiva partner, SEDA, for six years and has always made her repayments on time.
Cầm Thị C. is the leader of a six-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. This time, Cầm Thị C. wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy more goods to sell.

About the other borrowers in the group
Nga Thị Đỗ (ID 010103020013) is 41 years old. She sells bowls, plates and other goods. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her business.
Tám Nguyễn T. (ID 010103020014) is 28 years old. She has a shop where she sells steel. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her shop.
Tiến Thị Nguyễn (ID 010103020016) is 51 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy more goods to sell.
Vinh Thị C. (ID 010103020018) is 57 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy a sewing machine.
Dũng Thị Nguyễn ID 010103020030) is 49 years old. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND to invest in her store.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 30-year-old engaged man living in Tyre, southern Lebanon, where he has been working as a home painter since 2000. When he first started the business, which he entered because of his experience, he didn’t face difficulties except making himself known to the public. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase paint and painting tools for his work. This is his second loan, and he repays on time.

Khaled is special in his work because he does it well and is aware of the new painting fashion; he does his best to have the newest tools in order to improve his performance. His clients are people from his region. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase paint and painting tools for his work.

loans.name: Nazmia

texts.en:
Nazmia is a 40-year-old woman who lives in Bekaa with her husband and two children. She has been working as a seamstress since 1998. After Nazmia decided to start her business, she gained experience in sewing and also learned her trade by attending training. She repairs and makes dresses, skirts, shirts and other items. She works from home and does not own a shop. Her customers are her friends and neighbors.
When Nazmia first started her business, she didn’t have a good sewing machine and was not really known. However, she knew how to improve her work and make herself known to potential customers. Moreover, her previous loans helped her improve her work by purchasing a better sewing machine and increasing her number of customers. Nazmia's business is successful because she knows how to treat her customers, and is known for her good and talented work.
Nazmia has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to open a small sewing shop. This is her fourth loan cycle and she has always paid on time.

loans.use: To open a small sewing shop

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 57-year-old married man with six children of whom three are unemployed.

Ali has been working as a farmer for the past thirty years. He learned this occupation from his father who used to take him to the farm when he was very young.

Ali owns cattle on his farm and produces milk. He sells his products upon request of his clients. He produces delicious milk and yoghurt.

Today, Ali is requesting $1,000 to buy cattle to increase his productivity and make a good income for his family.

loans.use: To buy more cattle

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita D. is a 68-year-old married woman who lives in Prk. Luyang Brgy Guiljungan, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling herbal products in her community, running a pig-fattening operation, and as a charcoal retailer.

Amelita’s husband Rogelio helps also in running the businesses. Together they have 11 children between 29 to 48 years old. Nine of her children already have families, and the remaining two work and help their parents in household needs. They sometimes help in the selling of herbal products.

Amelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1990 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family, earning an average monthly income of Php 10,000 from her business activities.

Amelita is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 19,000 was used to fund operations of her herbal products dealership, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 15th loan, in the amount of Php 12,000, which she intends to use to purchase additional inventory for her herbal products business. Amelita is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Nader

texts.en:
Nader is a 27-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their three children. Two years ago, Nader decided to open mini-market in his region. He has been selling fruits and vegetables, all types of groceries such as candies, canned food, corn flakes, chips, pasta, rice, and lots more, as well as drinks and household cleaning products.

In order to provide the best for his customers, Nader has requested a loan from A. Majmoua to purchase merchandise for his market. This is the first time that Nader has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

Nader is speciA. in his business because he knows how to treat his customers, as well as having a good reputation. His customers are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had to face competition. Nader decided on doing his business because he always liked selling and wanted to have an independent job. For the future, he plans to keep on improving his shop so as to attract more customers.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Naftali

texts.en:
Naftali is 23 years old and has been running a 'boda boda' (motorbike taxi) transportation business for the past two years. He also sells electronics, such as amplifiers, televisions, extension cords, DVDs, and phone accessories to earn additional income. He employs two people for his transportation business.

Naftali wants to purchase a motorbike, which will cost Kes. 71,000 as well as insurance for the motorbike, which will cost Kes. 5,000. Naftali describes himself as hard-working and committed and he wants to work for a better future.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and insurance

loans.name: Farouk

texts.en:
Farouk is a 36-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their two children. Farouk has been working in the sanitary business since 2008. Farouk requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Farouk has requested a loan.

Farouk is speciA. in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had difficulty purchasing all the required tools. He decided on doing his business because he learned it since he was young. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
Jamil is a 39-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa. Jamil has been selling used cars and spare parts since 2005. Jamil requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase car spare parts for his garage. This is the first time that Jamil has requested a loan. 

Jamil is special because he knows how to treat his clients well. Before selling the used parts, he repairs and fixes them. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Jamil decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent job. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase car spare parts for his garage

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa T. is a married woman who supports her family as a rice retailer, buying and selling rice, while simultaneously running a hog-fattening business. She lives in Sitio Cagay, Barangay Suay, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental with her husband and their eight children, all of whom are adults.

Leonisa has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her two businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 10,000.

Leonisa is now borrowing Php 15,000 so that she can buy additional inventory for her rice retailing business, and feed for her pig fattening business. This will be her 8th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 18,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Leonisa aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.


 About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy more stocks for her rice retailing business and buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Ramin

texts.en: This young boy was born in 1989. He is single. Ramin A. lives in Fuzuli region. Ramin has been in the business of selling produce for 2 years. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy more agricultural produce to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy more agricultural produce

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en: Agapita P. is a 55-year old married woman who lives in Purok Gilside, Barangay Nabulao, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating her general store and selling chainsaw parts. Agapita’s husband also helps in running the business. They have four children between 26 and 36 years old of whom two are already married, one is working, and one is a student. Agapita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon (NWTF-PD) in 1995 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her general store. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 6,000 from her business activities. Agapita is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 29,500 was used to fund operations of her general store and chainsaw parts business and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php 29,000 as her 21st loan which she intends to use for her general store. Agapita is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 21-year-old single man living with his parents and three siblings.

After finishing his education in 2007, Youssef decided to work as a floor layer. During his two years of working in this market, he has been able to obtain good experience and has a growing number of clients. This job helps in ameliorating his economic situation.

Today, Youssef is requesting to borrow $700 to buy a special tile cutter and shears specific for his job. This will enable him to expand his business and be able to take on bigger projects.

loans.use: To buy a tile cutter and shears for his business

loans.name: Batzul

texts.en:
Batzul is 32 years old and lives alone in a house in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Batzul operates a taxi service in his town. He enjoys transporting people. He says, “I must be very responsible and careful when driving my car in order to provide a safe ride for my customers.”

Batzul started his business in 2003 after conducting a vegetable-trading business for three years. During that time he gained much experience in conducting a business and saved some money in order to buy a car.

This is Batzul’s second loan that he is requesting from Kiva. With his first Kiva loan he bought a plot of land and built a house for himself. He is planning to expand his house in the future. He says, “I am doing my best in order to have a decent living standard before getting married.”

Batzul is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan to purchase parts for his taxi.

loans.use: To purchase parts for his taxi

loans.name: Son's Group

texts.en:
Sơn Thị Đỗ is 38 years old. (id: 010114070030). She lives in Co Cuong Dong Anh, Ha Noi. She was married and has two children. She is the leader of a 5 member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

She has been raising chickens for seven years. She has a monthly income of about 3,500,000 VND.  She has been with SEDA for 3 years and has repaid loans on time. This time, she wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (or 270 USD) to buy food for her chickens.

About the other borrowers in her group: 

Xuan T. T. is 52 years old. (id: 010114070026). She has a store. She sells everything and has income per day. She wants to borrow 5,450,000 VND (or 295 USD) to invest in her store.

Ha T. T. is 34 years old. (id: 010114070028). She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND (or 225 USD) to buy paper to make votives.

Nhung T. D. is 49 years old. (id: 010114070029). She sells clothes in the market. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (or 270 USD) to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy food for chickens

loans.name: Rakhila

texts.en:
Rakhila is married and has a child. She was born in 1972. Rakhila A. and her family live in Fuzuli region.

Rakhila has 6 years of experience in the poultry business. Now she wants a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy 20 turkeys, 20 geese and some hens to expand her poultry business.

loans.use: To buy turkeys, geese, and hens

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 24 year old married man with one child who has been running a barbershop and salon for three years. He employs three people and wants to improve his services with the 40,000 KES loan.

He hopes to have a stable source of income and own a professionally run salon someday.

loans.use: To purchase new machines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Bulganbat

texts.en:
Bulganbat is 43 years old and lives with her husband and three sons in a house in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her oldest son is in the army, her second son is a driver who conducts a taxi service, while her youngest studies at university in Korea.

Bulganbat operates a vegetable-trading business with the help of her husband. Bulganbat is responsible for selling the vegetables and her husband is responsible for delivery. They started their business in 1993 and became quite popular amongst their customers because of the wide product selection. They have gained much experience and a good reputation.

To supplement their earnings Bulganbat’s husband drives his car during the night, transporting people. He has also recently been hired as a welder at a private company with a monthly salary of 200,000 tugrugs (~140 USD). For the future, they are planning to continue their business.

Bulganbat is a person who has a great passion to achieve her goals. She says, "I am working hard to open my own shop in the future." She is requesting a 2,100,000 tugrug loan to purchase more carrots, potatoes, cabbages, onions, etc.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mary Ngure

texts.en:
Mary is an old lady of 70 years and widowed. She has four children who are in their 40‘s.

Mary was a dressmaker in Mombasa before she started running a retail shop nineteen years ago. She employs one person to assist her in her business. Mary also earns extra income from her rental houses.

Faulu Kenya has helped Mary manage her business and she now requests Kes 30,000 which she will use to buy a fridge for her business.

loans.use: To buy a fridge for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad has worked as a taxi driver since 2006, servicing his town and its surroundings. Married with children who are still going to school, Mohamad works hard because his only purpose is to continue his children's education to the university level. His wife is helping him to achieve this goal. Today, Mohamad is requesting a loan of $1,000 to perform maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his vehicle

loans.name: Byambatsetseg

texts.en:
Byambatsetseg is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her oldest son, aged 16, is in secondary school while the youngest has not reached school age yet. Besides helping with the family business, her husband takes care of their children and does all the housecleaning.

Byambatsetseg manages a meat-trading business in her town with the help of her husband, selling a variety of locally raised meats to her many customers. She started her business in 1999 after working as a teacher for five years and has built a successful operation over the years.

Byambatsetseg received her first loan from Xacbank in 2008. Since then she has been a very trustworthy recipient and has made good progress with the loan. Today, her business continues to grow quickly and she has a large base of loyal customers. This is her second Kiva loan and she wants to use the money in order to expand her business. She says, “All I want is to have happy and nice life.”

Byambatsetseg is a hardworking businesswoman and attributes her success to her good accounting skills. She is requesting a 2,400,000 tugrug loan to purchase more meat to sell during upcoming national holiday.

loans.use: To purchase more meat to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 36-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom attend school. She has been running her snack shop for two years and employs two people. Previously, she was employed as a telephone operator.

With the kes 30,000 loan, Catherine wants to expand her business. She describes herself as active and hardworking.

loans.use: To expand her snacks business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 49 years old and is a widow with two daughters who are in school. She owns rental houses and has one employee who takes care of the houses. She was previously a teacher but she currently earns extra income from farming.

Eunice requested Kes 30,000 through Faulu Kenya so as to renovate her rental houses. Faulu Kenya has also helped her save money.

Eunice hopes to establish her own home in the Rongai area of Nairobi in the future. She describes herself as industrious and humble.

loans.use: To renovate her rental houses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius A. A. is thirty seven years old, is married and has four children. His business is located at Khayega, a busy market in Kakamega. He engages in selling fruits and vegetables and has been in this business for the last two years.

Julius’ major challenge has been that at times there is an excess supply which reducing demand and prices for his goods. However he is determined to expand his business and he is using his Kes 20,000 loan to buy more fruits, onions and vegetables to sell.

Julius actually wants to become the biggest vegetable supplier in Khayega and also has a dream of building his own shop. He is a very hardworking and determined person who never gives up.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel, a 45-year-old married man with two daughters who are both attending school, has been running Sam's Butchery for 11 years, mainly selling beef and mutton and employing one person. He wants to increase his stock with a loan of kes. 70,000. His other source of income is his taxi business. Previously, he was employed in the hotel business. Samuel hopes someday to own a slaughterhouse and supply meat as a wholsaler in the Burma market. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for helping him to expand his business.

loans.use: To increase stock of meat.

loans.name: Ramin

texts.en:
This man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Agdam region, now settled in the Surakhani region.

Ramin A. was born in 1981 and is single. He has been in his clothing business for four years. Now, he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to expand his sales area.

loans.use: To expand his sales area

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en:
Bolormaa is a 39-year-old single mother who lives with her two daughters in an apartment in Darhan-Uul province, Mongolia. Her oldest daughter is unemployed and her youngest is in secondary school.

Bolormaa operates a shoe-repairing business which provides the only family income for her. She began her business in 1994 and since then has found much success with her business. As a result of her hard work and good customer service, her business is progressing day by day.

In 2009 Bolormaa began to partner with her sister in managing her business. Bolormaa is working hard in order to one day own her own workshop and buy new work equipment. She says, “I am working hard in order to save some money for my children.”

Bolormaa is requesting a 700,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase some necessary tools and supplies for her shoe-repair business.

loans.use: To purchase some necessary tools and supplies for her shoe-repair business

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir F. is single and lives in Fuzuli region.  He is 22 years old. As seen in the above picture, Samir washes cars.  This young man has been in this auto-washing business for three years.  Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy an apparatus for washing cars to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy apparatus for washing cars

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy M. M. is forty-nine years old, is married, and has three children aged between fourteen and six years old.

Mercy’s business is located at Juja in Thika where she sells flour, sugar and rice. She has been running this business for three years now and hopes to expand it. That’s why she is using her loan to restock her business.

Mercy's major challenge is that there are many people in the area engaging in the same business as hers so there is not much customer loyalty as they are spoilt by choice. She wants to open many other shops and become a market leader so she will be able to reach out to many people in Thika. She is hardworking and innovative.

loans.use: To buy more flour, rice and sugar to sell

loans.name: Kathy

texts.en:
Kathy is a 41-year-old widow with two children in school. She does cloth embroidery and makes lampshades.

Kathy hopes to grow her business so as to afford quality education for her children. As a result, she requested Kes 30,000 through Faulu Kenya so as to purchase a sewing machine and to increase her stock.

Kathy is committed to her business and dreams of establishing catering services in the future.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and add to her stock of fabric

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 40-year-old married woman with five children who are in school. She runs a retail shop where she sells cereals and other products. She has requested for a loan of Kes. 30,000. With the kes 30,000 loan she wants to add stock of cereals, sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and other products to her store.

Grace hopes to expand her business in the future. She describes herself as strong-willed.

loans.use: To restock her retail shop

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Azimjon

texts.en: E. Azimjon is 34 years old and is married with two children. He is a small-business entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuffs like sweets (candies), meat products, preserved food, soft drinks, juices and other items in his grocery store. Azimjon is not alone in this business. His whole family actively helps him with sales. Azimjon admits that he has benefited a lot in the past three years from his relationship with IMON International. Financial assistance he has received has helped him to grow and expand his business. Currently Azimjon is requesting a loan of $2,800 USD to increase his stock. Azimjon is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Bibiraikhon

texts.en: F. Bibiraikhon is a fighting woman who has not allowed the passage of years to diminish the value of her work and, as such, has always set a solid example for many youths of today. Bibiraikhon was born in a clearly agricultural family that taught the hard work of tilling the land and also the joint effort of arduous work. She has been dedicated for twelve years to agriculture, sowing corn, potatoes and onions in an independent way. Bibiraikhon’s great wish is to provide for the studies of her three children and for this reason she works hard. At harvest time she sells directly in the wholesale market of her locality in order to obtain her profits. Bibiraikhon requests a loan to acquire a greater quantity of fertilizer with the objective of improving the quality of her produce. Support Bibiraikhon and her desire to work hard and improve her standard of living. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Aslam

texts.en: H. Aslam is married with three children and he has always been a hard-working man who has made sure, from his young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread. Aslam has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs. With a small starting capital, thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise fourteen years ago. Over time he expanded his business and today his business has become domestic as his family is also engaged in it. Today, Aslam needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of his goods. For this purpose he is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe Aslam’s perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business. loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Asomidin

texts.en: J. Asomidin is a father who has devoted himself to independent agriculture for the past five years, cultivating potatoes, onions and carrots. He is also engaged in livestock and his children help him with the business. His daily efforts and the care of his fields assure him a good harvest as well as profits. Asomidin has dreamed of extending his lands. He wants to obtain a loan to invest in his current land by purchasing seeds and fertilizer to earn greater profits and reach the goal he has set for himself. Asomidin thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan with no violations. loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Murod

texts.en: Murod is 45 years old and lives with his wife and six children. He is a humble person dedicated to growing crops. For five years he has grown different types of agricultural products and this activity takes all of his day. Early in the morning he leaves to work on the land and returns home in the evening. Agriculture has helped Murod to cover his home expenses. He enjoys being in contact with nature, although it’s hard to work with difficult weather conditions that affect his production. For Murod, having a healthy wife and happy children gives him strength to keep working hard. Murod will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for improving his land. This is why he requests 2,800 USD. He thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to repay the loan without any violations. loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Saidodkhom

texts.en:
Saidodkhom has been able to support his family in an honorable way by selling different kinds of foodstuff in his grocery store. He is married with three children. In order to improve the quality and quantity of his products, he wants to buy more foodstuff. For this purpose he needs a loan of $3,000 USD. Saidodkhom has put a lot of effort into developing his business; he would like to keep growing as a micro-entrepreneur, and with your help this could be possible. Saidodkhom and his family are sincerely grateful for your generosity and support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON’s History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase foodstuff to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Rasmiyya

texts.en: Rasmiyya M. lives in the Fuzuli region of Azerbaijan. She is 34 and is single. Rasmiyya has been in business for 5 years. Noe Rasmiyya M. is seeking a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 4 calves to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy 4 calves

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.en: Rahmatullo is a businessman from Kumsangir where he lives with his wife and three children. He sells flour, ice-cream and soft drinks in the market. Rahmatullo does a good business because he keeps his merchandise well stocked and makes sure it is good quality. Presently, he is making about $400 USD each month. Rahmatullo is very honest and polite with both his suppliers and his customers. It has helped him to gain a reputation as a trustworthy and friendly vendor and to build a solid client base. Rahmatullo is applying for a loan of $3000 USD to re-stock his merchandise and hopefully generate additional profit. This will be his second loan with IMON international and his evaluation shows he is qualified to receive the loan. loans.use: Purchase flour to increase his stock of goods for sale

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.en:
Ismoil operates a grocery store in his neighborhood. He started his operation seven years ago. He is a 49 year-old father of seven children, three of whom are currently in school. He sells products like rice, canned foods, drinks, cooking oil, assorted biscuits, candies, and evaporated milk. With the loan, he wants to buy more of these and other products to increase his stock of goods. With increased stock and increased varieties, Ismoil hopes to make more income to provide for the educational needs of his children. He would appreciate your assistance very much. He wants to send his children to the university. Ismoil is grateful for your assistance.       


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase additional foods to increase the range of products to sell in his store

loans.name: Simuzar

texts.en:
Simuzar is married and has 2 children. Her family lives in the Fuzuli region. She was born in 1960.

She has been in this business for 7 years. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy necessary things for her cafe.

loans.use: To buy necessary goods for her cafe.

loans.name: Ngwe

texts.en:
Ngwe P. is a widowed mother of five currently living in Ntaghem, Cameroon.

Ngwa is currently requesting her fourth loan from GHAPE. She has been with GHAPE since 2006 and has demonstrated a creditworthy character exemplified by her repayments, consistent attendance of meetings and the support of her borrowing group.

With this latest loan, Ngwe is hoping to continue the business practices supported by her prior loans. She has requested 300,000 XFA in order to purchase a few plantains, cocoa, chickens and seeds for groundnuts. The products will eventually be sold through the small market stand she currently manages in the main Bamenda market. Ngwe P. is confident that her business will succeed because her market stand is in a strategic position within the market. She also feels that her friendly approach towards her customers also makes a big difference.

Ngwe P. hopes to use the profits from her business to provide for the various needs of her family. As the sole provider for her family of five, she hopes to increase her profits in order to feed her family and have enough to pay for her children’s school fees.

Ngwe P.’s loan will be provided through the Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE), a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase inventory including plantains, cocoa, fowl and groundnuts

loans.name: Allahyar

texts.en:
Allahyar N. is 59 years old. He is married and has 3 children. Allahyar and his family live in the Fuzuli region.

He has been in this business for 10 years. Now Allahyar needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 4 calves.

loans.use: To buy 4 calves

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es:
Las socias del banco comunal “Nueva Vida” son 19 en total. Ellas viven en la localidad de Labranza, ubicada cerca de la ciudad de Temuco. Los negocios de ellas son principalmente de repostería, venta de tortillas, venta de ropa nueva y usada, venta de joyas, fotocopias y bazar.
Marianela es la presidenta de este BC. En la foto ella está en 2º fila, vistiendo blusa celeste y con los brazos abiertos. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de carbón, el cual vende en su casa. Tiene 2 hijos adolescentes. Marianela invertirá este préstamo en carbón y en piñas para vender, además de remodelar el techo de su bodega, para que no se mojen sus productos. Su sueño es tener un almacén establecido en su casa. Su gran motivación es brindarle estabilidad económica y estudios a sus hijos, para que tengan un futuro sin necesidades.
Una de las cosas que le gusta mucho a Marianela de trabajar con Fondo Esperanza son los talleres de formación emprendedora que FE les entrega.
Temuco es la capital de la Región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile) y posee una serie de balnearios lacustres y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativa. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Vida” ("New Life") communal bank has a total of 19 members. They live in the community of Labranza, near the city of Temuco. The most common businesses in the group are pastry-making, selling tortillas, selling new and used clothing, selling jewelry, making photocopies and running a bazaar. Marianela is the president of this communal bank. In the photo, she is in the 2nd row, dressed in a sky-blue blouse, with her arms open. Her business is buying and selling charcoal, which she sells out of her home. She has 2 adolescent children. Marianela will invest this loan in buying charcoal as well as pineapples to sell, and in remodeling the roof of her storage room, so that her products do not get wet. Her dream is to have a permanent store in her home. Her great motivation is to provide her children with economic stability and a good education, so that they will not lack the necessities in the future. One of the things Marianela enjoys very much about working with the Fondo Esperanza (Hope Fund) are the entrepreneurial training workshops provided by the Fund. Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía Region. The city lies 670 kilometers south of Santiago (Chile's capital) and has a number of lakeside beaches and very striking native flora and fauna. Another noteworthy fact about the area is that 50% of Chile's Mapuche people, an indigenous group, live there.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing charcoal and pineapples

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 26-year-old single man living alone and has been working in construction for the past nine years. In 2002, he started to take his own projects and began his own career. Working on a freelance basis, he worked on houses in his village and its surroundings. Youssef is very glad because over the years, he has been able to have a mounting number of customers.

Today, Youssef is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy construction tools and supplies because his business is growing and he's planning to take on bigger projects.

loans.use: To buy construction tools and supplies

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 39-year-old single man living with his parents and three siblings. He has owned a gadget, CD and DVD shop since 1995 after seeing a need for such services in the region.

Fadi is a very responsible and punctual client. He chose to repay his first loan early and took a new loan of $1,200. With the new loan, he will invest in buying inventory for his shop in order to expand his business and hence his income.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Fayez

texts.en:
Fayez works as a farmer in his village. He's 49 years old and is married with three children.

Fayez has been working in agriculture for the past thirty years. He is the only provider for his family with his business. He cultivates different fruits and vegetables such as apples, olives, cherries, etc., and he distributes them through the market. Over the years, thanks to his business income, he was able to raise his family.

Today, Fayez is requesting $1,000 because he needs to buy different plants to grow on his plantation to augment his production and satisfy the demands of the market.

loans.use: To buy different plants to augment his production

loans.name: Nueva Asuncion Group

texts.es: La Asociación Comunal Nueva Asunción esta integrado por 8 socias, con diferentes tipos de negocios, como ser: taller de costura, confección de chamarras, tejidos de chompas.  Como es el caso de la señora Martha B., señora de 35 años de edad, casada, la misma que está dedicada desde hace 6 años al tejido de chompas en su domicilio, al mismo tiempo que desarrolla las tareas del hogar.  La venta de su producción es realizada en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, de lunes a domingo.  La solicitud de crédito que ahora realiza está destinada a la compra de lana, para mantener su producción de chompas.
texts.en:
The Community Association Nueva Asunción is made up of 8 members with various businesses and skills, including running a sewing workshop, tailoring jackets, and knitting sweaters. Martha B. is 35 years old and married, and has been knitting sweaters from her home for the past six years as well as taking care of the usual household responsibilities. Sales of her jumpers take place in the different fairs around the city of El Alto from Monday to Sunday. The loan is currently being sought to buy more wool to continue with her sweater knitting business.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more wool

loans.name: Tamunang

texts.en:
Born in 1948, Tamumang J. is married  and they are having three children. Due to the fact that he is too difficult for him to take care of the family single-handedly and provide the children’s basic care, and also that his wife could not do it alone, he decided to join GHAPE in 1998. Also, he has been having a lot of marital problems with his family and this has made him sad all the time, but he is appreciative of the fact that he is alive.

J. desire is to give his children love and education. He states that he feels better each time he provides something small for his children. His inability to get investment capital which could constantly generate income for him to meet his children’s needs is what motivated him to obtain a loan from GHAPE.

Given the loan, J. plans to buy a motorcycle to start a transportation business. He knows this business will succeed because he is located at a good business site and he has a good rider for the motorcycle. He plans to use the generated profits to sponsor his children in school and to cater for the basic needs of his family.




About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO (non-governmental organization) based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 42-year-old married man with 3 unemployed children. He has worked as a taxi driver since 1984, providing service in his town and the surrounding villages. He sometimes provides private taxi transportation upon customer request. He works hard all day long to make a good income for his family. Today, Hasan is requesting to borrow $1,000 to perform maintenance on his car and renovate the vehicle painting in order to continue his work properly.

loans.use: Car maintenance and painting

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a 49-year-old married woman and the mother of two young children. She opened a tailoring business to help her husband with the family's income and to pay for her children's schooling. She has been involved in this occupation for the past thirty years. Her target, in addition to helping her husband, is to continue their children’s education until the get to university and to provide a good life situation to them.

Today, Faten is requesting $1,200 to buy additional textiles with different colors and qualities to present a variety of products to her clientele.

loans.use: To buy additional textiles

loans.name: Suh

texts.en: G. is married and has four children. She lives in the heart of metropolitan Bamenda, Cameroon. She plans to invest this loan in dressmaking and in the cultivation of yam and cassava. Specifically, she will purchase cloth for dressmaking, yam seedlings for her farm, and will pay for the clearing and hoeing of her farm in order to plant yam and cassava. Her yam and cassava farm is located outside the main town whereas her dressmaking workshop is in the town. G. has been a GHAPE member since 2008 and this is her second loan. Yam sells at a high price while cassava can be processed into many other products such as garri and waterfufu for marketing. G. is also a longtime fashion designer and has many customers. With the profits from this loan, G. plans to buy a piece of land for her family to construct a house on. She also plans to take care of her family, ensure that they eat well, and buy their medication. She knows she will be able to repay this loan because of the low interest rate and the small repayment installments. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO (non-governmental organization) based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase cloth, seedlings and to pay for clearing her farm

loans.name: Jaritza Group

texts.es:
Rosa Merchán de 42 años. Su esposo vende legumbres en el mercado de mayoristas con el tiene 6 hijos de 18, 13, 12, 10, 9, 8 años.

Rosa es dueña de una tienda, en la que vende huevos, bebidas, arroz, azúcar etc. Ella se levanta en la madrugada para comprar en el mercado de mayoristas la mercadería para la tienda.

Con el préstamo espera surtir mas su negocio con aceite, arroz, verde y otros víveres, y así mejorar su tienda.

Rosa es coordinadora del grupo ella esta vestida con una blusa de rallas rojas y una falda jeans, el grupo Jaritza  es integrado por 4 personas en total. Ellos viven en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil.

Rosa compartirá este préstamo con el grupo. Ellos trabajan en la venta de verdes y naranjas, decoraciones de autos, venta de carnes. Los miembros del grupo mutuamente se comprometen a ser responsables en pagar el préstamo.
texts.en:
Rosa M. is 42 years old. Her husband sells vegetables in the wholesale market and has 6 children with Rosa: they are 18, 13, 12, 10, 9 and 8 years old. Rosa is the owner of a small store where she sells eggs, drinks, rice, sugar, etc. She wakes up at dawn to buy her store's inventory in the wholesale market. With the loan, she will better supply her store with oil, rice, and other goods, and thus improve her business. Rosa is the group coordinator; in the picture, she is in the blouse with red stripes and the jean skirt. The Jaritza group consists of 4 people who live in the semi-urban area called Paraiso de Guayaquil. Rosa will share the loan with the group. They sell bananas and oranges, car decorations, and meats. The group members commit to each other to jointly be responsible for repaying the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of oil, rice, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Marlene Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Marlene del Socorro Rosas, cuenta con 44 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 16 años el cual ya está cursando los estudios secundarios, tiene 20 Años de estar trabajando en este negocio, con la institución trabaja desde el año 2004, en todo este período se la han otorgado la cantidad de 13 créditos, los créditos otorgados a demás de abastecer el negocio, le han servido para mejorar su puesto de trabajo como su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marlene del Socorro R.is 44 years old and has a 16 year old son who is in high school. She has worked for the past 20 years in this business (cooking and selling food) and has worked with this microfinance institution since 2004. During this time, she has been given 13 separate loans in order to supply her business; these loans have helped her to improve her business as well as her home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to improve locale (zinc, etc.) and merchandise for the business (corn, kindling, whitewash, gas, bags, etc.)

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 48 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Lidia se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno y limpiar la casa. Lidia se dedica a la venta D. churros en la calle en una carretilla. Ya son diez años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Lidia requiere el préstamo para comprar 20 kilos D. harina. (Churros postres que se elabora con harina y en el centro tiene un relleno D. manjar)
