She is very happy because it has gone very well for her. She is asking for a loan to open a site in her house to increase her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material to make outfits

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Maria es socia del Banco Comunal “Cristo Blanco” desde hace 7 años, vive en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 44 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 04 hijos. Ella estudió hasta quinto de secundaria, se dedica a diversos negocios como son: venta de tunta, tejido de escarpines, venta de chanchos y llamadas a celulares.

Maria nos cuenta que el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela R., que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  lana y cerdos.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener una tienda de abarrotes. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones con las socias, la puntualidad, los préstamos y las ganancias de los ahorros
texts.en:
Maria has been a member of the community bank “Cristo Blanco” (white Christ) for seven years, she lives in the district of Juliaca, province of San Roman, region of Puno, she is 44 years old, has a partner and four children. She finished 5th year of secondary school, she has different businesses such as: tunta (freeze-dried potato) sales, knitting slippers, pig sales and cell phone calls. Maria tells us that the first loan requested to the Manuela R. movement was for $300 soles and it increased her working capital. She requests a loan for $600 soles to purchase wool and pigs. Her dream for the future is to have a grocery store. What she likes the most about her community bank are the member meetings, being punctual, the loans and the earnings from savings.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool and pigs

loans.name: Amigas Solidarias De Miguel Grau Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL "AMIGAS SOLIDARIAS DE MIGUEL GRAU"
Josefina es miembro de la alcancía comunal AMIGAS SOLIDARIAS DE MIGUEL GRAU, ella lleva trabajando con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD por más de 3 años.
Su familia esta formada por sus 3 hijos que aún dependen de ella, y su esposo, con quien comparte los gastos, viven en una humilde casa propia que fue comprada gracias a los ahorros que ambos juntaron.
Josefina se dedica a producir y vender artesanías desde hace más de 5 años, todo gracias a una amiga q le enseñó a bordar, coser, hacer las artesanías en especial pulseras y correas, productos que actualmente vende al extranjero.
El sueño más grande de Josefina es ver estudiar a su mayor hija que tiene el deseo y aspiración a estudiar periodismo, también terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL "AMIGAS SOLIDARIAS DE MIGUEL GRAU" Josefina is a member of the communal bank, AMIGAS SOLIDARIAS DE MIGUEL GRAU. She has been working with EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD for more than 3 years. Her family is made up of her 3 children, all still her dependents, and her husband, with whom she shares expenses. They live in their own humble house that they were able to buy thanks to the savings that they put together. Josefina has worked making and selling arts and crafts for the past 5 years. Thanks to a friend who taught her how to embroider, sew, and to make crafts, she now produces bracelets and belts for export. Her biggest dream is to have her oldest daughter study. She wants and hopes to study journalism. Josefina would also like to finish building her house. .

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Milvia Emilia

texts.es: Milvia E. G. G. vive en el municipio de Posoltega en un reparto que se llama la Virgen, es una joven muy trabajadora, soltera, madre de dos niñas, una mayor de quince años y la otra menor, ambas asisten a la escuela, el negocio de esta cliente es venta de comida, gaseosas y todo tipo de refresco, el marido la apoya trabajando con ella en el negocio, tiene seis años de experiencia y de tener el negocio, con nuestra institución tiene tres años de estar trabajando con créditos, con los cuales hasta la fecha ha sido muy responsable, estos créditos que le hemos otorgados le han ayudado para fortalecer más su negocio.
texts.en:
Milvia E. G. G. lives in the municipality of Posoltega in a section called La Virgin. She is a very hard-working young mother of two girls, the oldest is 15 and the other is younger. Both girls are in school. This client sells food, soft drinks, and all types of refreshments. Her husband supports her by helping her with the business. She has had this business for six years. For three years, she has been a loan client of this lending institution and has been very responsible to this day. These loans that she has been granted have helped her to better strengthen her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies such as chicken, rice, potatoes, soft drinks, bread, vegetables, and fruits to make natural beverages

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 61 años, es madre soltera y pertenece al banco comunal “Las hijas de Maria” de la Asociación Arariwa. Maria apoya a su hija Alicia que estudia Administración de Empresas. Maria trabajaba como asistenta social pues ayudaba a la gente en el aspecto de la vida social. Maria se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno para su hija y por horas se dedica atender su librería. La socia nos cuenta que se esta acercando la campaña escolar y requiere el préstamo para comprar cuadernos. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maria is 61 years old, a single mom and belongs to the community bank "Las hijas de Maria" (Maria's daughters) from the Arariwa Association. Maria supports her daughter Alicia that studies Business Administration. Maria used to work as a social assistant and helped people from a social life aspect. Maria gets up very early to do housework chores such as prepare breakfast for her daughter and then for hours she works at her bookstore. This member says that the school season is approaching and requests a loan to purchase notebooks. The member is grateful for this opportunity and commits to meet the corresponding scheduled repayment.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy notebooks

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 38 años, es madre soltera y pertenece al banco comunal “Las hijas de Maria” de la Asociación Arariwa. Juana apoya a su hija Caty que estudia Turismo. Juana alterna sus actividades del hogar con el negocio de fabricación de artesanía  de tipo muñequería. Juana es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que requiere el préstamo para implementar el restaurante que esta abriendo en la Av. Collasuyo en el distrito de Cusco pues va comprar ollas y cubiertos. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juana is 38 years old, a single mom and belongs to the community bank "Las hijas de Maria" (Maria's daughters) from the Arariwa Association. Juana supports her daughter Caty who studies Tourism. Juana alternates her housework chores with her craft business making dolls. Juana is an entrepreneurial and hardworking woman that requires a loan to implement a restaurant to be opened at Collasuyo Avenue in the district of Cusco, she needs to buy pots and cutlery. The member is grateful for the opportunity and commits to meet the repayment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pots and cutlery

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene L. is a 38-year-old married woman who lives in Barangay Culipapa, Hinobaan, Negros Occidental. Her husband, Richard, works as a fishermen and they have one child who is 15 years old and a student, but who also helps them run their business.

Arlene earns her living by running a fish vending business, selling in the local market or direct to the community whatever fish her husband catches. She also runs a battery-charging business.

Arlene joined NWTF-Project Dungganon (NWTF-PD ) in July 2002 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income, earning an average monthly income of Php 10,000 from her business activities.

Arlene is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 10,000 was used to fund operations of her fish vending business, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php 15,000 for her 12th loan which she again intends to use to cover the operations of her fish-vending business.

Arlene works hard to achieve her dreams and her aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital and to buy materials for fishing

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto  tiene 54 años, es casado. El socio trabaja en la municipalidad como auxiliar de operaciones en el Terminal terrestres de buses de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son 12 años que trabaja con el municipio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El socio también tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de cuyes actualmente cuenta con 50 cuyes y requiere el préstamo para comprar 50 cuyes más.  El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

Alberto  pertenece al banco comunal “Las hijas de Maria” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Alberto is 54 years old, and married. He works for the city as operations assistant in the Cuzco bus terminal. He has worked for the city for 12 years, and has done well, because he is a hard worker. He has a small business selling guinea pigs, and currently has 50 of these animals. He needs a loan to buy 50 more guinea pigs. He is grateful for the opportunity available here, and commits to repaying the loan per the schedule. Alberto belongs to the “Maria’s Daughters” communal bank, part of the Arariwa Association.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: This member needs a loan to buy 50 more guinea pigs.

loans.name: Len

texts.en:
Mrs. Len M. is 27 years old and she lives in Andoung Samretth village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare (3.75-acre) field on which she cultivates rice. Aside from farming she also raises pigs.

In order to support her farming and pig-raising, Mrs. Len M. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to dig a well to support the field crop. The rest of the loan she would use to buy more piglets and pig feed.

Mrs. Len M.’s husband, Mr. Vuth Chom, is a soldier and he is also a motorbike taxi driver who is able to make a small income to support the family living. Mrs. Len M. is the mother of a child who is a student in the local primary school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, dig a well, and buy more piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorn S. lives in Andoung Samretth village, Takeo province. She is 43 years old and is married with four children, one of whom is employed in the garment factory and the other three are students in the local school.

Mrs. Thorn S. and her husband, Mr. Thorn Kheav, are farmers who own a 3-hectare (7.5-acre) field they use to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, her husband is a fisherman who is able to make a small income to support the family.

Mrs. Thorn S. needs 2,000,000 Riel from AMK to buy a motorbike for transportation and to support the workplace.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transportation

loans.name: Gandolgor

texts.en:
Gandolgor is 41 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in Arhangai province, Mongolia. They live in a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent called “ger.”  Her two sons both attend a secondary school. 

Gandolgor operates a wooden products business with the help of her husband in their town. Her husband is responsible for making variety of wooden products such as tables, chairs, cupboards and so on, while Gandolgor is responsible for decorating and painting the products. They started their business in 1995 with working capital of 450,000 tugrugs (~320 USD). Over the years she has expanded and improved her business with working capital now reaching 4,500,000 tugrugs (~3200 USD). They are well known to residents of their town, because of their products' good quality and modern style. 

With their business profits, they were able to redesign and fix their home. To supplement to their earnings they also operate a meat trading business at a local market. Now they can fully support all of their family members' needs. She says, "For the future I want to expand my business." She is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase wood for her furniture business.

loans.use: Wood for furniture manufacture

loans.name: Erdenebaatar

texts.en: Erdenebaatar is 31 years old and lives with his wife and three sons in Arhangai province, Mongolia. They live in a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent called a “ger”. His oldest son aged 8 goes to school while his youngest two have not reached school age yet.  Since 2004, he and his wife have made Mongolian traditional shoes which they sell at a local market. At first their working capital was 200,000 tugrugs (~140 USD). Over the years he gained much experience and established strong customer base. Their products are well known amongst customers by their quality and style. Now their working capital has reached 700,000 tugrugs (~490 USD). With his earnings he was able to buy a car for family use. He says, “I want to expand my business for the future.” Erdenebaatar is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (approx. $350 USD) loan to purchase leather, glue and other necessary materials for his business.

loans.use: to purchase leather, glue and other necessary materials

loans.name: Sibul

texts.en: Mrs. Sibul Y. is 50 years old and lives in Angk Roveay village, Takeo province. She is a widow with four children, three of whom are silk weavers and one is a student in the local school. Mrs. Sibul Y. is a farmer who owns a piece of land used to cultivate rice. She also is a silk weaver at home who can make a small income to support her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. She decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk and supplies for her silk weaving. With the loans, her standard of living is improving and her income is increasing too.

loans.use: To buy more silk and supplies for her silk weaving

loans.name: Purevjav

texts.en: Purevjav is 57 years old and lives with her husband in Bayanzurh district, Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live in a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent called a “ger”. Her children are grown up and live on their own. Purevjav operates a grocery booth at National Historic Museum.  She sells candies, cookies, hot tea, hot coffee, etc. She started her business after working at a museum until retirement. For the future, she is planning to continue to maintain her business. She says, "I am happy to serve people who come to the museum.” Purevjav is requesting a 3,500,000-tugrug loan to purchase new tables and chairs for her grocery booth.

loans.use: To purchase new tables and chairs for her cafe

loans.name: Tsevelmaa

texts.en: Tsevelmaa is 46 years old and lives with her two children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her two children, between the ages of 19 and 23, are students. Tsevelmaa operates a clothing business out of a rented stall at a local market. She started her business in 1999 and her business progressed over the years.  She sells a variety of clothes such as pants, jackets, boots, shirts etc.  Now her working capital has reached 2,000,000 tugrugs (~1400 USD). She is a hardworking businesswoman and attributes her success to her good business sense and accounting skills. For the future, she is planning to expand her business and widen her product line. She says, “All I want is to be able to afford my children's education and help them to be better citizens.” Tsevelmaa is requesting an 800,000-tugrug loan in order to purchase more apparel from China.

loans.use: To purchase more apparel from China.

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en: Mrs. Chreb S. is 39 years old and lives in Andoung Samretth village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a two-hectare field used to cultivate rice to earn a living. She now faces a problem because she does not have enough money to support the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide and a pesticide container to support the crops. Her husband, Mr. Sein Chao, is a laborer in the local village. This couple has a child who is too young to study or work. Her husband is on the right in the picture

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide and a pesticide container

loans.name: Tsogjargal

texts.en: Tsogjargal is 33 years old and lives with his wife and twin children in a house in Arhangai province, Mongolia. His twin children attend a local secondary school. He operates a meat trading business with the help of his wife at a local market. He is responsible for purchasing and transporting meat and livestock from the countryside and his wife is responsible for selling. They sell a variety of meat to her customers at a stall in the local market. Tsogjargal started his business in 1998. His business currently operates at a stable level and he continues to make progress. He hopes to grow his business in the future and his continued success is very important, as he must support his family. He is requesting a 4,000,000-tugrug loan to purchase more meat in order to increase his sales.

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Sao's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sao O., 36 years old, is the representative of the loan group, which consists of eight people. She lives in Prey Phnhi village in Takeo province. She is married with five children. One of her children is a silk weaver, three are students in the local school and one is just three years old. Mrs. Sao O. and her husband, Mr. Ly Hean, are farmers who own a piece of land used to cultivate rice. In addition to farming, they are silk weavers. Since their business is going well, Mrs. Sao O. decided to ask for a loan to buy more silks for weaving. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more silks

loans.name: Kea's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Kea P. is 43 years old. She is the leader of a group bank loan, which consists of six people, located in Krang Pou village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Thol Paok, are farmers who own a two-hectare field used to cultivate rice. They do not have enough money to support the farm, therefore, Mrs. Kea P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pay for hire someone to do the plowing. Mrs. Kea P. is the mother of four children who all are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for hire plowing.

loans.name: Sarith's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sarith T., 45 years old, is a widow with one child who is a farmer. They both live in Svay Prey village, Takeo province. Mrs. Sarith T. is a farmer who owns a plot of land used to cultivate rice. Although she tries to work hard in her field, she still doesn't earn enough income to support the famiL.. So she decided to ask for a loA. to bU. rice to sell. With this new business, she will increase her income and improve her standard of living, she hopes. All the members are shown but some of them are blocked.

loans.use: To buy rice to sell

loans.name: Nhav's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Nhav I. is 38 years old. She is the representative of a group that consists of four people. Mrs. Nhav I. is married with three children who are all students I. the local school. This family lives I. Trapeang Srangae village I. Takeo province. Mrs. Nhav I. is a farmer who owns a plot of land used to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Ouk Kong, is a construction worker who makes a small income to support the family. Mrs. Nhav I. needs 800,000 Riel to buy a cow for breeding to improve and increase her income I. order to support her family.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Say's Group

texts.en: Mr. Say N. is 47 years old. He is the leader of a group village loan, which consists of four people. They are located in Pump Edth village, Takeo province. Mr. Say N. is a farmer who owns a 2.5-hectare field used to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Pheav Koem, plants crop (corn, vegetable, bean, etc). In order to support his farming and his wife's plantation, Mr. Say N. is requesting a loan to buy a water machine and fertilizer. Mr. Say N. is has seven children. Two of the children are employed in the garment factory, four are students in the local school and one is too young to study or work. Mr. Chhorn N. and Mr. Eam N. did not take a loan but their wives are taking the loan instead of them.

loans.use: To buy a water machine and fertilizer

loans.name: Elmer Enrique

texts.es:
Elmer Enrique a sus 23 años  de edad, tiene una tienda llamada “La Rebaja” que  iniciò hace 5 años con la ayuda de su padre, quien le apoyó su potencial de trabajador independiente  y por eso pudo desarrollar su iniciativa emprendedora en esta actividad comercial con la que puede ayudar a su familia;  él vive en un barrio  popular que reconoce como tranquilo, donde habitan personas en condición de desplazamiento, el cual está  ubicado en  Soledad, municipio de tierras planas, cenagosas y  cercanas al río Magdalena, que forma parte del área metropolitana de la ciudad de  Barranquilla.
Elmer es un padre soltero que sueña con impulsar los estudios profesionales de su hijo, que en la actualidad tiene tres años de edad; por eso no se aleja de su meta  que es trabajar para posteriormente poder estudiar una carrera técnica, que le permita aumentar su nivel académico y tener  la oportunidad de construir un mejor vivir para el y para su familia. Es así como todos sus esfuerzos están dirigidos a invertir en su negocio para verlo crecer y lograr su constante estabilidad; en la actualidad solicita su primer crédito por valor de $2.000.000, el que planea invertir en la compra de víveres, como arroz, azúcar, aceite, sal y granos, así  puede ofrecer mayor diversidad a sus clientes y responder a sus necesidades  con efectividad. 
Elmer a su edad es un empresario  innovador en su tienda, es consciente de las oportunidades que le brinda el mercado porque conoce y aprovecha los picos altos de cada uno de sus productos, está atento a hacer la oferta pertinente, tiene sus instalaciones  ordenadas y aplica  merchandising  para reafirmar o muchas veces cambiar la conducta de compra, a favor de los artículos más rentables que ofrece en su negocio; èl  siempre intenta  llamar la atención, de sus cliente y utiliza estrategias mercadologicas atractivas en  cada temporada   para  insentivar el consumo de sus productos
texts.en:
Elmer Enrique, at 23 years of age, has a store called "La Rebaja" ("The Discount") that he started 5 years ago with the help of his father, who supported his potential as a self-employed worker. For this reason he was able to develop his entreprenurial spirit in this business that he uses to help his family. He lives in a humble neighborhood that he considers a calm place, where displaced people live. It is located in Soledad, a region of flat and muddy lands close to the Magdalena River, that forms part of the metropolitan area of the city of Barranquilla.

Elmer is a single father who dreams of stimulating the education of his son, who is now three years old. For this reason he does not stray from his goal of working in order to later study a technical career that will enable him to move up academically and have the opportunity to construct a better life for himself and for his family. All his efforts are directed toward investing in his business to see it grow and to achieve a constant state of stability. He is now asking for his first loan of $2,000.00 that he plans to use to buy groceries like rice, sugar, oil, salt, and grains to be able to offer greater variety to his customers and effectively respond to their needs.

At his age, Elmer is an innovative business man in his store. He is aware of the opportunities that the market gives him because he recognizes and takes advantage of the peak prices of each one of his products. He is careful to make responsible sales, his displays are organized, and he uses merchandising to reaffirm or, many times, to change shopping habits to promote the more profitable products of his business. He always tries to capture his customers' attention and he uses appealing marketing techniques every season to encourage the sale of his products.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries like rice, sugar, oil, salt, and grains

loans.name: Antonio Josè

texts.es:
Para Antonio José la zapatería siempre ha sido en pan de cada día en su casa, pues es una  tradición familiar que él ha continuado; Su negocio de elaboración de calzado iniciò cuando desde muy temprana edad ayudaba a su papá en el oficio; este fuè su primera fuente de aprendizaje, donde aprendió a valerse por si mismo,  para posteriormente trabajar en varias empresas de calzado en la que fortaleció su experiencia inicial;  como sus ganancias como empleado  no le satisfacían, porque tenia el deseo de ser independiente,  dio el gran salto e iniciò su primera unidad de negocio con mucho esfuerzo y  desde hace cuatro años tiene un taller donde fabrica calzado para damas caballeros y para niños, los cuales produce  por encargo de sus clientes.
Antonio diseña los modelos de acuerdo a la moda, requerimientos y necesidades de sus clientes, su reto mas significativo es la innovación para estar a la vanguardia, por eso debe estar atento a   revistas especializadas, visitar almacenes de calzado, observar los artistas, en fin estar pendiente por todos los medios de la oferta, la demanda y la moda, pues debe ofrecer a su cliente lo mejor.    
Antonio, tiene 35 años y es una persona alegre y tranquila, vive en su casa del Municipio de Soledad, la tierra de la butifarra-embutido y el bollo de yuca, que està ubicado en el Departamento del Atlántico; es casado y tiene dos hijos de 11 y 14 años a quien quiere ver estudiando insistentemente,  para que sean unos profesionales con oportunidades de bienestar; quiere que su negocio crezca pues ello le representa mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.
Este es el primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y solicita $1.500.000, dinero que invertirá en la compra de materias primas en un mayor volumen, como material sintético para capelladas, suelas,  cuero, puntillas y especialmente en pegantes; él sueña con tener  su propia línea de calzado y se prepara gradualmente para ese fin.
texts.en:
For Antonio José, shoemaking has always been the source of his family’s income because it’s a family tradition that he is now continuing. His shoemaking business began when he was still a young boy and he used to help his father. This was his first training in this field, where he learned how to be on his own. Later on, he worked for several shoemaking companies where he deepened his knowledge and experience. However, his salary as an employee was not sufficient because he wanted to be independent. He took the leap and started his own business. It was quite an effort but, for the last four years, he has had his own cobbler’s shop where he manufactures shoes for women, men and children. He works based on prior orders from his customers. Antonio designs the shoes according to the latest fashions and his customer’s needs and wishes. His greatest challenge is to be up-to-date on innovations so that he can always be on the cutting edge of his field so he must be aware of what’s in the latest kraft journals, he must visit shoe stores, observe artists, and do whatever is necessary to be tuned into supply, demand, and the latest fashions, in order to offer his customers the very best. Antonio is 35 years old and is a cheerful and calm person. He lives in his own house, which is in Atlántico department. He’s married and has two children, 11 and 14 years old, who he wants to see intensely studying so that they may become professionals with opportunities for well-being. He wants his business to grow because that represents improving his family’s standard of living. This is his first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation; he’s asking for $1.500.000 which will be used to buy raw materials in larger quantities such as, synthetic strap material, soles, leather, toe pieces, especially glue-on. He hopes some day to have his own line of shoes and is gradually preparing himself for that end.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoemaking raw materials.

loans.name: Phat Tuy Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phat T. is 48 years old and is the group leader of a 15 person group.

Mrs. Phat T. is a widow with three children, one of whom works in a garment factory, while another is a student in the local school, while the youngest is only 5 years old. They all live in Pris Leu village, Takeo province.

Mrs. Phat T. is a farmer who owns a 2-hectar field used to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, she also breeds pigs to earn a small income to support her family. In other to increase her income and improve her family's lifestyle, she is requesting a 800,000 loan from AMK to buy more pigs and pig food for breeding.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and pig food

loans.name: Bou's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bou S. lives in Prey Chheu village, Takeo province and is representing a group of four people. This group loan will be used to purchase more materials, supplies and other items that will help to improve the lifestyle of the group members and their families.

Mrs. Bou S. is a silk weaver. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it through a loan to buy more silks.

Mrs. Bou S. is 41 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is artist, while another supports her in her business while the youngest is 13 years old. Her husband, ChroE. Nut is a farmer who owns a plot of land used to cultivate rice in order to earn a small income to support his family.

loans.use: To buy more silks

loans.name: Paterno

texts.en:
Paterno is a 45 year old father of six. Paterno is a rice farmer and he strives to support his children through hard work. He wants to continue to send his children to school so they can finish their studies. His eldest child is 18 years old.

Paterno wants to improve his farming and increase his earnings. He heard about Community Economic Ventures, Inc. that offers financial assistance to entrepreneurs like him. He joined and requested a loan of 15,000 Php to support his farming business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his rice farm

loans.name: Choeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Choeurn N. is forty-six years old and lives in Daeum Pou Village, Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Ly Ngoun are farmers who own a three-hectare field to cultivate rice. As they try to farm their land, they find themselves facing a problem: the soil in their field is not fertile. Mrs. Choeurn N. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and she would use the rest of the loan to buy piglets for breeding. She hopes to increase her family's income and improve the family's living situation with this loan. Mrs. Choeurn N. is the mother of three children; two of her children are farmers, and the other is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and piglets for breeding

loans.name: Nelen

texts.en:
Nelen is fifty-four years old and living in Norala, South Cotabato. She has a business raising hogs and farming rice. She is the mother of seven children; her eldest is thirty years old. She receives enough income for her family when she has a good harvest from the farm.

She would like to request a loan of PHP 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to purchase inputs for her farm.  This is very helpful to sustain her family and business.

loans.use: Inputs for her farm

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa, who is forty-seven years old, has a rice-farming business. She started her business in 2008, and now she is managing a rice field in Norala, South Cotabato. To supplement her income from farming, she also sells peanuts around her community. She is the mother of six children, and she works diligently to proviD. for her family's basic needs.

She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to help finance her farm. With this amount, she will be able to buy seeds and farm supplies, as well as peanuts to sell.

loans.use: Seeds, farm supplies, and peanuts

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en: Mrs. Khorn S. is 48 years old and she is lives in Daeum Pou village, Takeo province.  She is married with four children, one of whom is employed in the garment factory and the others are students in the local school. Mrs. Khorn S. and her husband, Mr. Lorn Pil, are farmers who own a 3-hectare field used to cultivate rice. In order to support the field, Mrs. Khorn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline. In addition to being a farmer, Mrs. Khorn S. is a grocer who can make a small income to support her family.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Neim

texts.en: Mrs. Neim S. is 54 years old. She lives in Andoung Samretth village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5- hectare field used to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Rim Tom, is a construction worker. In order to support her husband's workplace, Mrs. Neim S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorcycle for her husband's transportation and to pay the expense for her crop. Mrs. Neim S. is a mother of two children, one of whom is a construction worker while another one is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her husband

loans.name: Syprose

texts.en: Syprose A. O. is 43 years old, married and has three children between the ages of 12 and 5. Her business is located at Jua kali in Kisumu. It is situated in a busy market where she is able to catch a large market to purchase her goods. She sells foodsuffs, e.g doughnuts, soft drinks, water and cooking fat. She has been selling to the local people for six years now and she says that the major challenge is the many people in that area who are involved in the same business as hers. So her customers are spoiled by the choice. She is using her loan to add stock to grow her business. She wants the food stall to grow and then she will make it a hotel some day. She hopes to make enough money to give her children a quality education some day. She is a very hardworking and patient lady.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuff

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mrs. Mon S. is 29 years old and she lives in Tuol Kandal village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare field for cultivating rice. In order to support the field crop, Mrs. Mon S. decided to ask for a loan to buy two oxen.

Her husband, Mr. Sarvuth Orn is a duck breeder who can earn a small income by selling duck eggs to support his family's living. Mrs. Mon S. is the mother of three children, one of whom is a student at the local school while the other two are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy two oxen

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en:
Ganbold is 51 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a Mongolian ger. In 1997 he started his own transportation business by himself. Today he still runs that business with his son-in-law. Along with his transportation services, he has started to build a carpentry/building company. He builds gers as well as furniture and has already received two orders for wood for gers.

With a loan he will buy much-needed tools and wood. Wood is expensive. He needs a saw and a wood plane, as well as cedar wood and ebony for making furniture. His daughter, 21-year-old Delgermaa, is at school training to become a hairdresser, and his son, 22-year-old Altanbagana, helps with his dad’s business but has plans to get a job. Ganbold is an industrious, honest hard worker. He plans to make the business successful enough so that he can get a building in which to work and make it better.

loans.use: To purchase a saw and a wood plane, cedar wood and ebony for making furniture

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia N. M. is 35 years old, married and has five children. Her business is located at Ndunyu Sabuk in Thika. She sells cabbages, kale, bananas, potatoes, etc. She has been serving local people especially those who live in or near Ndunyu Sabuk.

She has been doing this business for the last five years. Her major challenge has been competition as there are many people in that area who are engaged in the same kind of business as hers. However, she is determined to expand her business and that is why she is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to restock her business. In future she wants to be the market leader in vegetable supply. She is hardworking and innovative.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Mrs. Soy K. is 61 years old and she lives in Spueu village, Takeo province. She is married, with three children who are all employed in the garment factory. Mrs. Soy K. and her husband, Mr. Phart Keit, are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare field for cultivating rice. In this plantation, they do not have cows to support their field crop, so Mrs. Soy K. is requesting a loan to buy two oxen for plowing and supporting their farming. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy two oxen

loans.name: Movlud

texts.en: Movlud I. was born in 1969. He is married and has four children. I.'s family live in the Khachmaz region. He is a dressmaker and has been in this business for five years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorn L. is 44 years old and she lives with her family in Thmei village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Torng Ouk, are farmers. Although they try to work hard with the field, they still earn less income to support the family. In order to increase their income and improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. Thorn L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow and four piglets for breeding. She will use the rest of the loan to buy pig food.

Mrs. Thorn L. has four children, two of whom are employed in the garment factory and the other two are students in the local school. Her husband is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow and four piglets for breeding, and pig food

loans.name: Samen

texts.en:
Mr. Samen S. is 36 years old and lives with his family in Samchat village, Takeo province. He and wife, Mrs. Sarom Prak, are farmers who own a 1.7-hectare field for cultivating rice. They now face a problem with their farming because they do not have enough money to support the field. Thus, Mr. Samen S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline for supporting the farming crop. 

Mr. Samen S. is also a construction worker and can earn a small salary to support his family members. He is the father of three children, two of whom are students in the local school and the other one is too young to study or work. His wife is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Hikmat

texts.en: Hikmat N. is a young man who is married and has a child. Hikmat is 33 years old and with his family lives in the Fuzuli region. He has been in this business for six years. Now Hikmat needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy four calves to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy four calves

loans.name: Chhan

texts.en:
Mr. Chhan Y. is 44 years old and lives in Prey Prum village, Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Hy Chheng, are farmers who own a plot of land for cultivating rice. They now face some problems with their farming because their field has infertile soil and does not have enough water to support the field crop.

Thus, Mr. Chhan Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy seed rice, fertilizer, pesticide and a water machine for supporting the crop. Mr. Chhan Y. has four children, one of whom owns supplies like tables, chairs, stores, etc. which have been hired by villagers during wedding ceremonies and other parties. Two of his children are students in the local school while the other one is too young to study or work. His wife is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy seed rice, fertilizer, pesticide and a water machine

loans.name: Reaksmey

texts.en:
Mrs. Reaksmey U. is 43 years old and lives in Angk Roveay village, Takeo province. She is a silk middleman and is also a silk weaver. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to bU. more silks to sell and to support her silk weaving.

With this loan, she hopes to increase her income and improve the family's living conditions. Her husband, Mr. Leng Tin, works as a truck driver and is on the left of the picture. Mrs. Reaksmey U. is the mother of two children who are both silk weavers at home.

loans.use: To buy more silks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Neng

texts.en: Mrs. Neng M. is 65 years old and she lives  in Prey Kabbas Kha village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Mav Teang (pictured at left), are farmers.  They own a 1.36-hectare field where they cultivate rice.  They now face a problem because they do not have enough money to support their crop.  Mrs. Neng M. is asking for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support her farm. Mrs. Neng M. has a child who is also a farmer.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mr. Seng N. is 34 years old and he lives in Srae Vong village, Takeo province. He is a farmer and owns 1 hectare, where he cultivates rice. To support his crop, Mr. Seng N. is seeking a loan for irrigation, fertilizer and pesticide. His wife, Mrs. Sokha Sok (pictured at left), sells salt in the local village. Mr. Seng N. has two children.  One is a student in the local school, the other is too young to study or work.

loans.use: For irrigation, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Pot

texts.en: Pot C. is a humble citizen who currently lives with other family members in a commune of Kampong Chhnang province. She is married with five school-aged children. Her husband helps to support the family by working as a district consultant adviser. Pot C. is a professional Khmer lecturer who earns a fixed salary of $3 per day to be used to feed her family. Beside this, the family cultivates rice during the farming season. In the past, Pot C. hired a cow to help plow her farmland.  She is seeking a loan to purchase an ox, so that she can plow the land without paying to rent a cow.

loans.use: To purchase an ox

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en: Taleh was born in 1981. He is married and has two children. G.'s family lives in the Fuzuli region. Taleh G. has been in this business for four years. Now, Taleh needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy fruits and vegetables to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Chory

texts.en: Mrs. Chory M. is 60 years old and she lives in Khvav village in Takeo province. She is widow with two children, one of whom is a basket-maker and the other one is a coconut-seller. Chory is a farmer; she is a basket-maker also. Although she tries to work hard with both businesses, she still earns less income than she needs to support her standard of living, so she wants to start a new business. She decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income and improve her support of the family.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Prum

texts.en:
Mr. Prum B. is 32 years old and lives with another family member in Kampong Chhnang Province. He inherited a plot of land from his grandparents, who died of senility years ago. On this land he plants crops, including rice and vegetables, from which he earns a living. 

He is a widower with three kids who are going to school or work as temporary laborers. Prum B. complains that his current income is not adequate to support his family. He wants to improve his family's finances with the assistance of Kiva's project partner, HKL, in order to invest in a new suitable trade. 

He requested a loan of $1050 to buy many pairs of oxen, which he will sell and hire to get extra income.

loans.use: To buy many pairs of oxen.

loans.name: Koem Srun

texts.en:
Mrs. Koem Srun T. is 29 years old, and she lives in Trapeang Chrey village in Takeo province. She is a farmer. She needs 1,000,000 KHR from AMK to buy rice seed and fertilizer for supporting her crop. 

Her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Ven, a construction worker in a private company, can make a small salary to support his family.  Mrs. Koem Srun is the mother of three children, one of whom is a student in the local school, and the others are too young to study or work. 

Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun L. is 51 years old and a widow with six children. One of them is employed in the garment factory, another one is a coconut-seller, and the other four are students in the local school. They all are living in Khvav village in Takeo province. 

Mrs. Savoeun L. is a farmer who owns a one-hectare field where she cultivates rice. Although she tries to work hard on this farm, she still earns less income than she needs to support her family. She decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. With the loan, she hopes to increase her income and improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
Mrs. Yin K., 36, is a rice farmer who has a partner in her husband, who assists her in planting crops. Besides their crop-growing business, the couple raised a few pigs in a stall next to their house. They plan to sell all the pigs when they come to maturity. 

The couple was married many years ago and now they have two school-aged kids. Yin K. is excellent at raising pigs and she has been widely known for this skill for a long time. 

Yin K. is taking out her first loan to buy more piglets to breed.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to breed.

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Mrs. Vann U. was born in 1969 and she was married many years ago to Mr. Bieng Hen, age 43. They are local rice cultivators. This couple has five children, four of whom are attending school, and the other one helps feed the family by driving a taxi. 

Vann U. has been planning to invest in a new enterprise line in order to improve her family's income, but she doesn’t have enough money to start the process. Therefore, she has requested a loan to buy many sets of spare parts for general, everyday machinery to sell. She is hopeful that this will provide her with additional income. 

Note: Vann U. was not available, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy many sets of spare parts of general machines.

loans.name: Djalal

texts.en:
"I am very thankful to Kiva lenders for their help in improving my business."

Djalal is applying to Kiva for his second loan. As you know from his first loan, he runs a taxi business and this has not changed. However, he changed his car and now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy spare parts for this car.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Vy

texts.en:
Mrs. Vy B. is 23 years old and she lives in Khvav village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land for cultivating rice. 

Her husband, Mr. Bros Pov Lorn, is a battery-seller who earns a small income to support the couple. They have no children. 

Since her husband's business is going well, Vy wants to expand it to increase their income and improve their standard of living. She decided to ask for a loan to buy more batteries to sell. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more batteries for selling

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Mr. Suon N. is highly skilled at building stone and wooden houses. He has a few physical laborers to help provide his service. He receives a lot of orders from his clients to construct their houses. 

He has another partner in his wife, who appears in the picture above. She sells meat to people who eat it with beer or wine in the village. 

Mr. Suon N. has three children, one of whom is married and lives independently, and the other two are students and dependent on him. Mr. Suon N. has been paying money for taxis to get to work because he doesn't own a vehicle. To solve this problem, he is applying for a loan to purchase a new motorcycle, which will allow him to commute to his work location.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
Tep S. is 58 years of age and a married woman. In order to meet the needs of the family, Tep S. sells a little grocery inventory out of her home. She has been engaged in this business for three years and earns approximately $3 per day. To help contribute to the family's needs, her husband works in construction and also assists her with selling. They have been married for many years and they have two school-aged and two married children. 

Tep S. hopes to expand her business and is applying for a loan to be used to buy supplies of grocery items to sell.

loans.use: To buy supplies of grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en: Mrs. Sreng V., age 31, is a vegetable seller. She has been engaged in this business for years, and is earning approximately $2 each day. She has a partner in her husband, who is a goldsmith and sells jewelry in the local market. The couple have three school-aged children who are dependent on the profit they earn in their businesses. Sreng V. saw that selling jewelry is a profitable business which provided her family with needed income. So, she would like to increase this business by requesting a loan through HKL. She will buy more supplies of jewelry for her husband to sell.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of jewelry for her husband to sell.

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en: Mrs. Vuthy P. is 32 years old, and she is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Sokhun Dey, is a motorbike taxi driver who owns an old motorbike to support their family living. They are villagers in Phnum Lonteah village, in Takeo province. This family has a problem because their motorbike is old and breaks down. In order to support her husband, Mrs. Vuthy P. decided to ask for a loan amount 1,500,000 Rail from AMK to buy a new motorbike to replace the old one. The couple has three children, two of whom are studying in the local public school, while the other child is too young to study or work. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is 44-year-old and married with 3 young children. He has owned a car repair shop in his town for the past 20 years. He is specialized in repairing all type of cars and is well known in the whole region. Thanks to his business, he was able over the years to take care of his family and better his life situation. With the help of the loan he requested for $1,200, Hussein plans to enlarge his business by buying badly needed spare parts.

loans.use: To buy badly needed spare parts.

loans.name: Mungu Tubaliki Group

texts.en:
Antonia K. is 52 years old, is widowed and has six children. Since 1986 she has been managing her own butcher shop from where she sells meat and chicken. Additionally she expanded the business to feed and grow her own chickens. Antonia works fifteen hours a day and currently earns 750,000 Tanzanian shillings a month (approx. 560 USD).

This will be Antonia’s tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans she grew her chicken business and she hopes to obtain this loan to open a small greengrocery. 

Antonia will share this loan with her loan group comprised of fourteen other men and women from her community. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

In the photo, Antonia is seated in the center of the first row and is wearing a white T-shirt and white pants.

loans.use: To start a greengrocery

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alihuseyn

texts.en:
Alihuseyn was born in 1952. He is single and lives in Baku city. He has been in the business of raising cattle for 8 years. 

Alihuseyn is requesting a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 5 calves to improve and increase the size of his business.

loans.use: to buy 5 calves

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.en:
Jhonny is a 28-year-old single man who lives with his parents and brother. In 2005, he opened his own bakery business in his town. Jhonny caters for a wide range of customers in his village and surrounding neighborhoods. He bakes all kinds of Lebanese bread, cookies, etc.  He is grateful for his work because it allows him to control his economic situation. 

Today, Jhonny is requesting to borrow $1,200 USD to renovate his bakery and purchase an electronic oven. In this way, he hopes to develop his business and attract more customers.

loans.use: To renovate his bakery and purchase an electronic oven

loans.name: Channly

texts.en:
Mrs. Channly N. and her husband, Mr. Oreng Oroun, are farmers who support their family by cultivating rice on a small piece of land. They have five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. The family lives in Phnum Lonteah village, Takeo Province.
Although they work hard, the couple still earn insufficient income to support their family. Therefore, Mrs. Channly N. wants to start a new business charging batteries for local villagers. As she does not have enough money to buy supplies to start the business, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a new machine to charge batteries.

loans.use: To buy a new battery-charging machine

loans.name: Houda

texts.en:
Houda is a 29-year-old married mother of one child. In 2004, after having her first child, she decided to help her husband in supporting the household by selling accessories and working as a hairdresser from the home. Over the years, she has been able to build up a growing number of customers for her beauty service and accessories business.
Today, Houda is requesting to borrow $1,000 USD to buy additional accessories and beauty products for her customers. She hopes that this will help her increase her income.

loans.use: To buy accessories and beauty products

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch N. is 39 years old and a villager from Chi Khmol village, Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Maney Soung, is a laborer in a local village. The couple has two children who attend the local school.
The family has had some problems because while this is a rice-growing season, they have not had enough money to support their rice field, especially since the soil is infertile and there are a lot of insects. Therefore, Mrs. Touch N. decided to apply for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticide and rice seeds. With the rest of the loan, she would like to hire laborers to plow the rice field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticide, rice seeds, and hire laborers to plow the field

loans.name: United Friends Group

texts.en:
Fatu S. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called United Friends. She is 34 years old, married, and has one child, aged 17, who is a high school graduate preparing for college. She also takes cares of an adopted child. Fatu and her family live and work on Peace Island in Paynesville, near Monrovia, Liberia. Fatu is a high school graduate who now studies computer software at vocational school.
Fatu's business is selling clothes. She buys her goods from neighboring Guinea and sells them to residents of her community in Paynesville. She has been running this business for four years and hopes to establish a boutique in the near future.
Fatu started her clothes business with 14,000 LRD that was given to her by her friends. She sells her goods at wholesale prices in order to encourage customers to continue buying from her. Fatu is requesting a loan to purchase additional clothes for resale to improve her business. She dreams of educating her children so that they can have a good future.
In the photo, Fatu is holding the group sign.

About LEAP
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes for resale

loans.name: Orzu

texts.en:
Orzu is 52 years old and lives with his wife and two children. He is a humble farmer full of vitality and youth. From his young age, Orzu has been devoted to agricultural tasks. Now, he is the father, which represents a deeper commitment to independently sustain his family through farming. Orzu mainly cultivates onions, potatoes, carrots etc. This father works hard because he wishes to see his children become great professionals and wants his family to prosper economically. Orzu asks for this loan with which he will purchase mineral fertilizer, seeds and other items that are necessary for the preparation of his farmland.       
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Sulton

texts.en:
Sulton is 30 years old, married has one child. His wife makes a living as a teacher. Sulton is 6 years removed from having started his small convenience store when he was unemployed and needed a way to pay the bills. His biggest dream is to have a general store where he can sell household products as well as cosmetics. With the loan Sulton expects to keep growing little by little and with the earnings he'll keep improving his quality of life and economic situation along with his business until he achieves his goal. His wish in life is to see his child as professional with prosperous businesses.

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 45 years old and married with four children, ages 8, 9, 10, and 12, and all of the children are attending school. He is a dairy farmer in the Nkubu area near Mount Kenya. He's been in this business for 15 years and sells fine beans, bananas, and milk to local brokers. Previously, he worked as the middle-man, buying bananas from farms and selling them in Nairobi. He says that the main challenge to his business are diseases that affect the dairy cow.

He has successfully repaid two previous loans through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 20,000 and 45,000 and requested this loan for Kes. 70,000 to purchase a dairy cow. John says that the dairy cow will provide milk for his children to drink as well as income to help him provide an education for his children. In the future, he would like to expand his dairy farming with a better cow shed.

John added that loans from Juhudi have really helped because he has gotten both income and manure for his farm from the dairy cows.

About Juhudi Kilimo

Juhudi Kilimo is an innovative, for-profit social enterprise working with smallholder farmers in Kenya. Juhudi directly finances dairy cows, chickens, agricultural equipment, and other assets that are specifically chosen to create immediate cash flow. Many of the assets are insured to prevent devastating business losses, and targeted technical assistance is provided to farmers, from agricultural training to basic bookkeeping and local market research. For its clients and their families, Juhudi also offers life insurance and a medical aid program. Through all these services, Juhudi is creating sustainable growth and employment in rural communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Chepkwony

texts.en:
Chepkwony is a 26-year-old entrepreneur and dairy farmer in the Litein area of the South Rift Valley of Kenya. He's been farming for five years and employs two people. He sells his milk through Kenya Cooperative Creameries and also earns income from a small general store. He previously worked as a motorbike taxi driver. He says that the main challenge to his business is unreliable employees that require close supervision.

He requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 80,000 to purchase a dairy cow, after successfully repaying a previous loan for 45,000. He says he is enjoying good financial services through Juhudi which might not have been available to him otherwise. In the future, he would like to build a modern house, own his own car, and stabilize his family with increased income from farming.

About Juhudi Kilimo

Juhudi Kilimo is an innovative, for-profit social enterprise working with smallholder farmers in Kenya. Juhudi directly finances dairy cows, chickens, agricultural equipment, and other assets that are specifically chosen to create immediate cash flow. Many of the assets are insured to prevent devastating business losses, and targeted technical assistance is provided to farmers, from agricultural training to basic bookkeeping and local market research. For its clients and their families, Juhudi also offers access to medical aid. Through all these services, Juhudi is creating sustainable growth and employment in rural communities across Kenya.

texts.en: Fouad is a 45-year-old married man with four children, two of whom are unemployed. He has owned a coffee shop since 2008 and has been involved in this type of work for the past 20 years. He offers all types of tea, coffee and Lebanese tobacco to his customers. Today, Fouad is asking for a loan of $1,200 USD to renovate and decorate his shop in order to attract more customers and increase his income.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is 40 years old and single. He has owned a restaurant in his town since 2000. The specialty in his restaurant is a special Lebanese food called falafel, and Hasan is well known in his region for this delicious food. He opened his restaurant after seeing a need for such services in his locality. His business idea was successful and allows him to control his life situation. Today, Hasan is requesting to borrow $1,000 USD to increase his inventory and meet customer demand.

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en: NidA., a 34-year-old single woman living with her mother and eight siblings, has worked as a beautician for the past seven years. After gaining experience in this field, she started working from her home where she set aside a speciA. room for the business. Over time, she has built up a good customer base, and with her business income, she helps her older brother take care of the family and its needs. Today, NidA. is asking to borrow $800 to renovate her beauty implements.

loans.use: To renovate her beauty implements

loans.name: Mame Bousso

texts.fr: Mame Bousso T. est une femme de 27 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants et a la garde de 2 autres enfants qu'on lui a confiés. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WALIDANE depuis 5 ans et a eu 10 expériences avec le crédit. Son prêt lui permet de développer une activité de restauration. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mame Bousso T. is a 27-year-old married mother of four children, and has two other children who have been placed in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group of Walidane for 5 years, and has had 10 previous loan experiences. Her loan will allow her to develop a food preparation business. She contributes to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her commercial activity

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal is a 30-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children.

Kamal has been working in construction since 2007. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to purchase all the needed tools. Now, he requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and a machine for his work. This is his third loan and he has always repaid on time.

Kamal is special in his work because he does a good work. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. He decided doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In future, he plans on improving his business by purchasing more sophisticated tools.

loans.use: To purchase tools and a machine for his work

loans.use: To buy stock in bulk

loans.name: Pablo Enrique

texts.es:
Pablo R., tiene 40 años, es casado y es padre de 2 jòvenes  de 16 y 21 años de edad;  su vivienda está ubicada en el sur de la ciudad de Bogotá, cercado por el Rio San Cristobal; esta localidad es bien reconocida en la ciudad y en toda Colombia, porque su principal actividad económica  es la venta de calzado y de los insumos para su fabricación. Pablo nacido en La Vega municipio del departamento de Cundinamarca, que por su temperatura media: 22 °C. es llamado el Barrio caliente de Bogotá, hace 8 años iniciò su negocio “La Esperanza del Milenio, en una zona modesta vendiendo al detal  viveres y articulos de aseo; pero buscando mejores oportunidades comerciales desde hace 4 años se mudò de barrio y es en la localidad mencionada en la que ahora reside, la cual está considerada como una de las mejores plazas de Bogotà, por estar  influenciada por actividades  de producciòn, comercio y servicios  financiero,actualmente muy cercanas a su tienda. Su incursiòn en el comercio fuè impulsada por el desempleo que lo obligò a experimentar nuevas opciones  que  le sirvieran para el sostenimiento de su familia, desde ese momento  puso al descubierto la capacidad emprendedora y fortaleza de caracter que hoy lo caracterizan.
Iniciò en la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo  en el año 2002 con un credito por valor de  $800.000, desde entonces  ha accedido a cuatro gradualmente aumentados, los cuales ha reembolsado  puntualmente, dando muestras en cada una de sus acciones de honestidad y amplio sentido de responsabilidad; Pablo dice que el negocio cambiò su vida, mejorò su forma de trabajar y lo ha visto crecer: especialmente porque ha podido reinvertir sus utilidades en activos fijos, lo que hace visible su ampliaciòn.  Su meta està relacionada con fortalecerlo, buscando incrementar los tiempos de descanso, mejorar su flujo de caja y ofrecer mejores productos .
Su salud es su maximo desafio y acude a su fortaleza para conseguirla,  porque desde hace 2 años se ha quebrantado, pero dice, que ha logrado estabilizase mediante tratamientos bioenergeticos lo que  no  ha permitido que sus dolencias avancen.  
En la actualidad aplica a un credito por valor de $2.000.000 dirigido a aumentar el inventario de utiles escolares, refrescos, dulces, làcteos y comestibles en general, que lo ayudarà a hacer una oferta diversificada y sostenida de los productos que tienen mayor rotaciòn en su stand.
texts.en:
Pablo R. is 40 and married. He has two children, 16 and 21. His house is located in the southern part of Bogotá. Surrounded by Lake San Cristobal, this location is well known in the city and in all of Columbia for the sale of footwear and the supplies to make the footwear. Pablo was born in the La Vega municipality in the department of Cundinamarca. The average temperature is 22° C. It is called the hot neighborhood of Bogotá. He started his business, La Esperanza del Milenio, eight years ago in a modest area selling food and cleaning products. Looking for other commercial opportunities, he moved neighborhoods four years ago, and he now lives in the above mentioned area. It is considered to be one of the best plazas in Bogotá because it is influenced by production, commerce, and financial services, which are currently very close to his store. His entrance into commerce was driven by unemployment that obligated him to try different options, which would serve to support his family. At that time he discovered his entrepreneurial capacity and his now characteristic strength of character. He started with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation in 2002 with a loan for 800,000 COP. From then on he has had four, gradually larger loans. He has repaid them punctually, demonstrating honesty and a big sense of responsibility in each one of his actions. Pablo says that the business changed his life. He improved his way of working, and he has seen his business grow, especially because he was able to reinvest his profits into fixed assets. This made his expansion clear. His goal is related to strengthening it, looking to increase time off, improving his cash flow, and offering better products. His health is his biggest challenge. He looks to his strength to meet the challenge. Two years ago he was hurt, but he says that he has been stabilized through bioenergetic treatments. This has stopped his problems from advancing. He is currently applying for a loan for 2,000,000 COP to increase his inventory of school supplies, soft drinks, sweets, dairy products, and general food. This will help him offer a variety of products. It will also help him keep his most popular products in stock at his stand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his inventory of school supplies, soft drinks, sweets, dairy products, general food

loans.use: To buy more soya beans, vegetable oil, khebab sticks, pepper, etc.

loans.name: Ramona Concepcion

texts.es: La Señora Ramona tiene 52 años, es madre soltera y ella sola ha logrado mantener a sus 2 hijos que actualmente trabajan de manera independiente. Ella tiene muy pulpería muy surtida, pero todavía necesita otros productos que sus clientes le solicitan, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable a pesar de las dificultades como es la poca afluencia de clientes, pero la mayoría de sus clientes son sus vecinos que siempre llegan a comprarle, porque es ella les brinda mucho cariño a sus clientes. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan, galletas, detergentes, jabón, leche, cuajada entre otros productos. Su deseo es seguir adelante su negocio.
texts.en:
Ramona is a 52 year old single mother. She has raised and supported her two children alone. They now work independently. She has a well stocked mini-market, but she still needs other products that her customers are requesting. She is a very hard-working woman. She is responsible in spite of the difficulties like the small amount of customers. Most of her customers are her neighbors who always come to buy from her because she treats them with much affection. She is asking for this loan for working capital to buy sweets, natural cold drinks, bread, crackers, detergents, soap, milk, and cottage cheese, among other products. Her wish is to get ahead in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sanae

texts.en:
Sanae is a 50-year-old woman who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with her husband and their two children.

Sanae has owned a grocery store for a few years. She also sells candies, canned food, home cleaning products, etc. She requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is the first time that she has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

Sanae is speciA. in her work because she opens early in the morning and closes late in the evening. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and passers-by. When she first started her business, she didn’t have enough cash to purchase a lot of merchandise. She decided doing her business because she wanted to supplement her husband’s income, as well as always wanting to work for herself.

In future, Sanae plans to keep on improving her store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a happily married man who is blessed with two children who are both in school. The fifty-eight-year-old man lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a regional capital in Ghana. It is one of the busy commercial centers in the country.

Isaac is into trading, running a stationery shop on one of the streets in the community. He sells and supplies items such as exercise books, text books, pens and pencils, etc. He buys his goods from distributors that come around to supply.

Isaac has been in business for thirteen years and wants a loan to procure stationery in bulk to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy stationery in bulk

loans.name: Vida Luz

texts.es: Vida Luz tiene 32 años, por lo que su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de video juegos. Este no es el primer financiamiento que realiza con Fundación León 2000, por lo que es una mujer muy alegre y dinámica por lo que está muy contenta con esta experiencia. Ella siempre se ha preocupado por sacar adelante a su negocio pues ella hace todo lo posible para mantener a sus 2 hijos que son lo más importantes para ella. Actualmente ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de ciertos artículos que son necesarios en su negocio, por lo que quiere comprar sillas, golosinas y algunos discos nuevos de juegos. Ella sueña con mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia que son las más importantes.
texts.en:
Vida Luz is 32 years old. She currently provides video games services. This is not the first loan that she receives from Fundacion Leon 2000 because she has enjoyed this experience. She is a very dynamic and happy woman. She was always keen on developing her business to raise her 2 children who mean the world to her. She is applying for this loan in order to buy furniture for her business such as chairs, candies, new CDs for gaming purposes. She hopes to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chairs, candies, new CDs

loans.use: To buy motor spare-sparts in bulk

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou S. est âgée de 51 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 4 ans et demis et a été 9 fois de suite bénéficiaire de prêts. Son objectif est de développer son activité principal de restauration et son activité secondaire de transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide, de poisson fumé et/ou séché et de légumes. Avec ses revenus financiers elle parvient à assurer la prise en charge de ses enfants et à subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Fatou S. is a 51-year old widowed mother of five children. She has been a member of the local village loan group for 4 and a half years, and has had 9 previous loan experiences. Her goal is to develop her principal business of preparing and selling food and her secondary activity of processing and selling peanut paste, smoked and/or dried fish, and vegetables. With her income, she is able to take care of her children and provide for herself.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her self-financing capability

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Siembra Y Cosecha Group

texts.es: A 5 kilometros del municipio de Tecpan, Viven las tres señoras, de derecha a izquierda, Lucia C., Trinidad A., Cristina M., Hacen una Platica entre ellas para obtener una nueva opción de trabajo  y solicitar un crédito mancomunado,  las señoras  tienen un promedio de edad de 52  años, se dedican en orden de nombre tienda de consumo diario, Venta de verduras  y retazos de tela, Elaboración de güipiles y servilletas, grandes y pequeñas,  aunque sus actividades son diferentes, su objetivo son similares, porque están apoyando a su esposo a lograr el objetivo familiar, con alimentación equilibrada, aumentar capital e ingreso para construcción de una casa, estudios para sus hijos, aprovechando que pueden trabajar todavía, hasta que puedan lograr su metas,
texts.en:
Just 5 kilometers from the municipality of Tecpan live 3 married women, from right to left, Lucia C., Trinidad A., and Cristina M.. They had a discussion among themselves and decided on a new work option, to solicit a communal loan. The women average 52 in age and are dedicated to running a daily consumer goods store. They sell vegetables and measures of cloth, and they make decorative native blouses and napkins, large and small. Although their activities differ, their objectives are similar, because they are helping their husbands to reach familiar objectives: sufficient food, an increase in capital and income for the construction of a house, and schooling for their children.
