They want to take advantage of the fact that they can still work, until they can reach their objectives.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING VEGETABLES TO SELL AND THREAD FOR SEWING BLOUSES

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more fabric, clothes, ladies' jeans and tops for sale

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro S. H. de 58 años de edad, reside en Armenia, ubicado en el departamento de Sonsonate. Vive junto a su esposa y un hijo quien le ayuda en el negocio. Alejandro posee un molino el cual está ubicado en su casa de habitación, ahí las personas llegan a moler maíz, frijoles, e ingredientes para salsa, entre otras cosas más. Desde hace 10 años el señor Alejandro se gana la vida de esta manera, razón por la que desea poder invertir en el negocio, es por esto que solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar un motor para el molino, el cual trabaja con gasolina, esto le permitirá  poder brindar un mejor trabajado, ya que el molino funcionará de una manera más rápida y mejor. Para el señor 
Alejandro mejorar su servicio significa más clientes lo que se convierte en mayores ganancias, es por esto que él desea poder mejorar su negocio, ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta para solventar los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Alejandro S. H. is 58 years old and lives in Armenia, which is in the department of Sonsonate. He lives with his wife and his son who helps him with his business. Alejando has a mill which is located in his home. People come to have corn, beans, ingredients for salsa, and other things ground. Mr. Alejandro has made his living this way for ten years which is why he would like to invest in his business, and is why he is asking for a loan. He would like to buy a motor that works with gasoline for his mill. This would allow him to do a better job since the mill would work faster and better. Improving his service would mean more customers for Mr. Alejandro which also means he would earn more. He wants to improve his business since this is his only source of income he can count on to take care of his household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motor for his mill.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wristwatches

loans.name: Mame Bousso

texts.fr: Mame Bousso G. est une femme de 34 ans, elle est mariée et mère d' un enfant et responsable de 2 enfants qu'on lui a confiés. Son crédit lui permet de développer un son activité de couture, en effet elle achète des tissus les confectionne et vend son produit sous forme de prêt à porter. Elle coud également sur mesures. Elle participe à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Mame Bousso G. is a 34-year-old married mother of one child, and is responsible for 2 additional children who have been placed in her care. This loan will allow her to develop her tailoring business - she actually buys fabric, tailors it, and sells her goods as ready-to-wear clothing. She also takes custom orders. She participates in taking care of her family's financial needs.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy printed fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of coesmetics and hair care products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy refgrigerators to sell

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Teresa De Jesús tuvo muchas experiencias con financiamientos por lo que es una buena cliente de Fundación León 2000. La señora es muy perseverante y emprendedora, ella se dedica a la venta de artesanía por lo que se encuentra situado en lugar en medio del parque que está muy bien acondicionado  en donde todos los días tiene clientes nuevos, ella les brinda el mejor servicio posible para mejorar sus ventas, ya que últimamente han bajado, pero Teresa es una mujer que tiene 6 años de experiencia con este negocio, por lo que esto le ayuda mucho, ya que cuida no gastar más de lo que gana, sino que le gusta reinvertir en su negocio. Sin embargo gracias a su negocio, tiene de donde obtener dinero efectivo para hacerle frente a las compras de medicinas, que ahora están tan caras. Ella sueña con tener un negocio más grande ubicado en el mercado. Ella solicita este financiamiento para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio. Su deseo es que hijo finalice sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa De Jesús has had a lot of experience with loans and she is a good client of the Fundación León 2000 (León Foundation 2000). She is very persistent and enterprising and works selling handicrafts in the middle of the park. She has a good location where she has new customers every day. She provides the best possible service to improve her sales, which have been down recently, but Teresa is a woman with 6 years of experience in this business, which helps her a lot. She is careful to not spend more than she earns, and instead likes to reinvest in her business. Thanks to her business, she has a means to obtain the cash to buy medicine, which is now very expensive. She dreams of having a bigger business located in the market. She is asking for the loan to continue investing in her business. Her desire is for her son to finish his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To strengthen her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell to her customers

loans.name: Tobías Rafael

texts.es: Tobías Rafael M. V. de 44 años de edad, reside en Cojutepeque, departamento de Cuscatlán. Vive junto a su extensa familia, la cual esta conformada por su esposa quien es ama de casa, y sus cuatro hijos todos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar,  el hijo mayor de 17 años, le ayuda a su padre con el negocio. Tobías posee un taller de enderezado y pintura, en el cual trabaja desde hace 10 años atrás, tiempo el cual le cuenta por mucha experiencia, por la que los clientes solicitan mucho su trabaja, ya que él es una persona muy responsable quien siempre entrega su trabajo a tiempo y con excelentes resultados. Debido a que uno de los mayores deseos de Tobías es poder mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, y así mismo mejorar sus servicios, él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar materiales de trabajo como: pintura, compresores y otros artículos más, los cuales son utilizados a diario en su trabajo. Entre las razones con mayor peso para querer crecer en su negocio está su familia, esto debido a que Tobías es el único que trabaja para brindarles el sustento diario y todo lo que ellos necesitan
texts.en:
Tobías Rafael M. V. is 44 years old and lives in Cojutepeque, a zone of Cuscatlán. He lives with his large family, comprised of his wife who cares for the home, and their 4 children who all study. Their oldest son is 17 years old and helps his father with the business. Tobías has an auto body and paint shop where he has worked for 10 years, and all the time spent there has given him a lot of experience. For this reason customers ask for his work, and he is very responsible and always meets deadlines with excellent results. Due to the fact that one of Tobías' greatest desires is to be able to improve the conditions of his business, and thus improve his service, he is asking for a loan to buy materials such as paint, air compressors, and other supplies that he uses daily in his work. One of the most pressing reasons to want to grow his business is his family, because Tobías is the only one who works to provide for their daily needs and all that they need.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools and paint for cars

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food to sell to her customers

loans.name: Blanca Mirian

texts.es: Blanca  Mirian   C.  M. de 57 años de edad, reside en Lourdes colón, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo el cual es jubilado, y quien le ayuda a ella con el negocio. Blanca posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual se encarga de elaborarlas y venderlas. El negocio está ubicado en su casa, lugar en el cual las personas llegan a comprar las tortillas, las cuales las prefieren, debido a que blanca cuenta con 8 años de experiencia. Así mismo ella se encarga de llevar tortillas a los trabajadores de una fábrica que está ubicada cerca de su casa, labor en la cual su esposo le ayuda cargando las tortillas hasta la fábrica. Por esta razón Blanca solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el dinero necesario para comprar mayores cantidades de maíz, cal, y gas propano, para la elaboración y cocción de las tortillas, esto le será de mucho beneficio para ella debido a que le permitirá hacer mayor cantidad d producto y así podrá atender mayor cantidad de pedidos. Blanca es una persona muy trabajadora a quien le llena de mucha ilusión el poder atender más clientes y aceptar más pedidos, lo cual se convierte en mayores ganancias para ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
Blanca Mirian C. M. is 57 years old and lives in Lourdes Colón, in the La Libertad zone. She lives with her husband, who is retired and helps her with the business. The business is located in their home, where people go to buy their favorite tortillas (as Blanca has 8 years of experience). She is also in charge of delivering tortillas to the workers at a factory that is located close to her home, and her husband helps her by carrying the tortillas to the factory. Blanca is asking for a loan to obtain the money needed to buy greater quantities of corn, lime, and propane gas for making tortillas. This would be of great benefit to her since it would let her make a greater quantity of her product and be able to fill more orders. Blanca is a very hard-working person who is full of hope because she will be able to attend to more customers and accept more orders, which will result in higher earnings for herself and for her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, lime, and propane gas

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Carmen Beatriz

texts.es: Carmen C. solicita este crédito para invertirlo en una tienda que tiene desde hace 9 meses, aunque su negocio desde hace varios años ha sido la venta de ropa típica tuvo la oportunidad de adquirir este negocio y quiere aprovechar para poder surtir mas productos ya que quiere comprar frutas, maíz, frijol, azúcar y aceite, también algunos utiles escolares ya que su negocio esta ubicado cerca de la escuela de la aldea donde ella vive. Una de las metas que la señora tiene es de atender bien a sus clientes y ganar su preferencia, ella dice que sigue trabajando duro ya que después de haber estado enferma y haberse recuperado quiere darle una buena vida a su hija, aunque su hija tiene poco mas de 3 años ella se prepara para el futuro.
texts.en:
Carmen C. is asking for a loan to invest in a store that she has had for 9 months. While her business for many years has been to sell traditional clothing, she had the opportunity to acquire this store and she would like to be able to provide more products that people like to buy such as fruit, corn, beans, sugar, and oil. Also she would like to sell school supplies because the store is near the village school where she lives. One of her goals is to serve her customers well and to gain their loyalty. She says that she continues to work hard even after being sick and having recovered. She wants to provide a good life to her daughter. Even though her daughter is only 3 she is preparing for her daughter’s future.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working captial

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy vegetables and spices to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa L. de 55 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Arce, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad, vive sola en su propia casa, esto debido a que sus hijos ya son mayores y residen en Los Estados Unidos.  La señora Rosa trabaja elaborando ropa para niños, mujeres y hombres, la cual posteriormente sale a vender de manera ambulante por las calles de Zapotitán y Ciudad Arce, siempre ubicadas en el departamento de La Libertad. Ella se dedica a este trabajo desde hace ya varios años. Debido a su arduo trabajo y gran esfuerzo diario, Rosa logra obtener ganancias aceptables, a pesar que las ventas no siempre son muy buenas, ya que hay día en los que las ventas son pocas. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de tela, hilo y todo tipo de materia prima para la elaboración de prendas de vestir y de esta manera poder ofrecer mayor cantidad de estilos, tallas y colores de ropa, tratando de obtener más clientes. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de poder contar con el dinero necesario para tener una vida digna, suplida de todo lo necesario para vivir, así mismo, desea poder terminar de reparar su casa, ya que algunas paredes están dañadas, así como el techo, es por ello que necesita mejorar sus ganancias para contar con el dinero necesario para mandar a hacer estas reparaciones.
texts.en:
Rosa L. is 55 years old and lives in the city of Arce located in the Province of La Libertad. She lives alone in her own home because her children are grown and they all live in the United States. Ms. Rosa makes clothing for men, women, and children that she used to sell by walking the streets of Zapotitán and Arce, both in the Province of La Libertad. She has worked in this area for many years. Because of her hard work and daily effort, she has achieved an acceptable profit in spite of sales not always being good, and some days when the sales are very low. She requested a loan through which to buy more fabric, thread and all kinds of raw material for making clothing and thus be able to offer as many styles, sizes and colors of clothing, and to try to get more customers. She does all this in order to have the money to make a decent living, and be supplied with all the necessities. She also wants to finish repairing her house, as some walls and the roof are damaged. That is why she needs to improve her profits to have the money to do these repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy material and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy vegetables and spices to sell to her customers

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es:
Julieta, tiene una pensión (tipo restaurante) en su domicilio, donde elabora almuerzos diariamente. Trabaja con una empleada (cocinera Ayudante) y con su hija.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de tembladerani de la ciudad de la Paz.
El crédito será destinado para la operación de su hija porque tiene un lunar en su nariz, que le molesta y no le deja trabajar.
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial la califica como cliente bueno en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Julieta has a restaurant in her home where she makes lunch every day. She works with an employee (assistant cook) and with her daughter. Her home is located in the Tembladerani zone in the city of Paz. The loan will be used for an operation for her daughter, who has a mole in her nose that bothers her a lot and keeps her from working. This is the 3rd time she has asked for a loan from Impro. Her loan history qualifies her as a good client in the payment of her bills.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for an operation for her daughter so that she can breathe better.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana Gloria C. C. de 46 años de edad, reside en Armenia, ubicado en el departamento de Sonsonate. Vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar. La señora Gloria posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos comestibles y de primera necesidad para el hogar, así mismo posee una venta de antojitos. Yuca frita, empanadas, atol de elote, y otros productos más son los nombres de los platillos típicos que Ana prepara en su propia casa de habitación, y por los cuales posee muy buenas referencias, ya que es una señora muy trabajadora y emprendedora, quien elabora lo mejor posible su oficio, brindándoles el mejor servicio a sus clientes. Ana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos, tales como yuca, maíz, elotes y otros más, todo esto con el fin de ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos y así aumentar las ganancias que tan bien le harán a su familia y su estabilidad económica, ya que dependen en gran manera de este negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Gloria Chavez C., 46, lives in Armenia, located in the Sonsonate department. She lives with her husband and her two children, who are in school. Gloria has a store where she sells food products, household necessities and home-made snacks. Fried cassava, empanadas, and "atol de elote" (a drink made of corn) are the names of some of the typical dishes that Ana prepares in her home. She has very good references, since she is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who makes the most of her business by providing the best service to her customers. Ana requests a loan that she will use to buy raw materials for the production of food, such as cassava, corn and other items, all with the aim of offering more products and increasing her earnings. These earning will support her family and provide them with economic stability, as they depend heavily on this business for their livelihood.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw materials for the production of food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To strengthen her sheep-rearing business

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina A. is married and has four children. She has received junior high education.  Regina cooks fufu to sell at Elmina, which she has been doing for quite some time now. Regina uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Regina will use the loan to purchase bags of cassava, plantain, meat and fish to cook for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Regina plans to save for her children’s education.

loans.use: Regina will use the loan to purchase bags of cassava, plantain, meat and fish to cook for sale.

loans.name: Formarah

texts.en:
E. was born in 1970. She is single has two children. She lives in mile three at Nkwen Bamenda Cameroon. E. lost her children’s father in 2001, thus making life so difficult for her and the children. The father was the sole breadwinner of the house, taking care of sickness and education of the children. She had her first loan of 20,000FRS, which she paid promptly, likewise subsequent loans of 70 000FRS and 150 000FRS.

She plans to invest this money in clothes and shoes. She has worked in this business for a long time, therefore giving her a good background of business management. 

She will have three months of grace in her loan, thus enabling her to increase her profitability ratio and manage the loan appropriately.

Her activity will help the community to obtain dresses at reduced prices.  She plans to use the profit to purchase items, feed and educate her children and fight poverty at home.

About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.

loans.use: Purchase of used clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Mujeres Con Metas Y Sueños 1 &2 Group

texts.en:
Amada is the coordinator of her group Mujeres con Sueños y Metas (Women with Dreams and Goals), and her story is representational of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients in general. Her group is located in the slums, north of the capital, Santo Domingo, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her four children.

Amada is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling bacon and Longaniza (a pork sausage popular in the DR) by purchasing 180lbs of meat. She will use the profits to invest in a freezer, which will serve a dual purpose of supporting her business as well as providing cold storage for her family. Her long-term goal is to save enough money to have a large comfortable home and to send her kids to university. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: 180 lbs of meat with which to make sausage and bacon

loans.name: Gerardo José Antonio

texts.es: Gerardo José Antonio M. T. de 29 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de San Martín, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar. El señor Gerardo se dedica a trabajar para una presa hidroeléctrica, pero debido al aumento de despidos en su trabajo por la falta de recursos de la empresa, desde hace un año y medio, él decidió emprender su propio negocio, en el cual se encarga de comercializar ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, esta ropa es traída desde Los Estados Unidos y Gerardo la comercializa en su propia casa. Mientras Gerardo se dedica a trabajar durante los días de semana, su esposa le ayuda a atender el negocio. Él solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar mayor cantidad de ropa en diferentes tallas y colores, esto con la intención de mejorar las ganancias, atrayendo mayor clientela. Para Gerardo el dinero obtenido es de mucha importancia debido a que él realiza compras al contado y para esto es necesario contar con el dinero en efectivo para realizar las compras. Él cuenta con  muy buenas referencias por ser un padre muy responsable y trabajador quien siempre está dispuesto a brindarles una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Gerardo José Antonio M. T. is 29 years old and lives in the San Martín zone, located in the area of San Salvador. He lives with his wife and their two children who are 10 and 8 years old and who both study. Mr. Gerardo works for a hydroelectric dam, but due to increased layoffs at his job and a lack of resources at the business, a year and a half ago he decided to start his own business selling clothing for men, women, and children. This clothing is imported from the United States and Gerardo sells it out of his home. While Gerardo works at his other job during the week, his wife helps by running the business. He is asking for a loan to be able to buy clothing in different sizes and colors, with the intention of improving earnings and attracting more customers. The money is important to Gerardo because he pays for his merchandise in cash. He comes with very good references for being a very responsible father and worker who is always willing to provide a better life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of flour.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa Emilia P. D. N. D. 50 años D. edad, resiD. en Santa Tecla, departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos los cuales asisten a la universidad y ayudan con el negocio. La señora Rosa posee una panadería, en la cual se encarga D. elaborar pan dulce, (nombre que se le da al pan en El Salvador, el cual es D. sabor dulce como su nombre lo indica). Durante mucho años ella se ha dedicado a este tipo D. trabajo, a través del cual ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos y así mismo le ha brindado la ayuda necesaria a su esposo para poder solventar todos los gastos del hogar y pagarles los estudios universitarios a sus hijos, los cuales le ayudan  cada tarD. a elaborar el pan. Rosa comercializa sus productos en su propia casa, lugar en el cual lo venD. por mayor o por unidad. Así mismo posee una ruta D. clientes a los cuales les lleva el pan hasta sus propias casas.  Rosa es una señora muy entusiasta y trabajadora, la cual ha dedicado gran parte D. su vida a la elaboración del pan, obteniendo gran experiencia, lo que le permite tener muchos clientes. Razón por la cual ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. harina, levadura, miel y otros ingredientes más y así elaborar mayor cantidad D. pan para los clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa Emilia P. D. N. is 50 years old and lives in Santa Tecla, a zone of La Libertad. She lives with her husband and their three children who are in college and help with the business. Mrs. Rosa has a bakery, where she works making pan dulce (a name given to the bread of El Salvador, and which is sweet, as indicated by its name). For many years she has worked at this type of job, which has allowed her to help her children get ahead, provided the means for her husband to take care of the home's expenses and, paid for their children's studies. Their children help every afternoon preparing the bread. Rosa sells her products out of the home, in bulk or individually. She also has a sales route and delivers bread to the houses of certain customers. Rosa is a very enthusiastic and hard-working lady. She has devoted a large part of her life to making bread, and has a lot of experience, which allows her to have many customers. She is asking for a loan to be able to buy more flour, yeast, honey, and other ingredients to make more bread for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour and yeast

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge es jubilado y tiene un horno donde elabora masitas, pasteles y pan diariamente y a contrato. Trabaja con su esposa y una hija.

Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Villa Fátima de la ciudad de la Paz, donde vive en anticrético.

El crédito será destinado para capital de inversión (compra de una maquina ablandadora de masas).
Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en  el pago se sus cuotas. 

La foto se sacó en la oficina de IMPRO, por eso el cliente aparece en terno y corbata y no en su panadería.
texts.en:
Jorge is retired and has an oven that he uses to make baked goods, cakes, and bread daily and under contract. He works with his wife and a daughter. His lives in a rented home in the Villa Fátima area in the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to invest in business supplies (to buy an electric mixer). This is the fourth time he has asked for a loan through Impro. His credit history shows him to be a good client in his loan payments. The photo was taken in IMPRO's office, which is why the client is pictured in a suit and tie, and is not shown in his bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an electric mixer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy printed fabrics.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es: Lorena C. G. de 30 años de edad, reside en San Luis Talpa, ubicado en el departamento de La Paz. Vive junto a sus dos pequeños hijos, los cuales dependen por completo de ella. Lorena posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, entre los cuales están: pan, leche, verduras, detergentes, entre otros productos más. Así mismo ella se encarga de vender ropa para niños, hombres y mujeres, lo cual le permite obtener algunas ganancias extras. Para Lorena es de mucha importancia el poder obtener ganancias aceptables, de su negocio, debido a que esta es la única fuente de ingresos con los que cuenta para poder brindarles todo lo necesario a sus dos hijos, ya que ella es madre soltera quien no recibe ningún tipo de ayuda económica para la manutención de ellos. Lorena solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir la tienda no solo con productos comestibles y de primera necesidad para el hogar, sino también para invertir en papelería y cuadernos, ya que en los alrededores de su negocio no existe ninguna librería. Lorena cuenta con la ilusión de poder brindarle una vida mejor a su familia, en un hogar en el cual este suplido de todas las necesidades básicas.
texts.en:
30-year old Lorena C. G. lives in San Luis Talpa which is in La Paz department. She lives with her two small children who are completely dependent on her. Lorena owns a store selling perishables and basic necessities such as bread, milk, vegetables, detergent, etc. She also sells clothing for children and adults, a job that provides her with additional income. In Lorena’s view, it is very important to be able to earn an adequate income as she is the sole breadwinner and has to provide everything for her children. She is a single mother who does not receive any kind of financial help for their upbringing. Lorena is asking for a loan to buy more stock for her store. Not only does she want to sell perishables and basic necessities, but also stationery and exercise books as there is no bookstore near her business. Her dream is to provide a better life for her family in a home that has all the essentials.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy perishables and stationery

location.town: San Luis Talpa,  departamento de La Paz.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary B. is single and has two children. She has no educational background herself. She sells kenkey at Elmina, which she has been doing for some time now and uses her income to pay school fees and utility bills.

To prepare her kenkey Mary buys maize from the market and soaks it in enough water to soften the maize. She washes it on the third day and sends it to the mill to be milled. She then makes a mixture of dough out of the milled wet corn, leaving it to prove (rise) on the next day. She divides the proved dough in two, uses one part for her firm half-cooked dough (she mixes it with water to get it in a porridge form and cooks it for some time to get a firm mixture or texture) and mixes the rest of the uncooked dough with the half-cooked dough. She molds the dough into balls and wraps them in corn husks. She then cooks them till they become soft enough to eat.

The photo was taken at the time the kenkey was ready for consumption and Mary was taking them out to put into another big bowl which will be sent out to where it is sold.

Kenkey can be eaten with various kinds of sauces, such as pepper sauce with fried or roasted fish, roasted chicken, roasted turkey, frog limbs, and any other kind of meat or fish.

Mary will use the loan to purchase more maize to prepare kenkey for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to complete her building.

loans.use: To purchase more maize to prepare kenkey to sell

loans.name: Caring Friends Group

texts.es:
Grupo solidario conformado por tres socias, Nancy, con su esposo tiene un trabajo  de electricidad, Irma, un café internet, y Vilma, costura, miscelánea y librería.
Vilma, tiene 41 años de edad, vive en ciudad Guatemala, tiene 3 hijos el cual 2 de ellos trabajan y uno que es el mas pequeño esta estudiando, su negocio es costura donde esta trabajando los uniformes de una escuela de donde ella vive, tiene 18 años de tener su negocio con la ayuda de su esposo han podido superarse y ahora tiene la necesidad de adquirir un crédito para poder comprar mercadería telas y accesorios para los uniformes, el cual recurrieron a la Fundación FAPE Y KIVA para que puedan brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y un mejor futuro a sus familia
texts.en:
This is a caring group formed of 3 members. Nancy has an electrical job with her husband, Irma works at an internet cafe, and Vilma sews, sells stationery items, books, and general merchandise from her home.

Vilma is 41 years old and lives in Guatemala city. She has 3 children. Two of them work and the youngest one is in school. She has a sewing business where she works on uniforms for a school from her area. She has been in this business for 18 years and has been able to succeed with her husband's help. Now she is in need of a loan to purchase merchandise, fabrics, and accessories for the uniforms. This is why she requested one through the FAPE Foundation and KIVA as well as to be able to offer better service to their clients and a better future to their families.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of thread and fabrics.

loans.name: Ngeh

texts.en: V. is single and was born in 1952. She is the mother of two children. She lives in her own house situated at Foncha Street, Nkwen, Bamenda, Northwest province, Cameroon. This is V.’s third loan since she joined GHAPE. The first was for 37,500 FRS and the second 200,000 FRS obtained in 2007 and 2008 respectively. V. plans to invest the current loan in cultivating her farm, buying farm inputs, piglets and firewood. She plans to use the profits to increase her capital and build a kitchen for herself. V.’s difficulties have mainly been illnesses of family members and the death of some relatives. The loan will help the community in providing vegetables, manure to farmers and firewood to households, reducing the cost of going to the market to obtain these items. V. believes she will succeed because she has been in this business for a long time. GHAPE is most preferable to V. because its interest rate is low and the repayment conditions are very good, notwithstanding the conditions of granting the credit to its borrowers. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO (non-governmental organization) based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs, piglets and firewood

loans.name: Afonso

texts.es: Alfonso F. J. de 57 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Paz. Vive únicamente junto a su esposa, quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. Alfonso es un señor muy humilde, quien trabaja a diario por brindarle a su esposa una vida digna, suplida de todas las necesidades básicas. Él brinda sus servicios de transporte públicos, ya que posee un pick up, en el cual se encarga de hacer viajes por las diferentes ciudades y pueblos de La Paz. De esta manera el trasporta personas de un lugar a otro, transporta frutas, verduras, muebles y todo lo que sus clientes le pidan. De esta manera el se ha ganado la vida durante mucho años, lo que le permite ser muy conocido en el lugar y contar con la confianza de las personas, ya que lo reconocen como a un hombre muy trabajador quien siempre está dispuesto a dar más para su trabajo con el fin de obtener mayores ganancias. Alfonso solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar algunos repuestos para su automóvil, ya que para él es de mucha importancia mantener lo mejor posible el estado de su pick up, ya que es este el que le permite contar con un trabajo.
texts.en:
Alfonso F. J., 57, lives in the La Paz department. He lives alone with his wife, who devotes herself to taking care of the house. Alfonso is a very humble man who works everyday to give his wife a decent life with the basic necessities. He has a pick up, which he uses to offer public transportation services. He makes trips to the different cities and towns of La Paz. He takes people from one place to another and transports fruits, vegetables, furniture, and everything his customers request. He has earned a living this way for many years. It has allowed him to become very well known in the area, and people trust him. They consider him to be a very hard-working man who is always prepared to put more into his work in order to earn more. Alfonso is asking for a loan to be able to buy some replacement parts for his automobile. It is very important to him to maintain his pick up in the best possible shape. His pick up is what allows him to have work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts for his automobile

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tubers of yam

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa De Jesús C. B. de 41 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de rosario de Mora, ubicado en el departamento de La Paz. Junto a ella vive su esposo quien trabaja como jornalero, y su hijo. A pesar que ella cuenta con una familia pequeña, Teresa debe esforzarse a diario por poder contar con el dinero suficiente para solventar todos los gastos del hogar. Es por ello que posee una venta de carne de pollo, de res y de cerdo, la cual comercializa en su propia casa de habitación. Teresa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de carne, sobre todo la carne de cerdo la cual es la más pedida por sus clientes. De esta manera ella espera poder mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, ya que gracias a este es como ha ido mejorando su economía familiar en los últimos meses. Teresa es alguien con mucha determinación y deseos de seguir adelante junto a su familia, es por ello que día tras día se esfuerza al máximo por brindar un mejor servicio y de esta manera obtener mayor cantidad de clientes.
texts.en:
Teresa De Jesús C. B., 41, lives in the Rosario de Mora municipality, which is located in the La Paz department. She lives with her husband, a day laborer, and her son. Even though she has a small family, Teresa must make an effort everyday to be able to have enough money for the household expenses. That is why she has a business selling chicken, beef, and pork. She sells from her home. Teresa is asking for a loan to be able to buy a larger quantity of meat, especially pork, because her customers request it the most. This way she expects to be able to improve her business conditions. Thanks to this, she has been improving the family’s economic situation during the last months. Teresa is a person with a lot of determination and desire to get ahead with her family. That is why she puts forth her maximum effort day by day to offer better service. This way she will get more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat wholesale

location.town: Rosario de Mora, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es: María Teresa J. D. M. D. 60 años D. edad, resiD. en la Ciudad D. Soyapango, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo, dos hijos y una nuera. María es una señora quien a su edad, trabaja arduamente en su propio negocio, el cual es una tienda D. productos perecederos y D. primera necesidad. A pesar que cuenta con varios años D. tener su negocio, ella no ha podido surtirla con todos los productos necesarios, los cuales las personas comprar con mayor frecuencia. Es por esta razón que la señora María solicita un préstamo, el cual le permita contar con el dinero necesario para comprar productos como detergentes, carnes, embutidos y otros más. Para la señora María es muy importante el poder surtir la tienda, ya que es D. esta forma por la cual obtiene la mayor cantidad D. dinero para brindarle esa ayuda tan necesaria a su esposo para los gastos D. ambos, esto debido a que sus hijos son mayores D. edad y ellos cuentan con su propio trabajo. A pesar D. esto María trabaja mucho para contar con una mejor estabilidad económica junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
María Teresa J. D. M., 60, lives with her husband, two children, and a daughter-in-law in the city of Soyapango. María is a woman, who at her age, works arduously in her own business. She has a store selling perishable basic needs items. Even though she has had the business for several years, she has not been able to stock it with all of the necessary products, which people buy more frequently. That is the reason that María is asking for a loan. It will allow her to buy products like detergents, meat, sausages, and other things. Being able to stock the store is very important to María because that is the way she gets more money. She gives her husband the much needed help to pay their expenses. This is because their children are adults, and they have their own jobs. In spite of this, María works a lot to have better economic stability together with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perishable products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy printed fabrics in bulk to expand her business

loans.name: José Ricardo

texts.es: José Ricardo H. A. de 41 años de edad, reside en Rosario de Mora, ubicado en el departamento de La Paz. Junto a él vive su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 2 años de edad.  El señor Ricardo posee una carpintería, la cual está ubicada en su casa de habitación. En ella se encarga de elaborar muebles hechos de madera, los cuales son encargados por sus clientes. Gracias a la amplia experiencia de José en su trabajo, cuenta con mucho clientes quienes están muy satisfechos con el trabajo que él realiza, reconociéndolo como un hombre muy trabajador y responsable quien siempre entrega su trabajo a tiempo. Así mismo José elabora muebles y otros tipos de adornos hechos de madera, los cuales vende a las afueras de su hogar. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar madera al por mayor, así mismo comprar repuestos de los instrumentos de trabajo. De esta manera José espera poder aceptar mayor cantidad de trabajo, ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta para sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
José Ricardo H. A. is 41 years old and lives in Rosario de Mora, located in the department of La Paz. He lives with his wife and small son who is 2 years old. Ricardo has a carpentry business which is located in his home. In this business, he makes furniture made of wood which has been ordered in advance by his customers. Thanks to his extensive work experience, Jose has many customers who are satisfied with the work he does, recognizing him as a very hardworking and responsible man who always delivers his products on time. In addition to making furniture, Jose also makes other types of decorative wood products, which he sells outside of his home. He requests a loan so that he can buy wood at wholesale, and also parts for his work tools. In this way Joseph hopes to accept more work, since this is the only source of income that he has to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy wood at wholesale

location.town: Rosario de Mora, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is married with two grown sons. She lives and works in Melitopol. Mariya sells clothing merchandise. All of the merchandise is of very high quality, which draws customers back for shopping from Mariya again and again. Mariya is very friendly with all her customers. She always listens to their preferences very carefully, trying to best serve each one of them. She has been in this business for ten years. Currently, she has 80,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. Her income amounts to 10,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Mariya is seeking a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to restock her inventory. Diversified merchandise will help her please the different tastes of her broad clientele. Moreover, it will help her generate additional income and open a second vending location as a result. Mariya has proved to be a responsible borrower. She is an entrepreneur with integrity and prudence. We believe she will use the current loan to the benefit of her clothing sales venture.

loans.use: To restock her inventory

loans.name: Rufina Miriam

texts.es: Rufina Miriam tiene 53 años de edad, su actividad económica es ofrece el servicio de costura. Por lo que a pesar de su edad es una persona muy alegre y eficaz por lo que poco a poco y con el paso del tiempo y ha logrado crecer con su humilde negocio, ya que cuando era muy joven siempre le gustaba ser una persona muy independiente por lo que con este negocio tiene 38 años, que han sido muy constructivos por que le ha dado lo necesario para seguir adelante. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de telas, hilos, tijeras, zipper entre otros productos, por lo que se acerca la temporada de entrada a clases y ella quiere aprovechar este momento por los encargos que le hacen. El sueño de Rufina es proporcionarle mejoras su vivienda.
texts.en:
53-year old Rufina Miriam is a seamstress. In spite of her age she is a very lively and efficient person as over the years she has gradually built a small business. Ever since she was very young, she always enjoyed being independent and has had this business for 38 years. They have been profitable years as they provided her with enough to make progress in life. Rufina is asking for a loan to buy material, thread, scissors, zippers and other items. The back-to-school season is fast approaching, and she wants to take advantage of any orders that her customers give her. Rufina’s dream is to make her home more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To strengthen her sheep-rearing business

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es: El señor Enrique tiene 58 años de edad, un hombre activo desde su juventud ha trabajado y es de  pocos recursos económicos, reside en barrio German Pomares, junto a su esposa, la cual vende perecederos como chiltoma, cebolla, ajo, naranja, mandarinas y otros. Con un hijo estudiante en la universidad en la carrera de derecho,  Don Enrique trabaja en mantenimiento de jardinería desde mas de once años en el colegio del barrio en que vive, también trabaja como vigilante cuando se enferma el del colegio, y los fines de semana cuida una casa particular en donde tiene otras entradas, para el es importante ya que desea que su hija termine su carrera para que pueda tener mejores oportunidades en la vida, ya que cuando no se estudia el trabajo es duro. Su casa la ha venido mejorando con estos financiamientos ha repellado paredes y logro levantar un muro para mejor seguridad y higiene de familia. Con esta solicitud desea hacer el baño y el inodoro ya que no esta en las mejores condiciones ya que es de zinc y lo tapa con sabanas es por eso su necesidad de poder hacerlo de concreto para mejor higiene y aseo personal. Muy contento ya que podrá realizar esta obra el cual comprara: bloques,  cemento, zinc ya que tiene la arena comprada y  otros para comenzar. Contento por el la oportunidad que la institución ha dado.
texts.en:
58-year old Señor Enrique is an energetic man. He has worked ever since he was a young man, but he is still poor. He lives in the German Pomares neighbourhood with his wife who sells perishables such as sweet peppers, onions, garlic, oranges, tangerines, and other items. One son is at university studying law. Don Enrique has worked as a gardener for more than eleven years at the high school in the neighbourhood where he lives. He also works as a security guard when the high school guard is sick. At weekends he looks after a private house from which he gets further income. Money is important for Enrique because he wants his daughter to complete her professional studies so that she can have better opportunities in life. When you don’t have an education, it is hard to get work. Enrique is renovating his house. With previous loans he painted the walls and also managed to build a wall which made the house safer and easier to keep clean. With this loan he wants to build a new bathroom and toilet as the current one is not in good condition. It is made of corrugated iron covered with sheets. For this reason he needs to build a concrete one for better hygiene and personal cleanliness. Enrique is very happy that he will be able to do this work. He plans to buy cement blocks, cement, and corrugated iron; he has already bought enough sand and other items to make a start. He is grateful for this opportunity provided by the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cement blocks, cement, and corrugated iron to build a bathroom

loans.name: Iris Idayda

texts.es: Iris Idayda L. de 35 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Rosario de La Paz. Vive junto a tres hijos menores de edad, los cuales gracias al esfuerzo de su madre, se dedican a estudiar. Iris posee una venta de pupusas, en la cual se encarga de elaborar y vender su producto desde su humilde casa. Ella es una mujer muy esforzada quien cada mañana y noche se dispone a trabajar lo mejor posible, todo con el fin de poder brindarles una estabilidad económica a sus hijos, sin importar el esfuerzo que esto conlleve. Iris solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda adquirir el dinero necesario para poder comprar maíz, harina de arroz, queso, frijoles, y chicharrón, los cuales son los productos básicos para la elaboración de las pupusas. Iris desea poder contar con mayor cantidad de materia prima, y de esta manera vender más pupusas, ya que cuenta con mucho clientes. A pesar que ella ha sido madre soltera es alguien muy admirada por sus vecinos ya que ha sabido sacar adelante a sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Iris Idayda L. is 35 years-old and lives in the town of Rosario de La Paz. She lives with her three young children, who, thanks to the efforts of their mother, are students. Iris has a business selling pupusas (stuffed tortillas). She makes and sells her products herself from her humble house. She is a very hard-working woman who every morning and night tries to do her best work, all with the goal of providing her children economic stability, no matter the effort necessary. Iris is asking for this loan to use as working capital to purchase corn, rice flour, cheese, beans, and pork crackling, the basic ingredients for making stuffed tortillas. Iris wants to use raw materials of the best quality and thus sell the best stuffed tortillas to her many customers. Although she is a single mother she is admired a lot by her neighbors for her ability to get her children ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw material for the elaboration of food products.

location.town: Rosario de La Paz, departamento de La Paz

loans.name: Jesus Está Aquí Group

texts.en:
Isabel is the coordinator of her group, Jesus Está Aquí (Jesus is here), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the slums in the north of Santo Domingo, where crime is rampant and running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and seven dependents (nephews who have been orphaned).

Isabel is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of selling fried food by purchasing rice, spaghetti, beef, chicken, sausage and pork. She will use the profits to save for the continued needs of caring for the her newly enlarged family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchasing rice, spaghetti, beef, chicken, sausage and pork for making food to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk in order to expand her business

loans.name: Beatice

texts.en: Beatice B. bakes bread for sale at Elmina.  Beatice has received junior high education.  She is married and has four children. Her husband is a teacher. Beatice has been baking bread for sale for some time now. She helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more flour, sugar, margarine and other ingredients to bake the bread for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: buy more flour, sugar, margarine etc., to bake bread for sale

loans.name: Ngwa Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel was born on 15th March 1963, is married to one wife whose name is Nnam Delphine, and is the father of five children all below fifteen years. He owns a three-room house. He had some financial hardship when his salary was blocked and he was later sacked from his job. This made it very difficult to pay the children's fees and cater for sickness in the family. This is Emmanuel’s second loan since he joined GHAPE; the first was 40,000 FRS in 2007.

He plans to invest the money to construct a pig fence, cultivate vegetables and buy food for his fish pond.

He is very sure of succeeding in the business due to his experience in the projects. His projects will help to supply his community with sufficient meat, fish and vegetables. The manure from the pigs will increase productivity in people’s farms. He plans to use the profit to improve the family's standard of living.

About GHAPE

The Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.

loans.use: construct a pig fence, cultivate vegetables and buy food for his fish pond

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy electrical appliances

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy second hand clothes.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a widow. She has three grown children. Valentina runs a small business selling clothing and merchandise in a little store, close to the central market, in her home town of Melitopol. Valentina has been in this trade for 10 years. She has 30,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her profit amounts to 7,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Valentina is seeking a 7,500 Grivnya loan to purchase assorted merchandise. She is very responsible when it comes to loan repayment. Valentina has repaid previous loans without any delinquencies. She can be characterized as a hard-working and circumspect individual with clear vision and a determined nature. We believe these personal characteristics will help Valentina succeed in her business endeavors and repay the current loan without any problems.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy motor spare-sparts.

loans.name: Jose Oswaldo

texts.es: El joven José tiene 22 años de edad, es un padre de familia de un hijo, junto con su esposa se esfuerzan para poder tener una mejor vivienda, el trabaja como asesor de venta en la compañía Coca Cola, en donde recorre toda la capital, como los departamentos para ofrecer los productos. Su prioridad es cada día mejorar la casa, con el crédito anterior logro hacer un cuarto, ahora desea repellar las paredes, comprar puertas seguras ya que las que tiene están en malas condiciones, poner el piso ya que es de tierra y lograr mejor higiene como pintar. Para esto comprara materiales de construcción como:, arena, cemento, piedrin, piso y pintura  para comenzar la obra, ya que solo mediante con el  financiamiento puede hacer estas mejoras, ya que su salario es un básico y gana por comisión de venta, es por eso desde horas temprana sale a trabajar para poder ganar un poco mejor y poder sastifacer las necesidades de su familia. Como ofrecer una mejor vivienda. El cual esta logrando con ayuda de Afodenic.
texts.en:
José is a young 22 year-old man who is the father of a family with one child. Together with his wife he works hard to improve their home. José works as a salesman for the Coca Cola company, traveling all over the capital to offer their products. His priority is to each day improve the house; with the previous loan he has succeeded in adding a room. Now he wants to plaster the walls, purchase secure doors, as the current ones are in poor shape, add a floor, as the current one is just dirt, and improve the decoration by painting. For these projects José will purchase construction materials like sand, cement, stone, flooring, and paint to begin. Only with this loan can he make these improvements, as his salary is minimal and he gets paid by commission. For this reason he leaves very early to work in the morning to earn a little more and thus be able to satisfy his family's needs, like a better home. He is succeeding with the help of Afodenic.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sand, cement, stone, flooring, and doors to make improvements to his family's living conditions

loans.name: Mboh

texts.en:
F. was born April 10, 1960 and is a widow. She has five children, all over fifteen years of age. She stays in a two-room house with the three wives to her late husband. Her sad moments are when she thinks of the deaths of her husband and four children. This is her second loan since she joined GHAPE in 2008 with the first loan being 40 000FRS.

She plans to buy vegetables, which she supplies in Yaounde and Douala - cities of Cameroon. She will also buy fowls for her poultry business and fertilizer to increase her farm production.

She thinks she will succeed due to the fact that she has a good idea in the business. The profit will be used to educate her children and also to increase her capital.

Her business will help the community to have sufficient vegetables, chickens and food items.

About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, fowls, seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married. She has a 9-year-old child. Olga is an entrepreneur from Nikopol where she works in two different marketplaces – Venetsiya and Pervomaiskyi. She sells knitwear and underwear items. Olga is very prudent. She started her business 6 years ago and worked hard to give it a solid standing. Presently, Olga has 70,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. Her income amounts to 17,000 Grivnyas.   

Olga is seeking a 15,800 Grivnya loan to purchase additional merchandise. She offers this type of inventory at reasonable prices. It is always in high demand. Olga is hoping to continue growing her venture in the future.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital.

loans.name: Josephine Ekua

texts.en:
Josephine Ekua M. sells cooked beans with 'gari' (manioc couscous) at Elmina. Josephine Ekua has received junior high education. She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a policeman.

Josephine Ekua has been selling cooked beans and 'gari' for some time now. She helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more beans to cook and more 'gari' for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a piece of land which their family house will be built on.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more beans to cook and 'gari' for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Codou

texts.fr: Codou D. est une femme de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc villageois depuis 4 ans et a bénéficié 8 fois de suite de crédits. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine, une activité qui lui génère de bénéfices lui permettant de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Codou D. is a 43-year-old married mother of 6 children. She has been a member of the Village Loan Group for 4 years and has benefited from 8 successive loans. She raises sheep, a business that generates a profit allowing her to take part in improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her sheep-rearing business

loans.name: Evelin De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Evelin de los Ángeles Z. R. de 29 años de edad, reside en Candelaria, ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como albañil, y sus dos hijos de 9 y 3 años de edad. Evelin, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de puros, negocio en el cual tiene 10 años de dedicarse, así mismo ella comercializa cosméticos y ropa, esto con el fin de poder obtener ganancias extras, debido a que el trabajo de su esposo no es constante, Evelin debe trabajar muy duro para poder llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar material para la elaboración de los puros, de esta manera ella podrá hacer mayor cantidad de productos atendiendo de esta manera a más clientes, así mismo desea poder comprar más cosméticos, los cuales son de los productos que más vende, de esta manera ella podra ofrecer variedad en sus productos. Esto la llena de mucha ilusión ya que le será posible mejorar las condiciones económicas de su hogar.
texts.en:
Evelin de los Ángeles Z. R., 29, lives in Candelaria, Cuscatlán department with her husband, who is a bricklayer, and their two children, 9 and 3 years old, respectively. Evelin makes and sells cigars. She has been in this line of work for 10 years; she also sells cosmetics and clothing in order to make extra income because her husband's employment isn't consistent. Evelin must work very hard to provide for her family's daily support. She is requesting funding to buy cigar-making supplies so that she can manufacture a larger quantity and meet the demand of more customers. She also wants to buy more cosmetics, which are her highest-selling items, so that she can offer a greater variety of products. This fills her with hope that she will be able to improve her household's economic conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cigar-making supplies.

location.town: Candelaria en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her ability to invest in her business

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Don Miguel es un hombre de iniciativa, tiene 53 años de edad, por falta de trabajo, no logro poder desempeñarse en su carera, pero eso no le impidió poder trabajar ya que se ha dedicado a la venta de chatarra el cual compra y vende, su esposa procreo cinco hijos de los cuales estudian para una mejor educación. Con el dinero del préstamo siempre invierte en el negocio para aumentar las ventas a mayor lo cual le generan mejores ganancias. Para el es difícil abecés ya que tiene que comprar mucha chatarra pero su capital no le ajusta. Es por eso compra todo lo que sea de hierro, alambre, plancha, abanicos, zinc sillas de metal, rines de carro, y otros, claro todas en mal estado por reciclaje. Sus planes es poder seguir incrementado para poder apoyar a sus hijos que cumplan su ciclo de estudio. Contento con el financiamiento ya que gracias al préstamo hace posible su inversión. En donde comprara mas productos de metal como los mencionado anterior para seguir llenando su bodega que tiene para venderlo a la rastra completa.
texts.en:
Miguel, 53, is filled with initiative. Because of lack of employment opportunities he was unable to practice his profession. This, however, did not stop him from working and he has worked reselling junk metal items. He and his wife had five children, who study to get a better education. He always invests his loan funds in his business so that he can increase sales and thereby higher profits. It's difficult for him because sometimes he must buy large quantities of junk metal but he lacks enough funds to do so. He buys all kinds of metal items like wire, metal sheeting, fans, zinc metal sheets, metal chairs, automobile tire rims, etc. Of course, all these items are in very poor condition because of the recycling. His plans are to continue growing so that he can see to his children finishing their school cycle. He is happy with the financing because it makes his investment possible where he will buy metal items like those mentioned above to continue to stock his storeroom for later sale at the flea markets.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy junked metal pieces, metal rims, metal panels, fans, wire, zinc metal sheeting, metal chairs etc.

loans.name: Anielka De La Concepcion

texts.es: Anielka tiene 26 años, por lo que es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora. Esta joven es cliente de Fundación León 2000 desde hace 4 años, por lo que ha sido lo más importante para mantener a su hijo. Ella lucha todos los días para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, por lo que ella mejora las técnicas para atraer a sus clientes ella visita la vivienda de sus clientes, además les aconseja cuales son los productos más recomendables para cada uno de ellos. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de ciertos productos necesarios como cremas, colonias, tratamientos, pintura de uñas, pintura de labios entre otros productos. Su deseo es tener una tienda para generar más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Anielka, 26, is a hard-working, tenacious woman. She has been collaborating with Fundación León for four years which has been very important for her in supporting her son. She struggles daily to improve her family's living conditions. She improves her techniques to attract more customers. She visits her customers in their homes and advises them on which products are most recommended for each one of them. She requests funding to buy certain needed products like creams, colognes, treatments, nail polish, lipsticks, among other. Her wish is to have a store in order to produce more income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Minerva Mirabal 1&2 Group

texts.en:
Soraida is the coordinator of her group 'Minerva Mirabal' (named after one of the famed trio of sisters who stood up to Dictator Rafael Trujillo and paid the ultimate price for doing so), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the slums north of the capital Santo Domingo where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her 5 children.

Soraida is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling bacon and sausage by purchasing 180 lbs of meat. She will use the profits to invest in her business with the goal of one day owning a corner store that will meet all the needs of the people in her neighborhood. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Meat with which to make bacon and sausage

loans.name: Koubowa

texts.en: Koubowa M. is married and has 2 children. She sells fabrics and veils, most commonly worn by Muslim women. She works in the Nukafu market in Lomé, Togo. Mrs. M. has been in this business since 2007. She is now asking for her first loan from WAGES. She will use this loan to replenish her stock of fabrics and veils to satisfy her customers’ needs.

loans.use: Fabric and veils.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary N. is married and has two children. She has received junior high education. Mary cooks banku and okra soup for sale at Elmina, which she has been doing for some time now. Her husband is a teacher. Mary uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Mary will use the loan to purchase more maize for her banku business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to save to build a house.
 
To prepare her banku, she makes sure she gets her corn dough (maize that has been milled and left to prove. After milling the maize, is not used immediately but left until the following day before it can be used.) and cassava dough.
She makes a mixture with the cassava and corn dough in a porridge form, stirs on fairly hot heat for sometime to get a firm but fine texture, firm enough to be eaten.

The accompanying dish can either be any kind of soup or sauce of your taste such as palm nut soup, groundnut soup or peanut soup, okra soup, hot pepper sauce with fish of any kind. 

She wasn't cooking as at the time the picture was taken. She was therefore asked to demonstrate how the Banku is prepared.

loans.use: Mary will use the loan to purchase more maize for her banku business.

loans.name: Imelda Pastora

texts.es: Imelda Pastora tiene 52 años, por lo que  su actividad económica es una librería. La fuerza emprendedora y las gansa de salir a cumplir con todos sus sueños son las que la motivan a salir adelante. Por lo que tiene 10 años de dedicarse a este negocio, que está ubicada en su humilde vivienda en donde ofrece los productos necesarios, ya que se acerca la entrada a clases y quiere aprovechar ya que tiene ciertos pedidos, y será de gran ayuda para ella. El financiamiento es para la compra de cuadernos, lápices, borradores, marcadores, hojas de block, folders y calculadora. Ella sueña con  incrementar su negocio, pues esto sería de gran importancia para ella.
texts.en:
Imelda Pastora, 52, has a bookstore. Her entrepreneureal spirit and wish to get ahead in life and see all her dreams come true motivate her to continue forward. She has been in this line of work for 10 years. Her store is located in her humble home. She stocks all those items that are necessary, especially now that the new school term is nearing; she wants to take advantage of the orders she has pending. This will be of great help to her. The funding will be used to buy notebooks, pencils, erasers, markers, sheet of paper, folders and a calculator. She dreams with enlarging her business; this would be very important to her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stationery items.

loans.name: Adjélévi

texts.en: Adjélévi G. sells grocery products outside her home in the Agbalépédo region of Lomé, Togo. She is married and has 3 children. She began this business in 2008 and is now asking for her first loan with WAGES. She will use this loan to purchase soap, dairy products, and dried pasta. This resupplying of her stock will help her meet her customers’ demands.

loans.use: A variety of grocery products.

loans.name: Brenda Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Brenda del Socorro E. L., vende ropa para varones, sandalias y gorras a dos cuadra aledañas del Mercado central Chinandega, la señora E. solicito el crédito para surtir su negocio con mercadería para la temporada de playa, que ahorita en su negocio no tenia en existencia, ella anteriormente le ayudaba a su tía a ver sus tiendas y luego le motivó y decidió poner su tienda con la ayuda de su mamá y su tía que le brindaron ayuda económicamente.
La señora E. es madre de dos hijos en edad escolar  por lo que ella se esfuerza enormemente en su negocio para poder llevar el sustento en su hogar.
texts.en:
Señora Brenda del Socorro E. L. sells boys clothing, sandals and hats, 2 blocks in front of the central market Chinandega. Señora E. is seeking a loan to stock her business with merchandise for the beach season, as at the moment there isn't any in her shop. Señora E. used to help her aunt in her shops, and later became motivated and decided to have her own shop, with the help of her mother and her aunt, who have assisted her economically. Señora E. is the mother of 2 school-aged children, for which reason she works enormously hard in her business to be able to sustain her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes and beach sandals

loans.name: Mercedes Lisseth

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes C. posee una pulpería en su casa de habitación en el departamento de Chinandega,  ella misma la atiende y  es madre de un niño de 3 años.
Este financiamiento ella lo solicitó para comprar mas productos para su pulpería  tales como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, golosinas,  entre otros y así tener mas variedad que ofrecer, anteriormente ella empezó vendiendo bolsas plásticas en su casa.
La señora Mercedes C., lleva con Ceprodel 20 créditos anteriormente  los cuales ha ella le han servido mucho porque ha incrementado su negocio y con este a podido sacar adelante a su hijo.
texts.en:
Señora Mercedes C. possesses a grocery store in her house in the Chinandega department. She herself attends the store and is mother to a 3 year old boy. This loan that she is seeking is for the purchase of more products for her grocery store, such as rice, beans, sugar, lollies, amongst others, so she can have a greater variety to offer her customers. Señora C. began by selling plastic bags at her house. Señora C. has had 2 loans with Ceprodel 20 previously, which have served her greatly because she has increased her business and with this has been able to improve life for her son.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for grocery store

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: La señora Josefa Ramírez es casada con el señor Maximiliano y son clientes distinguidos de nuestra institución ya que anteriormente se les otorgo un crédito para la construcción de una barda en el lado de su casa y su crédito fue pagado siempre con puntualidad, por lo tanto se le esta tramitando un nuevo crédito para terminar la construcción de la misma ya que es un espacio muy grande y desean concluir este proyecto. Ella labora para una empresa como supervisora de control de calidad y el es empleado de una fabrica; son una familia muy trabajadora y responsable.
texts.en:
Señora Josefa Ramírez is married to Señor Maximiliano and they are distinguished clients of the institution, as previously they received a loan for the construction of a wall at the side of their house, and the loan was always paid punctually. For this she is seeking a new loan to finish construction of the same as it is a very big space and they want to conclude this project. Señora Josefa Ramírez works for a company as quality control supervisor and Señor Maximiliano works in a factory, they are a very hard-working and responsible family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: FInish building the lateral wall of their house

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth E. is single and has one child. She has received junior high education.

Elizabeth is a hairdresser who, for some time now, has owned a beauty salon in Elmina that sells hair products, such as weave-ons and wigs. Elizabeth uses her income in payment of school fees and utility bills.

Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more weave-ons and other hairdressing products to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to open her own shop.

loans.use: To purchase more weave-ons and other hairdressing products to sell

loans.name: Fátima Ivone

texts.es: La señora Fátima Ivone es casada con el señor Jesús Manuel Vela  y son una familia muy estable y unida, ella trabaja para una Parroquía como secretaria desde hace 4 años y su esposo trabaja para el Correo Nacional de nuestra ciudad, anteriormente se les otorgó un crédito para la ampliación de un cuarto de su casa, proyecto que fue realizado y sus pagos se registraron siempre con puntualidad. Nuevamente tramitan el crédito para la colocación del vitropiso del cuarto que construyeron y del resto de su casa. Ya que son clientes distinguidos de nuestra Institución.
texts.en:
Fátima Ivone is married to Jesús Manuel Vela and they are a very stable and united family. Fátima has worked as a parish secretary for 4 years, and her husband works for the national post office. Previously they were granted a loan for the extension of a room in their house, a project that has now been finished. They made their payments punctually and they are arranging a loan once again to lay a floor in the room they constructed, and in the rest of the house. They are distinguished clients of the Institution.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Laying a floor in their house

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “SAGRADA FAMILIA”, está conformada por 10 socios entusiastas y luchadores, quienes tienen por afinidad dedicarse al comercio minorista, trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desD. hace 2 años.
Hilda es una socia del grupo comunal y a su vez asume el cargo D. presidenta, tiene 50 años, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a la confección D. ropa desD. hace 4 años, se inicio en este negocio porque inicialmente trabajo en un taller, en el cual logro aprender y decidió independizarse, con el esfuerzo D. su labor diaria ha logrado la construcción D. su vivienda D. material noble y la compra D. maquinarias (1 remalladora y 4 rectas).
Uno D. los grandes sueños D. Hilda es ampliar más su negocio y solo administrarlo.
El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido en la compra D. mercadería, todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a cumplir con los pagos respectivos.
texts.en:
The communal bank 'Sagrada Familia' is maD. up of 10 enthusiastic and hard-working members, who all work in the retail traD. and work with Edaprospo - prosperity for 2 years. Hilda is one member of the group and she assumes the role of President. She is 50 years old, married with 2 children, and has worked making clothes for 4 years. She began this business because she initially worked in a workshop, in which she managed to learn and decided to become independent. With the force of her daily labour she has achieved the construction of her house with fine material and the purchase of machinery (1 overlocker and 4 sewing machines). One of HIlda's biggest dreams is to increase her business more and administer it by herself. The loan, when it is granted, will be invested in the purchase of merchandise. All of our associates are thankful for the support given to them and promise to comply with their respective repayments terms.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
La señora Amalia R. O. vende ropa y cosméticos en Esteli el negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitación del parque infantil 2 cuadra al oeste ½ al sur
Doña Amalia va usar el crédito para comprar ropa , su negocio empezó cuando comenzó a vender perfume que se lo enviaban del extranjero sus hijo y luego fue vendiendo ropa para damas y caballero
