Amalia ha tenido su propio negocio desde hace unos diez años aproximadamente.
Ante de tener el negocio era ama de casa y comenzó con un ahorro de 3000 córdoba este es el segundo crédito que tiene con Ceprodel el primero lo utilizo para comprar una vitrina par exhibir su producto de venta.
texts.en:
Amalia R. O. sells clothing and Esteli brand cosmetics. She works from her home, which is 2 blocks west and 1/2 block south of Parque Infantil. Amalia will use the funding to buy clothing. She started her business selling perfume that her son would send her from abroad; then she started selling clothing for men and women. Amalia has had her own business for about ten years now. Prior to having the business, she was a housewife. She started out with her 3000 córdoba savings. This is her second loan with Ceprodel; she used the first one to buy a display case to show her products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy unisex clothing.

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
Priscila A. R. lives with her family in La Suiza de Turrialba, a quiet and tranquil region near Costa Rica’s central valley. Priscila is 25 years old and is currently in her 3rd year at “The University for Distance Education” (UNED) studying to become a preschool teacher.

A goal of Priscila’s is to be able to contribute to her family’s income in a significant way, as does her brother. Priscila aspires to open her own business selling clothes in an effort to gain financial independence and to finance her university costs (books, tuition, transportation, etc.). Priscila has developed her sales experience by assisting a colleague with her business.

This will be Priscila’s first loan with Fundacion Mujer. This loan will be used to make initial investments in clothing products to be sold in her community and at university. She will purchase clothes from a store in nearby Cartago (an hour from Turrialba) to sell in La Suiza. Priscila is confident in her estimation of potential earnings to be sought via sales to neighbors, friends and acquaintances.

As a full-time student, most of Priscila’s day is spent in classes; however, she plans to dedicate at least three hours after class every day to her business. Priscila says that for business advice, she consults her mother or sister.

Priscila has been studying part-time to become a preschool teacher since 2003. For financial reasons, she wasn’t able to afford enrollment in a full-time schedule. Recently she has been granted a scholarship with UNED which she will use to enroll in full-time studies. Every fifteen days she must travel to Turrialba (thirty minutes by bus) to attend university - the rest of her classes she takes on the Internet. Part of her motivation to become a teacher stems from the fact that she has always liked caring for children.

Priscila is a hardworking, determined and competent woman. With limited time, she skillfully balances her schedule: Tuesdays and Thursdays she spends working at a local day care; the rest of her time is divided between studying and babysitting her 8-year-old niece. Priscila also loves to play volleyball; she used to have more time to devote to her sport on a competitive team but recently it has become more of a hobby. She likes to spend weekends with her family.

loans.use: To start a business selling clothing

loans.name: Confines Del Sur Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco comunal “Confines del Sur” son de la ciudad de Angol, ubicada a 2 horas hacia el sur de Temuco, en la Región de la Araucanía. Temuco se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile) y posee una serie de balnearios lacustres y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativa. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existentes en nuestro país.
Ellas se dedican principalmente a la venta de ropa nueva y usada, venta de provisiones y verduras en ferias, a atender bazares, librerías y  peluquerías. 
Noemí, es la presidenta de este BC. En la foto es la única mujer rubia de la 1º fila. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa juvenil y ropa interior, puerta a puerta y confecciona recuerdos para eventos tales como graduaciones, bautizos y matrimonios. 
Noemí invertirá este préstamo en ropa para vender. Con ella vive su hija menor de 7 años , la cual es su gran motivación para trabajar. Su sueño es tener un negocio establecido en su propia casa, para de esta manera alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Para Noemí Fondo Esperanza ha significado una oportunidad y herramientas para surgir.
texts.en:
The members of the "Confines del Sur" communal bank are from Angol, which is two hours south of Temuco, in the Araucanía region. Temuco is 670 kilometers south of Santiago, Chile's capital, and it has several lakeside resorts and very showy flora and fauna. It's worth noting that this area is home to 50% of Mapuche, an indigenous people of Chile. Most of the members sell new and used clothing. Some sell groceries and vegetables in the markets, some tend to sales stalls, bookstores, barbershops. Noemí is the president of the communal bank. In the photo, she is the only blonde in the first row. She sells underwear and young adult clothing door-to-door; she also makes souvenirs for events like graduations, baptisms and weddings. Noemí will use the funds to buy clothing to sell. Her 7-year-old daughter, who is the motivating force in her life, lives with her. Her dream is to have an established store in her home so that she can reach a better quality of life. For Noemí, Fondo Esperanza has meant an opportunity and the tools to surge ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Petita Paula

texts.es:
Paula C. de 44 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento pero solo tiene luz como servicio básico. Su esposo trabaja de guardia en una empresa nocturna. Tiene 3 hijos de 20, 18, 10 años todos estudiando.

Paula comenzó hace 3 años vendiendo aretes, plumas y arroz por libra poco a poco incremento su capital y empezó a implementar víveres.

Paula ahora tiene una tienda y trabaja todos los días desde las 06:30 hasta las 21h00, trabaja con la ayuda de su hijo mayor vendiendo aceites, arroz, atún y artículos para bazar. Una de las dificultades es que vive en una loma y le cuesta llevar la mercadería a la tienda. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, laminas, perfumes para poder surtir más su negocio. En el futuro quiere poner otro local pero con mas artículos de bazar.
texts.en:
Paula C., 44, lives in a periurban zone of Paraíso de Guayaquil; the only utility in her cement house is electricity. Her husband is employed as a night security guard. She has three children, who are 20, 18, and 10 years old; all are students. Paula began 3 years ago selling earrings, pens and pounds of rice; as her capital gradually increased, she added groceries to her inventory. Paula now has a grocery store where she works daily from 6:30 until 9pm. Her eldest son helps her to sell cooking oil, rice, tuna, and kitchenware. One of the difficulties she faces is that she lives on a hill and it's rough having to carry the merchandise to the store. She will use the funds to buy notebooks, prints and perfumes to better stock her store. In the future, she wants to open a second store but stocked with more kitchenware.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Perfumes, notebooks, prints.

loans.name: Aida Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Aida Esperanza F. es una persona que depende de los envió de remesa de sus hijo que están en Estado Unido de Norte América. Ella se dedica ala elaboración de ropa.
Aida va usar el crédito para pagar la mano de obra de la reparación de su casa ya que la van a repellar y además va a comprar arena.
Ella espera que la remodelación de su vivienda le ayude a estar mas cómoda y le de una mayor presentación a su vivienda .
Aida es madre soltera tiene 3 hijo todos ellos mayores de edad  y no tiene persona a su cargo. Este es el segundo crédito con Ceprodel ella dice que el crédito anterior fue de gran ayuda ya que con ese crédito pudo construir su casa.
texts.en:
Aida Esperanza F.'s main source of income is the money sent to her by her son, who is in the United States. She is a seamstress. Aida will use the funds to pay labor costs to have her house replastered; she will also buy sand. She hopes that the repairs will help her to be more comfortable and that her house will be more attractive. Aida is a single mother of three adult children; she has no one under her care. This is her second loan with Ceprodel. She tells us that the previous loan was of great help to her because it allowed her to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home repairs and to buy sand.

loans.name: Cleotilde Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Cleotilde tiene un negocio que es ofrecer el servicio de costura. Ella vende sus productos en sus comarcas  de manera ambulante y en su casa de habitación, con la ayuda de su hija, realiza las compras de materia prima del negocio en el mercado de Managua ya que en este lugar los precios son más favorables y  le generan mayores ingresos.  Es madre soltera de 59 años pero siempre ha batallado por salir adelante, es por ello que solicita un nuevo financiamiento para mejorar su negocio ya que es lo más importante que tiene. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Cleotilde, 59, is a seamstress. She sells her articles of clothing going from district to district and in her home; her daughter helps her. She buys raw materials in Managua's market, where the prices are the most favorable for her to generate higher earnings. She is a single mother who has always struggled to get ahead. For this reason, she is asking for new funding to improve her business because this is the most important thing she has. Her wish is to do some home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Fanny Margoth

texts.es:
Fanny Margoth R. P. tiene 55 años y vive en el municipio de  San Jacinto ubicado en el departamento de Bolívar. Fanny es madre de tres hijos entre las edades de 37 y 28. Población se caracterizada por la proliferación de mujeres dedicadas a la elaboración de artesanías, como hamacas  tejidas en telar artesanal, mochilas  y bolsos, mientras sus  cónyuges realizan labores del campo. En San Jacinto Fanny no es la excepción,  produce mochilas en crochet y simultáneamente tiene un negocio de modistería como su principal actividad, para la que  requiere un crédito de $2.000.000 que será invertido en la compra de telas para hacer uniformes escolares, aprovechando  que inicia la temporada de regreso al colegio. También tiene pensado  comprar hilo para  elaborar de mochilas tejidas.
La Sra. Fanny es una persona que ha trabajado desde muy joven y tiene aproximadamente 35 años de trabajar con su máquina de coser, actividad que aprendió en un colegio de monjas. Actualmente vive en su casa con su esposo que está dedicado a las labores del campo y dos nietos a los que educa   porque sus hijos viven en otras ciudades. Ella elabora vestidos  en las líneas femeninas y masculinas,  y  en la actualidad está confeccionando uniformes escolares. Fanny conoce el arte de tejer en crochet al que se dedica en sus ratos de descanso o cuando baja la temporada  de modistería,  es así como elabora lindas mochilas y bolsos tejidos que también vende y que requiere de la innovación constante para poder rotar estos productos.
Ingresó como cliente a la Fundación en 1996 como parte de un grupo solidario y recibió en ese entonces un crédito de $100.000, posteriormente ha realizado créditos como microempresaria individual en los últimos años y desde entonces dice: “ha mejorado notablemente mi entorno familiar con mis ingresos”. Se siente muy agradecida de pertenecer como usuaria a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, ya que le ha dado la oportunidad de seguir trabajando como independiente y seguir apoyando a sus nietos.
 Fanny  es una excelente miembro de familia que siempre cuenta con la solidaridad de sus vecinos que la ayudan en tiempos difíciles, porque quizá reconocen el ella su potencial de trabajo y capacidad de servicio.
texts.en:
Fanny Margoth R. Puerto is 55 years old. She lives in the San Jacinto Municipality, in the Bolivar region. Fanny has three children between the ages of 28 and 37. In her area, a number of women make crafts such as traditional woven hammocks, backpacks and purses. Their spouses usually do farm work. Fanny is no exception; she crochets backpacks, and she also has a dressmaking business, which is why she has applied for a loan. She plans to invest in fabric for school uniforms; she wants to be able to take advantage of the start of the school season. Fanny would also like to buy more yarn for woven backpacks. Fanny has been working since she was quite young. She learned how to use sewing machines in a convent school, and has been using them in her work for about 35 years. She lives with her husband, a field worker, and two of their grandchildren. Fanny and her husband are providing their grandchildren with an education, because their own children need to live and work elsewhere. In addition to school uniforms, Fanny makes men's and women's clothing. When the demand for tailoring is low, she takes advantage of her weaving and crochet skills by producing and selling bags and purses. She comes up with creative designs in order to keep people interested in buying her bags. Fanny started working with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation in 1996. She was part of a group that received a substantial loan. Since then, she has received individual micro-loans. "My family's standard of living has been greatly improved by my income," she says. She's grateful to be working with the Foundation, which has given her the opportunity to work independently and support her grandchildren. Fanny is a credit to her family, and she has the support of her neighbours in hard times, too. They recognize the value of her work.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fabric for school uniforms

loans.name: Eloy

texts.en: Eloy is a construction worker in New York City, originally from Ecuador. With his many years of construction experience, he decided to become his own boss two years ago. With his loan from ACCION USA, Eloy will purchase two jackhammers and other equipment for demolition work. He has found ACCION USA's financial education program very beneficial as it has provided helpful information and great support. Eloy dreams of being able to grow his business and employing others. By doing this he will be helping not only his family, but his workers' families as well, he says. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA: Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To purchase two jackhammers and other equipment for demolition work

loans.name: Gladys Vanesa

texts.es:
La señora Gladys Vanesa G. es maestra de secundaria ella da clase en una comunidad llamada Isidrillo a 6 km del Esteli.
Primero realiza su plan de trabajo y loimparte en periodo de 5 horas diaria de Lunes ha Viernes
Gladys va usar el crédito para la compra de cama matrimonial. Ella quiere una cama nueva ya que la que tiene ya dio su vida útil.
Gladys es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar ambos menores de edad y convive con su hermana.
Este es  el sexto crédito con Ceprodel ha trabajado con 4 años con Ceprodel. Ella dice que los créditos con Ceprodel le han ayudado mucho ya que ha solventado algunas necesidades y ha comprado  electrodomésticos que necesita para su hogar.
texts.en:
Gladys Vanesa G. is a secondary school teacher in a community called Isidrillo, which is 6 kilometers from Esteli. She draws up her lesson plan and then imparts it during a 5-hour period from Monday until Friday. Gladys will use her loan to buy a double bed. She wants a new bed because the one she has has given all it had to give. Gladys is a single mother of two, school-age children; she lives with her sister. This is her 6th loan with Ceprodel over the four years she has collaborated with Ceprodel. She states that Ceprodel's loans have been much help to her because they have covered some expenses and have paid for some home appliances she needed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a double bed.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel Sánchez desde hace 9 años tiene una venta de ropa usada en un lugar muy concurrido por la gente. Ella vende ropa, zapatos y artículos para el hogar a buen precio. Ella es una mujer sola que saco a sus hijos adelante y ya son hombres adultos que tienen su propia familia. La señora Maribel trabaja de esta manera para obtener ingresos, pero como ella quiere prepararse para el cambio de temporada de calor quiere comprar mercancía nueva para no estas desprevenida y tener todo para que sus clientes encuentren lo que necesiten. Ella recurre a esta institución pidiendo el apoyo para poder surtir su negocio de ropa para así obtener mas ingresos y ganancias.
texts.en:
Maribel Sánchez has sold used clothing for the past 9 years in a very busy location. She sells clothes, shoes and household articles at fair prices. She is a woman who has raised her children by herself; they are all grown men now with their own families. Maribel works this way in order to produce earnings. She now wants to be prepared for the change of seasons; she wants to buy clothes appropriate for the warmer weather so that she will have in stock everything her customers may want. She calls upon this institution asking for help to stock her clothing sales business in order to have higher income and profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To install a roof on his house.

loans.name: William

texts.es: El señor William tiene 41 años de edad, reside en un bario de la capital Andrés Castro, junto con su esposa y un hijo, juntos se están esforzando para lograr sus metas. Ella trabaja como jefa de servicios financieros el cual cubre parte de los gastos como pago de agua, luz, y pago del cuido del bebe. El negocio de don William es una tienda en el mercado Israel Lewites de venta de carcasas de celulares, cargadores, baterías de celulares de todo modelo, gorras calculadoras, y lentes, lleva ocho años vendiendo. El cual inicio por medio de su mama ya que ella se dedicaba a la venta de diferentes productos en el mercado el cual heredo. Lo que mas desea el es poder comprar el local ya que es alquilado y parte de sus ganancias quedan ahí. A pesar de las dificultades económicas que se le han presentado para finalizar sus estudios  lo esta logrando terminar la licenciatura en leyes lo cual solo le falta hacer la defensa es por eso la necesidad de este crédito es para pagar el tramite de su titilación que es de un alto costo y que no cuenta con ese capital. Contento por el apoyo que Afodenic esta otorgando ya que hará posible esta meta de culminar su carrera para poder encontrar un trabajo en donde tenga mejores oportunidad de ingreso.
texts.en:
William 41, lives in one of the capital's neighborhoods, that's called Andrés Castro, with his wife and son. Together they are struggling to reach their goals. She works as head of financial services, which produces enough to meet part of the household expenses like, utilities and babysitting costs. William has a retail store in the Israel Lewites market in which he sells a variety of products such as: cel phones, battery chargers, all models of cel phone batteries, caps, calculators, eyeglasses. He has been in this line of work for 8 years; he began through his mother, who sold various items in the market. He inherited her business. What he desires most of all is to buy the locale, which he currently leases, so that he can avoid leaving part of his profits in rent. Despite the financial difficulties he has had that have delayed his finishing his schooling, he is about to graduate from law school. All that he still needs is to defend his thesis. He needs this funding to pay for his graduation expenses because this process is very expensive and he lacks the funds to do so. He is happy with the help Afodenic has given because it will make possible his reaching the end of his professional preparation so that he can find work where earnings will be better.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for his final course and law school graduation expenses.

loans.name: Yader Javier

texts.es:
El señor Yader Javier S. M., tiene 28 años de edad es soltero y vive en el Barrio Pablo Calero, ahora esta viviendo con sus padres porque ha tenido problemas con su mujer, él se dedica al cultivo de la piña y se inicio en la agricultura gracias a su padre quien lo introdujo en el negocio desde muy pequeño.

Dentro de las Dificultades que el señor S. ha tenido a lo largo de estos años ha sido las plagas que acribillan a los cultivos y las enfermedades de las tierras que amenazan con el buen crecimiento de la cosecha, es por esta razón que el desea el préstamo par ainvertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes que salvaguarden con la producción y le garanticen a fuuturo la recuperacion del capital invertido, el señor Yader dice sentirse agradecido  por todas las veces que se le ha brindado los créditos porque es de esta forma que ha sacado adelante sus tierras y le han ayudado a mejorar sus condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Yader Javier S. M., 28, is single and lives in the Pablo Calero neighborhood with his parents, because he's had problems with his wife. He is a pineapple farmer and it was his father who introduced him to farming when he was still a little boy. Among the difficulties that Mr. S. has had over the years are the pests that decimate his crops and the diseases in the soil that threaten the growth of his crops. For this reason, he is asking for funding to buy fertilizers that will ensure production and guarantee that he will recoup his investment in the future. Yader is grateful for all the times that loans have been granted because they have allowed him to make his lands productive and have helped him to improve his economic condiditons.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and supplies for crop maintenance.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Manuel Antonio D. L. de 30 años de edad, es casado y vive en el Barrio El Edén, se dedican desde hace 17 años a la agricultura, ellos tienen 2 hijos menores de edad, que estudian la escuela primaria.

Son una familia humilde que dentro de las dificultades que se les han presentado han sido la  escases de agua potable, dentro de los planes que la familia tiene, están  el crear un pozo o comprar un tanque de agua que les suministre agua potable.  Para poder ejecutar estos planes,  desean brindarle al cultivo un mejor cuido debido a que las plagas amenazan con la producción ellos con el préstamo que solicitan lo invertirían en la compra de fungicidas y foliares, que garanticen el crecimiento correcto de la cosecha y con esto la oportunidad de poder vender la producción completa a un excelente precio, que les proporcione el capital necesario para futuros proyectos entre esto puede ser la compra del tanque de agua.
texts.en:
Manuel Antonio D. L., 30, is married and lives in the El Edén neighborhood. They have been farmers for 17 years. They have two, minor children, who are in elementary school. They are a humble family who, among the difficulties they have had to face, is the lack of drinking water. Part of the family's plan is to dig a well or buy a tank for drinking water. In order to do these projects, they need to care for their crops better because pests threaten production. The loan will be used to buy fungicides and leaf pesticides that will guarantee correct growth of the crop so that the entire harvest can be sold at an excellent price. This will then provide the necessary funds for future projects, among which is the purchase of the water tank.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies for crop maintenance.

loans.name: Sumacc Ayllu Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Sumacc Ayllu palabra en quechua que significa “Bonita Familia”, está ubicado en el distrito D. Yauli, que pertenece al departamento D. Huancavelica, tiene 8 socias y se encuentra en el ciclo 8.
 
Elisa, es casada, tiene 5 hijos, el mayor D. 16 años y L. menor D. 2 años, Elisa inicio su negocio D. venta D. artesanía haciendo tejidos para sus hijos, con sus vecinas aprendió a tejer pequeños llaveros, gorras, guantes D. colores que ahora teje en cantidad y manda para que se vendan en L. ciudad D. Huancavelica y en Lima. En esta época D. lluvias tiene dificultades con las ventas por las constantes lluvias y deslizamientos se ha interrumpido L. carretera y no hay pase a Huancavelica ni a Lima, Elisa aprovecha L. venta en las ferias D. su comunidad.

Eustaquia es casada, tiene 8 hijos, el mayor D. 18 años y el menor D. 2 años, Eustaquia se dedica a L. venta D. abarrotes, inició su negocio por necesidad, su esposo le ayuda llevándole mercadería en su carro desD. Huancavelica hasta L. comunidad, en L. cual solo hay 3 tiendas. DesD. que está en FINCA Perú es más responsable, sus hijos L. ayudan a sacar sus cuentas. El préstamo que solicita le ayudará en L. compra D. mas mercadería para su negocio, así tendrá más clienteL..
El sueño D. Eustaquia es que sus hijos estudien fuera D. L. comunidad, ellos quieren estudiar en Huancavelica y para eso tiene que hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Communal Bank Sumacc Ayllu's name is a quechua word that means "Beautiful Family." It is in the Yauli district, which is part of Huancavelica department. It is maD. up of 8 members and they are in their 8th loan cycle. Elisa is married and has 5 children, whose ages range from 16 to 2 years. Elisa began her crafts business knitting items for her children. Together with her neighbors, she learned how to knit small keyrings, caps, and gloves of many colors. She now knits large quantities of them and sends them to Huancavelica and Lima to be sold. During the rainy season sales are difficult due to the constant rains and landslides have washed away parts of the highway so the road between Huancavelica and Lima is interrupted. Elisa, then, must take advantage of the local markets to sell her wares. Eustaquia is married and has 8 children, whose ages range from 18 to 2 years. She sells groceries. She began this business based on need, there are only three stores in her community. Her husband brings her merchandise in his car from Huancavelica. Since she has been in FINCA Perú she is more responsible; her children help her with her accounts. The loan she is asking for will help her buy more stock items for her store so that she will have more customers.. Eustaquia's dream is that her children go to school outsiD. their community; they want to study in Huancavelic and to do so, the business has to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Elisa will buy supplies at wholesale.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal Huamanguina.
Lidia es casada, tiene 47 años y 5 hijos, Lidia se dedica a la compra y venta de ladrillos, actividad que realiza todos los días, además se dedica a la crianza de cerdos en su casa.
Lidia necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ladrillos.
El sueño de Lidia es que su ultimo hijo estudie en la universidad.
texts.en:
Lidia, 47, is a member of the Huamanguina communal bank. She is married and has 5 children. She sells brick daily. In addition, she raises pigs at home. She needs a 750 sol loan to buy bricks. Lidia's dream is that her youngest son go to university.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bricks.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Vicenta es socia del Banco Comunal Huamanguina.
Vicenta es casada, tiene 49 años y 2 hijos, Vicenta tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos, Vicenta además vende ropa en las diferentes ferias de la región.
Vicenta necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Vicenta es tener mas dinero para educar a sus hijos en la universidad y tener salud para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Vicenta, 49, is a member of the Huamanguina communal bank. She is married and has two children. She runs a grocery store at home; her children help her. In addition, Vicenta sells clothing at the region's various markets. Vicenta needs a 2000 sol loan to buy rice and sugar. Vicenta's dream is to have more money to be able to afford to send her children to university and to have good health so that she can continue to work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Griselda Rosario

texts.es:
Griselda es socia del Banco Comunal Huamanguina.
Griselda es casada, tiene 54 años y 5 hijos, Griselda tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Griselda necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Griselda son que sus hijos se superen y tener salud.
texts.en:
Griselda is a member of the Huamanguina Communal Bank. She's 54 years old, married, and has 5 children. Griselda has a store in her house where she sells groceries, vegetables, and meat every day. Griselda needs a loan of 900 Peruvian soles, money which she will invest in the purchase of rice and sugar. Griselda's dreams are for her children be successful and healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Jova Noemi

texts.es:
Jova P. de 25 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil. Su esposo es taxista, con el tiene 1 hijo esta embarazada de una niña. 

Jova comenzó a estudiar hace 4 años belleza, empezó con una plancha y algunos utensilios de belleza, poco a poco incremento su capital y puso un gabinete de belleza.

Jova ahora trabaja desde las 10h00 hasta las 21h00 todos los días, haciendo cortes de cabellos, tinturados, cepillados, planchados etc. No ha tenido complicaciones desde que comenzó el negocio.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una plancha de cabello, cremas, tratamientos para tener más variedad. En el futuro quiere tener otro gabinete de belleza.
texts.en:
Jova P. is 25 years old, and lives in a suburban area of Paraiso de Guayaquil. Her husband is a taxi driver; with him she has one son and is also expecting a daughter. Jova began studying as a beautician 4 years ago, and started out with an iron and some beauty implements. Little by little, she saved up and opened a beauty salon. Now Jova works from 10:00 AM to 9:00 PM every day giving hair cuts, colouring, brushing, straightening, etc. She has not experienced any complications since starting the business. With this loan, she will buy a straightening iron, creams, and treatments in order to have more variety. Someday she hopes to open another salon.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Irons, creams, treatments

loans.name: Yene America

texts.es:
Yene es socia del Banco Comunal Huamanguina.
Yene es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos, Yene tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende abarrotes en general, carnes, verduras, Yene también tiene pensado cambiar de local. Además Yene vende ropa en una tienda y también reparte a pedido.
Yene necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago de alquiler del local.
Yene sueña con brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Yene is a member of the Huamanguina Communal Bank. She has a common-law husband, is 32 years old, and has 3 children. Yene has a store in a rented space where she sells dry goods, meat, and produce. She is considering moving to a different location. In addition, Yene sells clothes in a store, and also on order. Yene needs a loan of 600 soles which she will use to pay the rent on her store. Yene dreams of providing a good education to her children and of growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay the rent on the store

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
ClotilD. es socia del Banco Comunal Huamanguina.
ClotilD. es viuda, tiene 66 años y 9 hijos D. los cuales 6 viven con ella, ClotilD. venD. alfalfa, verduras D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado D. abastos, actividad que realiza todos los días.
ClotilD. necesita un préstamo D. 450 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. alfalfa.
texts.en:
ClotilD. is a member of the Huamanguina Communal Bank. She is a 66 year old widow with 9 children, 6 of whom live with her. ClotilD. is a strolling vendor and sells alfalfa and other produce in the food market every day. ClotilD. needs a loan of 450 soles, which she will use to purchase alfalfa.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of alfalfa

loans.name: Franklin Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Franklin Antonio S. H. tiene 42 años, y con su esposa vive en el Reparto Roberto Juan Padilla, ellos tienen 3 hijos de los cuales todos sobreviven del sustento diario que el señor S. les provee. El señor Franklin desde hace 6 años tiene una refresquería y dentro de las principales dificultades están la falta de financiamiento que ha recibido de parte de las micro financieras, para esto el señor ha trabajado duro para poder reconstruir la infraestructura de su hogar.

Ahora que el negocio cuenta con un capital más amplio, es que él opto por este préstamo, con el crédito comprará los materiales de construcción y dentro de las remodelaciones que hará serán dos cuartos para los hijos mayores esto les brindara mayor comodidad, seguridad y sobre todo independencia debido a que están en una etapa de adolescencia en donde reclaman un espacio personal. Ellos son una familia unida que ha salido adelante gracias al trabajo de todos los días esto es del reconocimiento de los habitantes del lugar donde moran y es digno de reconocer.
texts.en:
Mr. Franklin Antonio S. H. is 42 years old, and lives with his wife in the Roberto Juan Padilla district. They have 3 children, all of whom live on the income that Mr. S. provides for them. Franklin has had a soda shop for 6 years, and amongst the main challenges has been the lack of financing he has received from micro finance organizations. Because of this, he has worked very hard to be able to rebuild his home. Now that the business is doing well, he has chosen to apply for this loan. With the funds he will buy construction materials. Part of the remodeling he plans are two rooms for his eldest children, which will offer them more comfort, security, and above all, independence. They are at a stage of their adolescence where they need personal space of their own. This is a very close family that has gotten ahead thanks to daily hard work. It's worth noting that this is something that is recognized by the people in their neighbourhood.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Merle Auxiliadora

texts.es: La Señora Merle Auxiliadora tiene 26 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería hace mas de 3 años, que se dedica a este negocio es madre de 2 niños que dependen de ella, por lo que se esmera mucho por proporcionarle lo necesario a su familia.  En la actualidad ya cuenta con mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad, es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes ya que diariamente se levanta muy temprano para comprar visitar al mercado y comprar los productos necesarios para su negocio. Este es el motivo del financiamiento para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan, galletas, jugos, gaseosas entre otros productos. Su deseo es seguir creciendo con su negocio, que es su medio de vida.
texts.en:
Merle Auxiliadora, 26, has had a small grocery store for the past 3 years. She has two, dependent children; they are the reason she works so hard to provide for her family's needs. Currently, she has a lot of experience in this line of work. She is well-known and well-liked among her customers. She rises very early every morning to go to market to buy the goods she will need for her store. This is the reason for her loan request: to buy sweets, beverages, bread, cookies, juices, soft-drinks, among others. Her wish is to continue to have her business, which is her means of support, grow.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bundles of used tee shirts, pants, children's clothing, and sheets

loans.name: Bismarck Antonio

texts.es:
El  microempresario: Bismarck Antonio M.tiene 43 años de edad, es casado con 4 hijos, los cuales se encuentran estudiando. El microempresario M.se dedica a la actividad de barbería desde hace unos 25 años en esta ciudad de Bluefields. Según el señor M.el ofrece a los clientes sus servicios de venta de refrescos y a la vez pone a su disposición un televisor con cable para que se entretengan mientras esperan para que se les realice su corte de cabello.

Este microempresario ya ha sido beneficiado con un préstamo por parte de kiva el cual le permite poder contratar a otras dos personas para que también realicen ente tipo de actividad y poder mejorar sus ingresos. A la vez aprovecha para agradecer a los prestamistas que han confiado en el entregando sus dineros el cual ya este ya ha regresado a ADEPHCA como socia de Kiva.

Actualmente quiere mejorar sus condiciones en el negocio y por tal razón esta solicitando para comprar los siguientes artículos:

Una silla de barbero que esta valorada en US 700 dólares, 2 maquinas de cortar cabellos valoradas cada una en US 50 dólares y una refrigeradora valorada en US 200 dólares.

Según el microempresario M.tanto la silla de barbero como la refrigeradora las necesita ya que las que tenia en uso se deterioraron y debe remplazarlas.
texts.en:
The small businessman Bismarck Antonio M.is 43 years old, married, and has 4 children who study in school. Since he was 25 years old, he has had a barbershop in the city of Bluefields. According to Señor Miranda, he offers his customers his services, selling soft drinks and offering cable TV for their entertainment while he cuts their hair. This businessman has already benefited from a Kiva loan that allowed him to hire 2 other people who also cut hair, so that he could increase his income. He would like to thank the lenders who trusted in him by handing over their money; this money has already been paid back to ADEPHCA, a partner with Kiva. Now he wants to improve the condition of his business, and for this reason he is requesting a loan to buy the following items: a barber chair valued at $700 US dollars, 2 hair clipper machines, each valued at $50 US dollars, and a refrigerator valued at $200 US dollars. According to businessman Miranda, both the barber chair and the refrigerator are needed since the ones he has have deteriorated and need to be replaced.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a barber chair, 2 hair-cutting (hair clipper) machines, and a refrigerator

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
TeofiL. es socia del Banco Comunal Huamanguina.
TeofiL. es casada, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, TeofiL. se dedica a L. compra y venta D. animales, los compra en las ferias y los comercializa en su distrito D. Acosvinchos, además TeofiL. venD. bebidas, galletas en su casa.
TeofiL. necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. animales menores.
TeofiL. sueña con mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
TeofiL. is a member of the Huamanguina Communal Bank. TeofiL. is married, 40 years old and has 4 children. TeofiL. makes her living buying and selling animals. She purchases them at market and sells them in her district, Acosvinchos. In addition, TeofiL. sells drinks and cookies from her house. TeofiL. needs a loan of 600 (PEN), which is money that will be invested in the purchase of small animals. TeofiL. dreams of improving her business and giving her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of small animals.

loans.name: Betzabeth

texts.es:
Betzabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Orcasitas II.
Betzabeth es conviviente, tiene 21 años y 1 hijo, Betzabeth junto a su pareja se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales, sus ventas los realiza en el mismo lugar. Además tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Betzabeth necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago de peones.
Los sueños de Betzabeth son construir su casa y comprar un carro para que trabaje su esposo.
texts.en:
Betzabeth is a member of the Orcasitas II Communal Bank. She is 21 years old, lives with a partner, and has a child. She and her partner are engaged in manufacturing hand-made bricks, selling them in the same location. She also has a grocery story in her house. Betzabeth needs a loan of 900 soles, to be used to pay her workers. Her dreams are to build her house and buy a car, so that her spouse can work.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay workers

loans.name: Limonario Group

texts.es:
El grupo Limonario está integrado por  tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Sara María H. R. quien desde 2006 empezó a comercializar ropa de forma ambulante. Esta señora de 34 años comenzo desde a bajo a luchar por sacar a delante a su familia especialmente por brindarle la mejor educación a sus tres hijos. Esto se ha hecho posible gracias a los prestamos según comenta Hernándes porque su negocio ha mejorado y su calidad de vida tambien.

Sus compañeros de grupo Norman Alberto J. vende fresco y Martha Lorena H. vende pollo, frescos, hielo y helados. Ambos desean seguir adelante y trabajar arduamente para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
The Limonario group is made up of three hardworking women, one of whom is Sara María H. R.. Sara María began selling clothing on the street in 2006. This 34 year old woman started from the bottom and has been working to improve her family's situation, and especially to give her three children a better education. According to Hernándes, this has been possible thanks to the loans; her business has improved, as well as her quality of life. Her partners in the group are Norman Alberto J., who sells beverages, and Martha Lorena H., who sells chicken, beverages, ice and ice cream. Both wish to continue improving their situations and to work arduously for the well being of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Erica

texts.es:
Erica es socia del Banco Comunal Orcasitas II.
Erica es conviviente, tiene 21 años y 1 hijo, Erica tiene una tienda en la casa de sus padres en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carnes, además Erica compra y vende tara y cochinilla.
Erica necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tara, cochinilla.
Los sueños de Erica son tener casa propia y que su hijo sea profesional.
texts.en:
Erica is a member of the Communal Bank "Orcasitas II". Erica is 21, lives with her partner, and has one child. She runs a store in her parents' house, where she sells groceries, vegetables and meat. Erica also buys and sells cochinilla [a red dye] and products derived from the tara tree [a tree native to Peru]. She needs a loan of 900 Peruvian Soles, which she will use to buy cochinilla and tara products. Erica dreams of having her own house and of seeing her son have a professional career.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cochinilla and tara products

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es: Doña Maria Nicolasa es una mujer emprendedora en su negocio, tiene 43 años de edad, casada y con tres hijos los cuales estudian. Su esposo es conductor de recorrido y su negocio de Maria es la venta de cosmético que durante once años vende una variedades de productos como: cremas para cuerpo, de limpieza de cutis, cremas para hacer faciales, perfumenes, body, pinturas de labios, vanidades, maquillajes y otros son de productos de la Avon, vende por encargo y mantiene para ofrecer a sus clientes. También trabaja en costura de vestidos nuevos como hacer rumbos pequeños y de esa manera se ayuda con otros ingresos. Con el crédito anterior invirtió también en su negocio lo cual ha logrado captar muchos clientes. También desea hacer mejoras a su casa como hacer las divisiones de su sala de concreto, poner piso para una mejor higiene pero poco a poco lo hará con las ganancias y ahorros de su esposo ya que con este crédito invertirá en cosmético como ropa escolar, faldas, camisas, calcetas y otros para aumentar las ventas.Da las gracias por el financiamiento ya que se ha beneficiado para incrementar sus ventas el cual es su fuente de trabajo.
texts.en:
Maria Nicolasa, 43, is an enterprising woman in her business. She's married and has three children, who are students. Her husband is a public transportation driver and Maria's business is selling cosmetics. For 15 years she has sold a variety of items like: body creams, skin cleansers, facial creams, perfumes, lipstick, make-up, and other Avon products. She sells on order and keeps some stock on hand to offer her customers. She also makes new clothing items, like party dresses, to earn extra income. She used her previous loan to invest in her business thus gaining many customers. She also wants to do some home improvements, like building concrete dividing walls in her living room, install flooring for better hygiene. She expects to gradually be able to do them with her profits and her husband's savings. She will use this new loan to buy cosmetics and school clothes like skirts, shirts, socks and other items to increase sales. She is thankful for the financing because it has been beneficial for her to increase her sales, which is her sole source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and school clothes.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Orcasitas II.
Nancy es casada, tiene 33 años y 3 hijos, Nancy junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales, sus ventas los realiza en el mismo lugar.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago de los peones.
El sueño de Nancy es salir adelante.
texts.en:
Nancy, 33, is a member of the Orcasitas II communal bank. She is married and has three children. Together with her husband, Nancy manufactures bricks, which she sells from the same location. Nancy needs a 900 sol loan that she will use to pay her laborers. Nancy's dream is to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay her laborers.

loans.name: Socorro Victoria

texts.es:
Socorro tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el sector Cruce Jaén Antiguo del distrito de Olmos, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de apoyar a la economía familiar la llevó a instalar en su vivienda una pequeña bodega donde ofrece frutas de estación y golosinas a sus clientes. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar al sostenimiento de su familia.

Socorro desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de abarrotes y de productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite) ya que existen pocas bodegas de ese tipo por la zona en donde vive. Por este motivo ha creido conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Socorro es una joven emprendedora, trabajadora y perseverante. Su mayor anhelo es hacer crecer su negocio y que este se haga más conocido en la zona.
texts.en:
Socorro, 27, is single and lives with her parents in Cruce Jaén Antiguo, Olmos district, which is two hours away from the city of Chiclayo. The need to contribute to household expenses led her to set up a small grocery store where she offers seasonal fruit and sweets to her customers. The income she earns help her meet her personal needs and to contribute to family expenses. Socorro wishes to enlarge her business buying groceries and basic needs items (rice, sugar, cooking oil) since there are few stores of this type in the area where she resides. For this reason, she deemed it wise to ask for her first, 1800 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa, which will help her reach her goal. Socorro is an enterprising, hard-working and persevering young woman. Her greatest wish is to make her business grown and that it become better known in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es:
Daisy es socia del Banco Comunal Orcasitas II.
Daisy es soltera, tiene 28 años y 1 hijo, Daisy se dedica a la compra y venta de tara y cochinilla, productos que comercializa en la ciudad de Ayacucho,
Daisy necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tuna, cochinilla.
Los sueños de Daisy son construir su casa y que su hijo estudie.
texts.en:
Daisy is a member of the Orcasitas II Communal Bank. Daisy is single, 28 years old and has 1 child. Daisy makes her living buying and selling products of the tara tree (a tree native to Peru) and cochinilla (an insect found on the prickly pear cactus and used to make a red dye), which she sells in the city of Ayacucho. Daisy needs a loan of 900 PEN, which will be invested in the purchase of cactus fruit and cochinilla. Daisy hopes to build herself a house and that her child can go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of cactus fruit and cochinilla.

loans.name: Placida Claudia

texts.es:
Placida es socia del Banco Comunal Orcasitas II.
Placida es casada, tiene 58 años y 7 hijos, Placida junto a sus hijos se dedican a la fabricación D. ladrillos, además Placida se dedica a la compra y venta D. tuna, cochinilla y tara.
Placida necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en el pago D. personal.
Los sueños D. Placida son terminar D. construir su casa y que sus últimos hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Placida, 58, is a member of the Orcasitas II communal bank. Placida is married and has 7 children. Together with her children, Placida manufactures bricks. In addition, Placida sells tuna, cochineal and tara (eco tanning is obtained from the grinding of the tara pod, harvested from a bush with the botanical name Caesalpinea Spinosa. Tara is mainly grown in the higlands of Perú). Placida needs a 900 sol loan, which will be used to pay her employees. Placida's dream is to finish building her house and that her youngest children finish their schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay her employees.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es:
Dionisia es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces de Compañía. Las socias son de la comunidad de Compañía.
Dionisia es casada, tiene 68 años y solo 1 de sus hijos viven con ella, Dionisia se dedica a la compra y venta de cochinilla, tara. Además Dionisia se dedica a la agricultura de maíz, cebada.
Dionisia necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cochinilla y tara.
El sueño de Dionisia es mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Dionisia, 68, is a member of the Los Sauces de Compañía communal bank. The members are from Compañía. Dionisia is married; only one of her children still lives with her. She sells cochineal and tara (a pod used in eco tanning). In addition, Dionisia farms corn and barley. Dionisia needs 1250 soles to buy cochineal and tara. Dionisia's dream is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de cochinilla y tara. To buy cochineal and tara (eco tanning is obtained from the grinding of the tara pod, harvested from bush. Tara is mainly grown in the higlands of Perú)

loans.name: Leonor Del Carmen

texts.es: Leonor Del Carmen tiene 55 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de carne y de comida, es madre soltera con 2 hijos que mantener. Ella realiza sus ventas de manera ambulante ya que tiene que ofrecer sus productos todos los días en las calles con el fuerte sol, esto le entusiasma mucho pues siempre se preocupa por sus hijos es una persona muy trabajadora y capaz pues hasta los momentos les ha proporcionado a su familia lo necesario es así como ella ha logrado aprender a mejorar la administración de su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima necesaria en su negocio. ella sueña con aumentar su negocio cada día.
texts.en:
Leonor Del Carmen, 55, sells meat and prepared meals; she's a single mother with two children to support. She sells her products in the streets and has to work daily under the relentless sun. She is excited about her work because she is always concerned for her children; she is a hard-working, capable person who has been able to provide for her family to date. She has learned to run her business better. The requested financing will be used to buy raw materials that she needs. Her dream is to have her business grow every day.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and raw materials.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces de Compañía. Las socias son de la comunidad de Compañía.
Bertha es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 4 hijos, Berta se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo, sus ventas los realiza en la misma comunidad. Además Bertha tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Bertha necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tierra, arroz, azúcar.
Bertha sueña con que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Bertha, 29, is a member of the Los Sauces de Compañía communal bank. The members are from Compañía. Bertha lives with her life partner and their 4 children. Bertha manufactures bricks with her husband. Her sales are in her own community. In addition, Bertha has a small grocery store in her home. Bertha needs 1250 soles to buy soil, rice and sugar. Bertha's dream is that her children complete their schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soil, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces de Compañía. Las socias son de la comunidad de Compañía.
Adela es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Adela se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo, sus ventas los realiza en la misma comunidad. Además Adela se dedica a la compra y venta de tara, cochinilla.
Adela necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Los sueños de Adela es que sus hijos sean profesionales y que tengan negocios propios.
texts.en:
Adela, 40, is a member of the Los Sauces de Compañía communal bank. The members are from Compañía. Adela lives with her life partner and their 4 children. Adela, together with her husband, manufactures bricks, which she sells in her own community. In addition, Adela sells cochineal and tara (a powder ground from a pod that grows on a bush in the Peruvian highlands that is used in eco tanning). Adela needs a 750 sol loan to buy firewood. Adela dreams that her children become professionals and have their own businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Vicenta es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces de Compañía. Las socias son de la comunidad de Compañía.
Vicenta es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 1 hijo, Vicenta se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo, sus ventas los realiza en la misma comunidad. Vicenta tiene proyectado abrir una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Vicenta necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Los sueños de Vicenta son mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Vicenta, 29, is a member of the Los Sauces de Compañía communal bank. The members are from Compañía. Vicenta lives with her life partner and their son. Vicenta, together with her husband, manufactures bricks, which she sells to her own community. Vicenta plans to open a grocery store in her house in the future. Vicenta needs a 900 sol loan to buy firewood. Vicenta's dream is to improve her business and to provide her son with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo es socio del Banco Comunal Los Sauces de Compañía. Las socias son de la comunidad de Compañía.
Pablo es separada, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, Pablo se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos, actividad que realiza todos los días, sus ventas los realiza en la misma comunidad.
Pablo necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tierra.
Los sueños de Pablo son salir adelante y dar un negocio a cada uno de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Pablo, 42, is a member of the Los Sauces de Compañía communal bank. The members are from Compañía. Pablo is separated and has 4 children. Pablo makes bricks every day and sells them in his community. Pablo needs a 1250 sol loan to buy firewood. Pablo's dream is to get ahead in life and give a business to each of his children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soil.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.es:
Pelagia es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces de Compañía. Las socias son de la comunidad de Compañía.
Pelagia es casada, tiene 45 años y 5 hijos, Pelagia se dedica a la compra y venta de ladrillos, atiende pedidos y lleva el producto a obra a la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Pelagia vende leña al por mayor en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Pelagia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ladrillos.
Los sueños de Pelagia son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Pelagia, 45, is a member of the Los Sauces de Compañía communal bank. The members are from Compañía. Pelagia is married and has 5 children. She sells bricks. She fills orders and delivers them to construction sites in the city of Ayacucho. In addition, Pelagia sells firewood at wholesale to Ayacucho's markets. She needs a 900 sol loan to buy bricks. Pelagia's dream is that her children become professionals and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bricks.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces de Compañía. Las socias son de la comunidad de Compañía.
Elena es soltera, tiene 60 años y 3 hijos, Elena se dedica a la agricultura de verduras en terrenos propios y alquilados, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Elena necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abono y semilla.
Elena espera progresar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Elena, 60, is a member of the Los Sauces de Compañía communal bank, which is in Compañía. Elena is single and has three children. She farms vegetables on her own and on leased land. She sells her products to Ayacucho's wholesale food market. Elena needs a 900 sol loan to buy seed and natural fertilizer. Elena expects to progress with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural fertilizer and seed.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un padre de familia de 43 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y sus dos menores hijos en el sector Capote del distrito de Picsi, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de salir adelante a pesar de las limitaciones económicas de su familia, le llevó  a trabajar como obrero de construcción hace 20 años. Durante todo este tiempo esta actividad ha sido su principal fuente de sustento y le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia. Poco a poco se ha ido haciendo conocido en el medio y ahora su trabajo es valorado por la responsabilidad y eficacia con la que es realizado.

Adicionalmente trabaja en la agricultura, sembrando pequeñas áreas de cultivo que arrienda con mucho esfuerzo para sembrar arroz una vez por año. Miguel desea adquirir algunos equipos e instruentos que faciliten su trabajo de operario de construcción, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme  Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es una persona honorable y muy estimada por sus vecinos y conocidos. Su mayor anhelo es ofrecerle a su familia un futuro estable y prometedor.
texts.en:
Miguel, 43, is a father who lives with his wife and two minor children in the Capote neighborhood of Picsi district, which is 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. The need to get ahead despite his family's limited economic resources, led him to work as a laborer in construction 20 years ago. During all this time this activity has been his main source of support and has helped him to get his family ahead in life. Gradually, he has become well-known in the construction field and now his work is highly valued for the responsibility and efficiency that characterizes it. In addition, he farms on small plots of land, that he leases with much effort, in order to grow rice once a year. Miguel would like to acquire some tools and equipment that will facilitate his construction work. This has led him to seek his first, 1000 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa. He is an honorable person who is held in high esteem by his neighbors. His greatest wish is to offer his family a promising and stable future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction equipment and tools.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces de Compañía. Las socias son de la comunidad de Compañía.
Justina es conviviente, tiene 46 años y 7 hijos, Justina  se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo, sus ventas los realiza en la misma comunidad. 
Justina necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tierra.
El sueño de Justina es brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Justina, 46, is a member of the Los Sauces de Compañía communal bank. The members are from Compañía. Justina lives with her life partner and their 7 children. She manufactures bricks with her husband that she sells in her community. Justina needs a 900 sol loan to buy soil. Justina's dream is to provide her children a good education .

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soil.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces de Compañía. Las socias son de la comunidad de Compañía.
Juana es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Juana se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo, sus ventas los realiza en la misma comunidad, también llevan sus productos a las obras.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Los sueños de Juana son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y seguir trabajando para la comodidad de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juana, 30, is a member of the Los Sauces de Compañía communal bank. Its members are from Compañía. Juana lives with her life partner and their 2 children. Together with her husband, Juana manufactures bricks, which she sells in her own community and they also take to construction sites. Juana needs a 600 sol loan to buy firewood. Juana's dreams is that her children finish their schooling and to continue to work for her children's comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood.

loans.name: Maria Natalia

texts.es:
María tiene 44 años de edad, es separada y tiene 3 hijos menores a su cargo. Vive en el sector Fundo San Nicolás, ubicado en la ciudad de Lambayeque, a 20 minutos de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos la llevó a empezar a trabajar hace tres años como vendedora de comida en un pequeño restaurante ubicado dentro de un molino de arroz en las afueras de la ciudad. Allí ella ofrece diversos platos a los trabajadores y eventuales clientes que visitan el lugar. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingreso económico con la que cuenta por lo que día a día da o mejor de si para sacarlo adelante.

La demanda por los potajes que ofrece en su negocio ha hecho que María piense en ampliarlo con la preparación de nuevos platos que ofrecer a sus clientes, así como en la compra de bebidas, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra de insumos para comida y bebidas gaseosas.

María es una madre de familia responsable y trabajadora. De buena sazón y que gusta mucho de la cocina. Su más grande anhelo es llegar a otorgarle a sus hijos la oprtunidad de estudiar una carrera superior que les permita asegurarse un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
María, 44, is separated and has 3 minor children under her care. She lives in the Fundo San Nicolás sector, which is in the city of Lambayeque located 20 minutes from Chiclayo. Three years ago, needing to provide for her children, she started to work selling prepared meals in a small eatery located inside a rice mill in the city's outskirts. She offers her various dishes to mill employees and occasional customers that visit the mill. This is her only source of income so every day she gives her best in order to make it succeed. Demand for her dishes has caused María to consider enlarging her business preparing new dishes to offer her customers as well as selling beverages. For this reason, she is calling upon Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to request a 2000 new sol loan, which will be used to buy ingredients for her dishes and soft-drinks. María is a responsible and hard-working mother. Her dishes are very tasty and she enjoys cooking very much. Her greatest wish is to provide her children with the opportunity to study a professional career that will assure them better futures.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and beverages.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Alicia C. le está haciendo falta una losa de concreto al frente de su casa.
Desea mejorar su vivienda ya que es el patrimonio de su hijo, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder realizar la mejora, ya que en este momento no cuanta con el dinero necesario. 
Con el  ingreso que obtiene de su  empleo en una clínica en el aria de enfermera,  planea pagar el crédito, ya que su esposo el señor José Alonso Méndez se encargara de los gastos familiares con el sueldo que obtiene como empleado de un súper mercado, en el departamento de mercancía. 
Quieren que su pequeño hijo tenga lo mejor y que no le falte nada. La persona que aparece en la foto es el señor José Alonso Méndez esposo de la señora Alicia C. ya que ella se encontraba en su trabajo el día de la visita.
texts.en:
Alicia C.' house needs concrete paving stones in the front yard. She hopes to improve her home, which is her son's estate. She is requesting funding to carry out this improvement because she currently lacks sufficient funds to do so. She plans to repay the loan with her earnings as a nurse in a clinic. Her husband, José Alonso Méndez, who works in the stock department of a supermarket, is in charge of paying for family expenses with his salary. They want their young son to have the best and lack nothing. The person in the photo is José Alonso Méndez, Alicia C.' husband, because she was at work the day of the home visit.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy concrete paving stones.

loans.name: Petrose

texts.en:
Petrose T. is from the village of Bliss, Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old and is married. Petrose owns and operates a business offering tricycle transport services. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Petrose joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle in order to provide better service. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. Petrose plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her tricycle

texts.en: Mrs. Sam N. is 50 years old. She is duck breeder who can earn some money from selling duck eggs. This couple has seven children, two of whom are employed in the garment factory, while the others are enrolled in local public school. This family lives in Trapeang Khlout village in Takeo province. In this farming condition, they face a problem because they do not have enough money to support their rice field. Thus, Mrs. Sam N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticide, rice seed, and rest of the loan she would like to buy fuel to support their rice field to increase rice yield. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

Mrs. Srey Oun M. is 28 years old and is the mother of two children who are too small to study or work. She is a farmer who owns 1-hectare (2.5-acres) of land on which she cultivates rice to support her family living. Her husband, Mr. Bun Chhean Chhoen, is a tobacco seller.

In order to improve the conditions of her family living, Mrs. Srey Oun M. decided to ask for a loan to buy more tobacco for her husband to sell, which can generate high profits.

This family has a problem because their rice field is far from the irrigation system. Thus, Mrs. Chrorn P. decided to ask for a loan to dig a well and buy a machine to support their rice field. This couple has three children, two of whom are farmers and one is a laborer in the local village.

Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en:
Mr. Sambo O., 33, and his wife, Mrs. Kunthach Yorn (pictured together), 31, have just been married in 2009 and have no children yet.  

Sambo has been a construction worker for four years, while his wife has been selling fried meatballs and roasted beef in front of the garment factory since she was married. He wants to purchase a motorbike to drive as a motor taxi when he is free, but he does not have money. Hence, he is requesting his first loan of $1,000 in order to make the purchase.

He will be able to get extra income from the new business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Chengly

texts.en:
Mrs. Chengly M. (pictured with her grandson) and her husband, Mr. Son Tit, live along national road number one approximately 20 km from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1975 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Two of the children are married and live in separate homes, one drives a Tuk Tuk taxi and the other one is a garment factory worker.
 
Mrs. Chengly M. and her husband have been raising pigs for more than 30 years. They also created another business producing rice wine. Chengly  asked for a Kiva loan once already. Now she is asking for her second loan of $1,200 to purchase food for pigs and to continue her rice wine production business.

loans.use: To purchase food for her pigs

loans.name: Ren

texts.en:
Mr. Ren K., age 42, and his wife, Mrs. Savun Seak, age 42, live along National Road No. 1, about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1989 and have six children: four sons and two daughters. One works in a garment factor, three attend school and the other one is a construction worker.

Ren has been a carpenter for ten years. His wife stays at home and does the housework. Ren is applying for his first loan of $1,000 US to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

Her husband, Mr. Chan Chhorn, harvests and sells green grass. This family has a problem because the green grass field is far from their home. It is also through a lake, but they do not have the supplies to support this business. Thus, Mrs. Saphoan N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a boat and a machine to support selling green grass. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in local public school, and the other is too small to study or work. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a boat and a machine to support selling green grass

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en: Mrs. Phalla N. is a villager in Rung village in Takeo province. She is 27 years old. She is a farmer who owns two hectares of land used to grow rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Thoeun Toem, is a rice wine maker. This family has a problem because this is rice-growing season, but the soil is infertile and has lot of insects. They do not have enough money to support it. Thus, Mrs. Phalla N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and rice seeds and to hire laborers to plow her field. She is a mother of a child who is too young to study or work. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, rice seeds and labor to plow the field

Ranny has just stared growing mushrooms in her village. Her husband assists her in the business. Ranny hopes to expand her business, so she is asking for her first loan of US$500 for this purpose.

In order to improve the family’s living conditions, Srey Touch is requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell because it is now the high season for fish.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

She is also a silk weaver, and in order to sustain her weaving, she has decided to request a loan in order to buy more silk for this purpose.

loans.name: Uon

texts.en:
Mrs. Uon M. is 53 years old. She lives in Thkov village in Takeo province. She is a widow with a child who is a driver for a hotel.

Mrs. Uon M. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to support her family’s living.

The family has a problem because the workplace of her child is far from home. In order to support her child’s working, Mrs. Uon M. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for transportation.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transportation.

loans.name: Ali-Mat

texts.en:
Ali-mat V. is from the village of Poblacion 4 Clarin Misamis Occidental. Ali-mat is married. He He is 34 years old. is now working abroad and in the picture is his wife Aileen. Their "sari-sari” store is shown located behind his wife in the picture. The business of the “sari-sari” store involves buying and selling different products such as rice, sugar, salt, noodles, vinegar, shampoo, coffee, can goods, eggs, bar soap and powder for laundry, and other products in the local community. Ali-mat has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 20000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ali-mat joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ali-mat has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30000 PHP from GDMPC. Ali-mat is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Ali-mat from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Pol

texts.en: Mrs. Pol S. is a villager in Klaong Tvear village in Takeo province. She is 46 years old and she is a farmer. She owns a 1-hectare field on which to cultivate rice. This business supports her family. Her husband, Mr. Krat Rorng, is a duck breeder. He earns a small income by selling eggs. But although they try to work hard, they still earn less income than needed to support the family. In order to improve the family living conditions, Mrs. Pol S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks to expand this business. The rest of the loan will be used to buy duck food for breeding the ducks. She is a mother of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the others are enrolled in a local public school.

loans.use: To buy more ducks to expand this business and to buy duck food.
